To adapt to this change, the Communist Party of China further developed the "eight-character principle" that guides its relationship with the democratic parties into the "sixteen-character principle". Hu Yaobang pointed out at the 15th National United Front Work Conference in January 1982: Our comrades should "be friends with all non-party members, and develop from casual acquaintances to true friends, and then to a relationship of mutual trust, shared honor and disgrace"; "We should clearly state to all party comrades and also tell our non-party friends that in the new historical period, we must truly establish a relationship of mutual trust, shared honor and disgrace with our non-party friends." This is the first time that the Communist Party of China has proposed the eight characters of "mutual trust, shared honor and disgrace" in its united front work. In September of the same year, Hu Yaobang, in his report to the 12th Party Congress, for the first time, linked the eight characters "long-term coexistence, mutual supervision" with the eight characters "liver and gallbladder in harmony, sharing honor and disgrace", proposing that our party should continue to adhere to the policy of "long-term coexistence, mutual supervision, liver and gallbladder in harmony, sharing honor and disgrace, and strengthen cooperation with democratic parties, non-party democrats, ethnic minorities, and patriotic individuals in the religious circles". In November of the same year, Deng Xiaoping also emphasized the sixteen-character policy of "long-term coexistence, mutual supervision, liver and gallbladder in harmony, sharing honor and disgrace" in his speech at the opening ceremony of the Fifth Session of the Fifth National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, thus formally establishing the sixteen characters as the fundamental guiding policy for the relationship between the Communist Party of China and the democratic parties in the new era. The proposal of the sixteen-character policy is in line with the objective reality of reform and opening up and socialist modernization in the new era, and is conducive to the role of democratic parties and democrats, inspiring them to participate in the joint management of state affairs, strengthen long-term cooperation, and make the unity between the Communist Party of China and the democratic parties closer.
After the 12th National Congress of the Party, with the comprehensive launch of reform and opening up and the implementation of the policy of "one country, two systems", the united front further assumed the dual tasks of serving socialist modernization and completing the great cause of national reunification, with a wider range of targets and richer contents. In this situation, the 16th National United Front Work Conference held in late November to December 1986 put forward the idea of "two alliances", namely one is the alliance composed of all mainland workers and patriots with socialism as the political basis, and the other is the alliance consisting of compatriots in Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macao, and overseas Chinese with patriotism and support for national reunification as the political basis. These two alliances constitute not only the whole of the united front in the new era, but also an important new characteristic of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
Chapter 3: Strengthening the Party's Leadership in the Field of Ideology and Culture and Scientifically Evaluating Mao Zedong's Historical Position
I. Denouncing the class struggle as the guiding principle and reaffirming the Four Cardinal Principles
After the Great Debate on the Criteria of Truth, especially after the Central Work Conference and the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, the mistakes of the "two whatevers" were seriously criticized, and the party's ideological line of seeking truth from facts was re-established. However, the differences of opinions and debates within the party over the ideological line have not been completely eliminated. Not only that, at the same time, two types of erroneous tendencies have emerged within the party and society. One type is those who are still influenced by the "left" mistakes, who remain in a rigid and semi-rigid state, skeptical of the line and policies of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, and even have a resistance. The other type is the appearance of a tendency to negate socialism and the leadership of the party among a certain number of people. In order to ensure the implementation of the shift of the party's work focus, and to smoothly advance the cause of modernization under the new situation, the central authorities explicitly put forward the requirement to adhere to the Four Cardinal Principles.
1. The introduction of the political foundation of modernization construction in the new era
In the climax of ideological liberation, China entered 1979. On the first day of the new year, Deng Xiaoping, at the symposium held by the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, highly praised the new political situation and social atmosphere, and for the first time raised the issue of the political foundation of modernization construction.
Deng Xiaoping said that Chairman Mao's dynamic and vivid political situation, which has both centralization and democracy, discipline and freedom, unified will and personal joy and liveliness, which he proposed in 1957, gradually formed last year. This atmosphere and situation can be summarized as a lively and vivid political atmosphere. We must develop and uphold this atmosphere and situation throughout the country, in the party, the government, the military, and the people. This is the political foundation for achieving the four modernizations. Without such a political situation, the four modernizations cannot be achieved. For quite a long time in the past, we did not handle well the relationship between democracy and centralization, and lacked some democracy, therefore, we should promote democracy even more.
Deng Xiaoping's speech represents the spirit of the central authorities and is the consensus of the collective leadership of the Party Central Committee. On January 2nd, when Hu Yaobang reported on the national political ideology to Hua Guofeng, Hua Guofeng also emphasized the firm commitment to improving the democratic life of our party and country. This is a political policy determined by the Third Plenary Session, and it is resolute. It is necessary to guide party members and cadres well. Party committees at all levels and newspapers should guide the healthy and orderly development of our democratic life, and avoid going astray. 
After experiencing a major change, especially for China, which has just gone through the "Cultural Revolution" and is emerging from the shadow of the "Two Whatevers," re-examining and establishing the political foundation of China's modernization construction is of great significance to the entire historical turning point. Therefore, as soon as the issue of the political foundation is raised, it immediately arouses extensive social repercussions. The main media such as People's Daily and Liberation Army Daily consecutively published editorials, signed articles, and investigative reports, further elaborating on the political foundation of modernization construction. In less than a month, People's Daily published articles such as "People's Representatives Must Be Elected by the People," "Democracy and the Rule of Law are the Political Ensures of Achieving the Four Modernizations," "Promote Democracy and Achieve the Four Modernizations," "There Must Be a Sound Democratic Life Within the Party," and "Proletarian Democracy and Proletarian Dictatorship," emphasizing that "the realization of socialist modernization cannot be separated from the extensive development of socialist democracy. The four modernizations must be accompanied by political democratization," and calling for "the kind of democratic style as required by the Third Plenary Session to be expanded to the whole party, the entire army, and people of all ethnic groups in the country."
It is in such a social atmosphere that the preparation work for the theoretical conference on abstract work began.
The proposal for the theoretical conference on abstract work was initially proposed by Ye Jianying. As for the specific time when this proposal was made, there is no record in the authoritative biography of Ye Jianying's activities, "Biography of Ye Jianying". However, Hu Yaobang's speech at the theoretical conference on abstract work and "Chronology of Deng Xiaoping" provide important evidence.
Hu Yaobang pointed out in the "Introduction to the Theoretical Conference on Abstract Work" that in May of last year, an important development on the ideological and theoretical front was the beginning of discussions on the practice as the sole criterion for testing truth, which caused a stir on our country's ideological and theoretical front. In September of last year, an article titled "Reviewing 'On Practice' - The Practice Standard is the Foundation of Marxist Epistemology" was written by the editorial office of Red Flag magazine and sent to the Central Committee. Comrade Ye Jianying proposed that the central government convene a theoretical conference on abstract work, so that everyone could put their differing opinions on the table, and through full democratic discussion, achieve unified understanding and resolve this issue.
On October 14, 1978, during a conversation with Wei Guoqing, Deng Xiaoping also mentioned, "Comrade Ye Jianying proposed the convening of a theoretical conference on abstract work. It's better to openly discuss it instead of talking behind the scenes."
Subsequently, in his speech at the closing ceremony of the Central Work Conference, Hua Guofeng officially proposed, "During this meeting, comrades have brought up many situations and raised many questions regarding the issue of 'practice as the sole criterion for testing truth.' Many comrades have received criticism. This has created favorable conditions for convening a theoretical conference on abstract work. Due to the multiple agenda items and limited time of this Central Work Conference, it is not possible to spend much time resolving this issue. The opinions of the members of the Politburo of the Central Committee still align with Comrade Ye Jianying's proposal to convene a theoretical conference on abstract work specifically after the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, in order to further resolve this issue well."
The preparation work for the theoretical conference on abstract work was presided over by Hu Yaobang.
On January 7, 1979, Hu Yaobang sent a letter to the members of the Politburo of the Central Committee, submitting for review the drafted "Introduction" and conference notice that will serve as the opening remarks of the theoretical conference on abstract work. The letter stated, "I have preliminary considered the format for the theoretical conference on abstract work: first, invite around two hundred theoretical workers in the capital, hold the conference in late January or early February, for approximately twenty days. Then take a few days to rest and report to the Central Committee." Please invite around 200 theoretical workers from various places, totaling about 400 people, and have the conference last for around 10 days. The first session of the conference will mainly involve discussions, group discussions, and speeches, allowing everyone to freely express their thoughts. In the second session, we would like Comrade Guofeng, Comrade Jianying, and Comrade Xiaoping to give speeches, guiding everyone in discussing and resolving important issues that need to be addressed urgently in the ideological and theoretical front. We will first have democracy, then centralization, in order to unify our thinking and improve the theoretical work after the shift of the Party's work focus.
After Hu Yaobang's "Introduction to the Virtual Conference on Theoretical Work" draft and letter were sent out, they quickly received the approval response from the members of the Central Politburo Standing Committee. Hu Guofeng expressed his agreement first.
On January 9th, Hu Yaobang chaired a meeting of the Ministry of Propaganda to officially determine the specific agenda for the virtual conference on theoretical work: (1) Conference start date: January 18th. (2) Conference venue: Friendship Hotel, Jingu West Hotel. (3) The conference will be divided into two sessions: The first session will last for 20 days (around 10 days before and after the Spring Festival), with 200 delegates participating, mainly consisting of those in Beijing, with one representative from each province, municipality, and autonomous region, focusing on group meetings. The second session will last for 10 days, with 400 delegates (200 from Beijing and 200 from local areas) participating, mainly held in the name of the CPC Central Committee, inviting the Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Central Committee to give speeches, with the conference as the main focus. There will be a one-week break between the two sessions. (4) Members of the leadership group for the virtual conference on theoretical work: Hu Yaobang, Hu Qiaomu, Huang Zhen, Zhu Muzhi, Hu Jiwei, Yu Guangyuan, Zhou Yang, Tong Dalin, Wu Lengxi, Wu Jiang, Hu Sheng. (5) Members of the drafting group for conference documents: Hu Yaobang, Hu Qiaomu, Yu Guangyuan, Wu Jiang, Ruan Ming, Lin Jianqing, Li Honglin.
Although later on, the conference not only exceeded the original plan in terms of time but also made adjustments to procedures and content, with the careful preparation of Hu Yaobang, the virtual conference on theoretical work officially began on January 18th.
2. The convening of the virtual conference on theoretical work
Hu Yaobang presided over the opening ceremony of the conference. At the beginning of the conference, he first announced the list of members of the conference leadership group and the list of conveners of the five groups.
The conveners of each group will serve as the leaders and deputy leaders of the respective groups. In addition, 20 specially invited attendees, all of whom are veteran comrades, were notified that they could freely participate and receive documents and briefings to accommodate their physical condition and work.
During the opening session, Hu Yaobang delivered a speech, the main content of which was the same as the "Introduction to the Virtual Conference on Theoretical Work."
In his speech, Hu Yaobang highly praised the achievements made in the ideological and theoretical field since 1977, believing that in terms of scale, the role it played in the struggle, and its contribution to the improvement of the Party's theoretical level, the past two years' work has surpassed any period since the establishment of the People's Republic of China. He praised the theoretical workers as the vanguard soldiers of the ideological and theoretical front. The emergence of a group of outstanding pioneers has strengthened the power of our Marxist theoretical team and is a remarkable achievement. He said that it is rare in history for theoretical work to become a truly mass activity like it is today. If we look at the world, there are not many nations like the Chinese people who care about theoretical issues and have such an interest in theory. This is a valuable national spirit.
In order to adapt the theoretical propaganda work to the shifting focus of the Party and the country, Hu Yaobang proposed a general guiding principle in his speech. He said that after the shift in the party's work focus, the fundamental task of theoretical propaganda work can be summarized in a few sentences: combining the universal truth of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought with the great practice of realizing the Four Modernizations, studying new problems, solving new problems, making our ideological and theoretical work as advanced as possible in practical work, continuously enriching and developing Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought in practice, and guiding us to achieve victory in a new long march.
The conference was divided into groups starting from the second day. On January 22nd, Hu Yaobang conveyed several points of views from Deng Xiaoping regarding the theoretical work forum. Deng Xiaoping emphasized the need for open-minded discussions. There can be more discussions on the standards of truth, and they should be done quickly. Many theoretical problems have not been clarified yet, such as democracy, rule of law, and economic management issues. The "Cultural Revolution" can also be discussed. The issue of "continuing the revolution under the dictatorship of the proletariat" can also be explored. In the future, there should be no mention of "holding high the banner of Chairman Mao," instead, the banner of Mao Zedong Thought should be raised. Based on Deng Xiaoping's instructions and the preliminary discussions of each conference group, Hu Yaobang once again gave a speech, summarizing several major issues for in-depth study by the conference. These issues include: how to deepen the discussion on the standards of truth; how the class struggle during the socialist period came about as the party's basic theory; the experience and lessons of theoretical work since the founding of the New China; the evaluation of the "Cultural Revolution," its nature, requirements, and lessons; the issue of socialist democracy; highlighting the propaganda of individual problems, and so on.
Subsequently, the conference discussions became more lively. The speeches from each group were sent to the conference secretariat, which distributed detailed briefings to each participant. Therefore, the exchange of information was timely. A total of 262 briefings were issued during this phase. Although Hu Yaobang explicitly requested that the conference materials and discussion content should not be spread outside, the distribution of briefings was relatively extensive, reaching many readers, and thus the influence of the conference quickly spread in society.
Almost simultaneously with the convening of the Central Conference on Theoretical Work, provinces and cities such as Shandong, Shanghai, Fujian, Guangdong, Liaoning, Hunan, and Jiangsu also held similar conferences before the Spring Festival. The number of participants generally ranged from fifty to sixty, reaching three hundred in Shanghai.
The first phase of the Conference on Theoretical Work ended in mid-February 1979, and the second phase began in late March. In addition to the personnel from the original central units, comrades from various provinces and cities (mainly Party committee secretaries and propaganda ministers responsible for ideological propaganda work) were invited according to the plan, with a total of four to five hundred people. The Conference on Theoretical Work continued until April 3rd.
From the progress of the first phase of the conference, the Conference on Theoretical Work upheld the democratic atmosphere restored at the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, adhered to the principles and directions of emancipating the mind, not only continued to sharply criticize the mistaken guiding ideology of the "Two Whatevers," but also challenged so-called "taboo areas". Many important theoretical issues were deeply discussed, such as the formulation of certain terms related to class struggle during the socialist period, the theory of continuing the revolution under the dictatorship of the proletariat, whether the internal struggle of the party reflects class struggles, at what stage China's socialism is in, the opposition to superstitious beliefs, socialist democracy, economic theory and practical issues, etc. Multiple aspects were reasoned and provided decision-making references for the central leadership, many of which were valuable. Many issues raised at the conference were gradually resolved through research and practice, playing a role in promoting the formation and development of the theory and cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
However, at this conference, due to the lack of a comprehensive analysis of the situation after the Third Plenum of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Party and the lack of systematic analysis and research on the rapidly changing ideological situation, there was insufficient preparation and some representatives' speeches showed obvious erroneous tendencies and ambiguous understanding. And this situation is intertwined with the complex social environment, which poses new challenges to the new situation of socialist construction being developed.
3. The presentation of social instability factors under the new situation
Before the theoretical work virtual meeting was held, some places had sparked some social contradictions due to many problems left over from the "Cultural Revolution". Some people took the opportunity to cause trouble and put forward various demands that were impossible to achieve or fundamentally unreasonable under the current conditions. They incited the masses to attack party and government organs, occupy offices, engage in sit-ins and hunger strikes, and block transportation. Particularly serious was the emergence of ideological trends that doubted or even denied the leadership of the Communist Party, the socialist system, proletarian dictatorship, and Mao Zedong Thought. The "Xidan Democracy Wall," which began to form in late October 1978, became the main battleground for these propaganda and activities at that time.
On January 6, 1979, Ren Haiting and seven others posted a printed flyer titled "Declaration of Chinese Human Rights," announcing the establishment of the so-called "Chinese Human Rights Alliance" and putting forward 12 principles. They handed it to foreign journalists, claiming that "this alliance requests support from human rights organizations and the public from all countries in the world" and requested that the US President "pay attention" to human rights in China.
A female worker in Beijing organized a "Citizen Petitioning Group" with some petitioners' support. They marched and demonstrated on Tiananmen Square under banners saying "Against Hunger, Against Persecution, We Demand Human Rights and Democracy," and petitioned at the gate of Xinhua Gate. Thousands of onlookers caused severe traffic congestion. On January 18, the Beijing authorities detained this female worker. The "Chinese Human Rights Alliance" and seven other organizations along with the printed publication called the "Joint Declaration" planned to hold a mass accusation meeting at the Xidan Democracy Wall and later petitioned in Zhongnanhai.
At the same time as the Xidan Democracy Wall became active, some grassroots organizations and publications also emerged. Wei Jingsheng and his publication "Explore" began to attract attention at this time.
Wei Jingsheng was a worker at the Beijing Park Services Management Office and the editor-in-chief of the printed publication "Explore." From December 1978 to March 1979, he continuously wrote articles and distributed publications, accusing Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought of being "a more sophisticated ointment than quack medicines." He slandered the national system of proletarian dictatorship as "a feudal monarchy wearing a socialist coat" and incited the masses to "no longer trust the 'stability and unity' of the dictator," and to "focus their anger on the evil system that creates the miserable fate of the people," and incited them to "seize power from these lords." Some of his articles were posted on the Xidan Wall, and some were published in "Explore." This publication was widely posted, distributed, and sold in Beijing and Tianjin.
In addition, there were eight workers in Guiyang who initiated the establishment of the "Enlightenment Society," with the headquarters in Guiyang and a branch in Beijing, with a membership of over 30 people. They advocated the "democracy," "freedom," and "human rights" of the capitalist world. In March 1979, the main leaders of the "Enlightenment Society" established the "Thaw Society" in Beijing, announcing their intention to "cancel class struggle, violent revolution, and all forms of dictatorship."
Similar organizations and publications also appeared in Guangzhou, Wuhan, Shanghai, and other places.
There are different understandings and judgments within the party and the theoretical community regarding how to understand and judge these new situations in the ideological and theoretical circles. Some people sympathize with or even support these new social trends and issues.
During the theoretical work virtual meeting, some suggested that "the central government should express its support for the Democracy Wall." Some said, "Even under socialist conditions, democracy is achieved by the people's own struggle, by breaking the resistance of bureaucrats and opportunists, and by breaking the suppression of excessive concentration of power and bureaucratic centralism in order to achieve it. "Democracy cannot rely on anyone's favor." "The main problem now is that democracy is not sufficiently promoted, not too much. We should not correct it." Some people also say, "What we need to be cautious about now is not excessive liberation of thought or democracy, and definitely not a new anti-rightist movement. We have not criticized the 'left' enough yet. If we propose an anti-rightist movement, it will hinder the criticism of the 'left' and affect ideological liberation, even possibly going backwards. The so-called 'right' should not be treated as a dangerous tendency, and as for individual exceptional cases, we can guide them through practical work. We should maintain clarity in our thinking about such problems, but there is no need to openly oppose it as a tendency in theoretical propaganda." Some individuals suggested a column titled "Democracy Wall" be established in newspapers to publish big-character posters. Others mentioned that Mao Zedong's ideology should also be evaluated with a critical eye and that it contains certain errors. Some people believe that "without Chairman Mao, there would be no New China" and "it wouldn't be excessive to evaluate Chairman Mao's achievements," but these statements go too far. These discussions and debates clearly indicate that there have been deviations in the theoretical work in dealing with new situations and problems.
4. A preliminary response to new erroneous tendencies
The various new situations that have emerged domestically and internationally, particularly the discussions and debates in the party's theoretical work, have raised Deng Xiaoping's high vigilance. He keenly sensed the seriousness of the problem and thus, starting from March 1979, he delivered multiple speeches, stating clearly the necessity of upholding the Four Cardinal Principles.
On March 16, 1979, at the meeting held by the CPC Central Committee on the situation of the counterattack in self-defense against Vietnam, Deng Xiaoping explicitly pointed out the need to uphold Chairman Mao's great banner. He said that negating Chairman Mao is negating the People's Republic of China, negating the entire history of the Party. Without Chairman Mao, there would be no New China. This is history. It means that without Mao Zedong's ideology guiding us to achieve revolutionary victory, we might still be struggling in the dark. When writing articles, we must be careful to uphold Chairman Mao's great banner and not harm it in any way. Both domestic and foreign class enemies hope that we will be confused on these major issues. We must tell party members and the people not to be misled. The key now is stability and unity. We address outstanding problems in order to concentrate our efforts on moving forward. He sternly pointed out the excessive actions taken by some educated youth demanding resettlement, saying that we should ask them, what will be the result if they cause unrest and attack government agencies? Haven't we learned from past lessons? If everything collapses, what hope is there for achieving the Four Modernizations? What hope is there for stability and unity? If all leadership agencies focus their energy on dealing with these matters, then there will be no energy left for achieving the Four Modernizations, improving people's lives, or developing the national economy. We must consider issues both in their local and overall context, both in the short term and long term. These problems should be used to educate the entire nation. He said that some people in China admire foreign human rights movements, why don't we organize counter-arguments? Some people write letters to support Carter's human rights, but isn't imperialism also violating human rights? How many people has imperialism killed? Imperialism helped Chiang Kai-shek kill many people in China. Imperialism has no qualification to talk about human rights. Why don't we use these living facts to educate the people? He sternly emphasized that it is completely correct to arrest the troublemakers who incite riots according to the law. Deng Xiaoping's speech first sounded the alarm for senior Party cadres and then transmitted to county and grassroots-level cadres, expressing the central government's stance.
On March 27, Deng Xiaoping discussed with Hu Yaobang, Hu Qiaomu, and others some of the main points and ideas he planned to emphasize at the party's theoretical work conference. He said, "We must adhere to four things: adhering to the socialist path, adhering to proletarian dictatorship, adhering to the Party's leadership, and adhering to the fundamental principles of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought. It is time to discuss these now..."
Deng Xiaoping said, ultimately, is socialist public ownership better or capitalist private ownership? As long as we do our work well, follow economic laws in our construction efforts, socialist public ownership will definitely be better than capitalist private ownership, and socialism will be better than capitalism. When talking about the leadership of the party, we should talk about history. Without the Communist Party, there would be no new China, and without the Communist Party, there would be no socialism. Every difficulty we have encountered has been overcome under the leadership of the party. We must speak about Chairman Mao. The evaluation of Chairman Mao is not prominent enough in the current draft; it lacks weight. Without the October Revolution and the acceptance of Marxism-Leninism, there would be no Communist Party of China and no new China. All of these are inseparable from Chairman Mao. It was Chairman Mao who put forward the theory of the division of three worlds, which freed us from international isolation. Proletarian dictatorship is necessary. We need to talk about the real conditions internationally and domestically, and we also need to prevent the restoration of capitalism.
Deng Xiaoping said: the issues of democracy and the rule of law need to be discussed. We need to talk about the relationship between democracy and centralization, the relationship between immediate interests and long-term interests, and the relationship between personal interests and national interests. When talking about democracy, we should analyze the activities of several illegal organizations to explain what socialist democracy is. The conclusion is: can we not adhere to the four principles? Can we not take a serious approach to dealing with bad people in society? This kind of argument may be more powerful and targeted. Too much vague language diminishes the emphasis and lacks persuasiveness and mobilizing power. We need to mobilize the masses to fight against these bad people. He also pointed out that democracy is democracy under highly centralized guidance, and centralization is centralized power based on high democracy. To promote democracy, we need to fully utilize the wisdom of the people and mobilize their enthusiasm. Only on the basis of democracy can we solve bureaucratism and the will of officials. However, without highly centralized power based on democracy, this cannot be achieved. When talking about the leadership of the party, it is emphasized that unified leadership and authority are necessary. Without the unified leadership of the party, there will be no efficiency. With the unified leadership of the party, as long as this leadership is correct, our adjustments will be fast, and the speed of construction will be fast. Without unity, no accomplishments can be made. Lenin stressed the importance of centralization and unity, and the importance of discipline. Our revolutionary war was also won under highly centralized and highly disciplined conditions.
Deng Xiaoping sternly pointed out that the Democracy Wall actually had an agenda. Those who use and promote democracy, use the Democracy Wall to engage in harmful activities, sell intelligence, and make foreign accusations should be banned. The few bad people should be separated from the masses. We need to mobilize the masses to fight against these bad people. Without stopping the troublemakers and opposing these bad people, there is no hope for the Four Modernizations. Most people are against the disruptive activities and absurd ideas of some illegal organizations in Shanghai and Beijing. They are advocating the same ideology as Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". These people are afraid of peace and stability. We must tell people, especially the youth, not to be deceived by them. Their essence, ideology, organizational purpose are aimed at socialism, proletarian dictatorship, the Communist Party, and Marxist-Leninist-Mao Zedong Thought.
In this speech, Deng Xiaoping also criticized the problems in the theoretical field. He said that the ideological and theoretical front cannot be said to have truly shifted the focus of work at present. There is a tendency to be obsessed with settling old accounts. There is less propaganda about the spirit of the Third Plenary Session, and there have been some statements that seem contradictory or even extreme. This is not good, it is not conducive to unity and progress, it is not conducive to mobilizing the enthusiasm of the people, and it is not conducive to wholeheartedly pursuing the Four Modernizations. Why not promote the good traditions of the Party? Traditional education includes discipline, diligence, and consideration of the overall situation. Theory should serve politics. The biggest political task in the country now is unity and progress, wholeheartedly striving for the Four Modernizations. We will encounter many difficulties in achieving the Four Modernizations, and the masses need to be prepared. Many new problems require theoretical research and answers, but we currently lack such theorists.
5. The formal proposal of the Four Cardinal Principles
On March 30th, on the third day after the resumption of the theoretical work meeting, Deng Xiaoping delivered a famous speech entitled "Adhering to the Four Cardinal Principles" on behalf of the CPC Central Committee at the Great Hall of the People.
This speech is highly targeted, but it does not discuss specific issues. Instead, it profoundly expounds on the unique political foundation and connotation of China's modernization construction.
Deng Xiaoping proposed adhering to the Four Cardinal Principles as a basic condition for achieving the Four Modernizations, and explicitly emphasized that the "Four Cardinal Principles" is one of the basic connotations of the newly proposed "Chinese-style Four Modernizations".
Deng Xiaoping pointed out that in the past, during the democratic revolution, we needed to fit the Chinese situation and follow the path of surrounding the cities from the countryside pioneered by Comrade Mao Zedong. Now, in construction, we also need to fit the Chinese situation and embark on a Chinese-style path of modernization.
To achieve the Four Modernizations in China, at least two important characteristics must be recognized:
One is a weak foundation. The long-term destruction by imperialism, feudalism, and bureaucratic capitalism has made China a poor and backward country. After the establishment of New China, we have made great achievements in economic construction. We have established a relatively complete industrial system and cultivated a group of technical talents. The average annual growth rate of our country's industry and agriculture from liberation until last year is relatively high compared to the world. However, due to the weak foundation, China is still one of the poorest countries in the world. China's scientific and technological strength is inadequate, and the overall level of science and technology is lagging behind advanced countries in the world by twenty to thirty years. In the past thirty years, our economy has experienced ups and downs, especially the great damage caused by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" from 1966 to 1976, which has had extremely serious consequences. Now we need to make adjustments in order to further eliminate these severe consequences.
Another issue is the large population and limited arable land. Currently, the national population is over 900 million, of which 80% are farmers. Having a large population has both advantages and disadvantages. Under the condition of insufficient development of production, issues such as food, education, and employment have become serious problems. We must vigorously strengthen family planning work, but even if the population stops increasing in a few years, the problem of a large population will still exist for some time. China has vast territory and abundant resources, but many resources have not been properly explored, extracted, and utilized, so they are not yet productive assets. Although the land area is vast, the arable land is scarce. It is not easy to change this situation, especially when there is a large population, particularly farmers. This has become a characteristic that must be considered in China's modernization.
Chinese-style modernization must start from the characteristics of China. For example, modern production requires fewer people, but with our large population, how can we balance both aspects? Without comprehensive consideration, we will face a long-term problem of insufficient employment in society. There are many issues here that require the joint research and practical work of all Party comrades in theoretical work. We will surely be able to find appropriate solutions.
Then, Deng Xiaoping turns the conversation around and points out that the central government believes that in order to achieve the Four Modernizations in China, we must adhere to four basic principles in ideology and politics. This is the fundamental prerequisite for achieving the Four Modernizations. The four principles are as follows: first, we must adhere to the socialist path; second, we must adhere to the dictatorship of the proletariat; third, we must adhere to the leadership of the Communist Party; fourth, we must adhere to Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought.
Deng Xiaoping said, as we all know, these four basic principles are not new things. They are principles that our Party has consistently adhered to for a long time. Since the overthrow of the "Gang of Four" and the Third Plenary Session of the Party Central Committee, the series of policies and guidelines implemented by the Party Central Committee have always adhered to these four basic principles.
In practice and theory, we have criticized the false socialism advocated by the "Gang of Four", which appeared in the form of extreme leftism and widespread poverty. We have adhered to the principles of socialist public ownership and distribution according to work. We insist on self-reliance as the primary approach, seeking foreign assistance as a secondary measure, and learning and introducing advanced foreign technology to develop our socialist economy. We strive to act in accordance with objective economic laws. In other words, we adhere to scientific socialism.
We smashed the feudal fascist ideology of the "Gang of Four", rectified numerous injustices, resolved a series of historical problems, consolidated proletarian dictatorship, restored and promoted socialist democracy, especially after the Third Plenary Session, a lively political situation emerged that Comrade Mao Zedong had long hoped to achieve.
We restored the three major styles of the Party that had been destroyed, improved the Party's democratic centralism, strengthened the unity of the entire Party and the unity between the Party and the masses, thereby greatly enhancing the Party's prestige and strengthening its leadership over the country and social life.
We have eliminated the mental shackles created by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four", insisting that leaders are humans, not gods; we insist on mastering the scientific system of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought correctly and accurately; we insist on starting from reality and seeking truth from facts. This has restored the true nature of Mao Zedong Thought and upheld the esteemed status that Comrade Mao Zedong, as a great revolutionary, should enjoy in the history of the Chinese revolution and world revolution.
Deng Xiaoping clearly pointed out that, despite this, the central leadership believes that it is still necessary to emphasize the promotion of these four fundamental principles today. On the one hand, there are some comrades within the Party who are still deeply influenced by the ultra-leftist ideology of Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". A few individuals even spread rumors and attacked the series of policies implemented by the central leadership since the defeat of the "Gang of Four", especially since the Third Plenary Session, claiming that they are contrary to Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought. On the other hand, there are a few individuals in society who are spreading doubts or opposing these four fundamental principles. And within the Party, some comrades not only fail to recognize the danger of this trend but even provide certain degrees of support, directly or indirectly. Although these groups of people are a small minority within and outside the Party, we cannot ignore their influence just because they are a small minority. The fact is that they have not only harmed our cause but also caused significant damage. Therefore, on the one hand, we must continue to resolutely eliminate the poisonous influence of the "Gang of Four" and help some comrades who are still affected by their poison to awaken, while giving a strong blow to the reactionary statements slandering the central leadership made by a few individuals. On the other hand, we must make tremendous efforts to fight against the trend that doubts the aforementioned four fundamental principles. Both of these trends violate Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought and hinder the progress of our socialist modernization.
Continuing on, Deng Xiaoping specifically refutes the trend that doubts or opposes the four fundamental principles from the right, expressing clear and profound viewpoints that are highly convincing.
In the conclusion, Deng Xiaoping particularly emphasizes that the central leadership believes that it is necessary to repeatedly stress the adherence to these four fundamental principles today because certain individuals (even if they are only a small minority) attempt to shake these principles. This is absolutely not permissible. Every communist, let alone every ideological and theoretical worker of the Party, must not have the slightest wavering on this fundamental standpoint. If any one of these four fundamental principles is shaken, then the entire socialist cause and the entire endeavor of modernization will be undermined.
In a historical turning point when the Party and the country were rectifying chaos and shifting the focus of work to socialist modernization, Deng Xiaoping, on behalf of the Party Central Committee, first clearly and comprehensively put forward the four fundamental principles and provided a profound and systematic exposition. Its significance is far-reaching and of great importance. Since then, the four fundamental principles have become an important theme in our country's political life, serving as the foundation for the formulation of various policies by our Party, and have continuously been enriched and improved with the development of practice. In 1982, the Four Cardinal Principles were officially incorporated into the Party Charter and Constitution, becoming the common will of the entire Party and the people of the country. The 13th National Congress of the Party regarded adhering to the Four Cardinal Principles as a basic point of the Party's basic line in the primary stage of socialism. The 14th National Congress listed it as the "foundation of the nation" and as a basic content of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. The 15th National Congress established Deng Xiaoping Theory as the Party's guiding ideology and highly reiterated the Four Cardinal Principles as an organic component of Deng Xiaoping Theory. The Four Cardinal Principles summarize the long-term historical experience of our Party and country and serve as the common political foundation for the unity and struggle of the entire Party and the people of the country.
II. The "make-up class" for the discussion on the standard of truth
After the theoretical work conference, the wave of opposition to the Four Cardinal Principles from the right was quickly repelled. However, the long-standing state of ideological stagnation or semi-stagnation was difficult to overcome in the short term, and the "left" ideological tendency remained quite serious and became the main obstacle to rectification.
1. The proposal to discuss the problem of the standard of truth
Since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, the promotion of democracy and the liberation of thought have just "started", but some people think that it has already "gone too far". Some people wrongly attributed the chaos that occurred in society at one time to the Third Plenary Session, believing that these chaotic phenomena were caused by the promotion of democracy and the liberation of thought. Some people have also set the Four Cardinal Principles against the line of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, believing that the Four Cardinal Principles are a "correction" to the Third Plenary Session. The various incorrect views that exist in the thinking of cadres indicate that the continued liberation of thought and the overcoming of the state of ideological stagnation are still a major long-term task of the ideological and theoretical front. At the same time, the above situation also indicates that the discussion on the problem of the standard of truth conducted before the Third Plenary Session has not been earnestly carried out in some regions and units, and has not deeply penetrated people's hearts, so a part of the people are still in a state of ideological stagnation and still start from the "textbook" in everything. Therefore, it is still very important and urgent to continue to carry out in-depth discussions on the problem of the standard of truth, further rectify the ideological line of the whole Party. In this context, various regions, while implementing the 11th Central Committee's Third Plenary Session's line and disseminating the spirit of the theoretical work conference, have proposed the issue of conducting a "make-up class" for the discussion on the problem of the standard of truth.
On May 21, 1979, the Liberation Army Daily published a commentator article titled "Unswervingly Continue to Implement the Spirit of the Third Plenary Session", which pointed out some ideological and understanding problems that occurred during the implementation of the spirit of the Third Plenary Session. The article stated that the discussion on the problem of the standard of truth, which is the only criterion for testing truth, played a good role in promoting the liberation of thought, but this discussion did not take place in many units of the army. Why do we need to discuss the problem of the standard of truth? Why can't the criterion for testing truth be something other than practice? Why do we need to liberate thought and put the machinery in motion? If the thought is stagnant and starts from the "textbook", the vitality of the Party, the country, and the nation will come to a halt! Many comrades in our army have not understood it well. The article proposed, "Comrades in our army should make up for this lesson and re-study the documents of the Third Plenary Session." The article used the term "make-up class" and clearly put forward the requirement to "make up" for the discussion on the problem of the standard of truth. This was the earliest and most explicit proposal to conduct a "make-up class" for the discussion on the problem of the standard of truth.
On May 22, 19
2. 

In mid-May, Feng Wenbin, Vice President of the Central Party School, pointed out in his report to all students that the main obstacle to implementing the policies of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee is the problem of ideological rigidity among some cadres. He said, "Currently, the education on distinguishing between the two ideological lines is not widespread and not deep enough in many places. Some comrades say, 'The overall situation of ideological liberation is that the central government has taken the lead, some places have made some progress, but many places have not started yet.' Therefore, it is necessary to continue propagating the ideological line of dialectical materialism, liberating from the spiritual shackles of Lin Biao and the Gang of Four, and daring to think about new problems, propose new problems, and solve new problems in the new Long March."
In mid-May, the main leaders of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Sichuan Provincial Committee stated in their speech at the Second Plenary Session of the Provincial Committee that from the ideological condition of the party, especially the senior cadres, it is relatively easy to unify thinking on adhering to the four basic principles, but it is still a major problem to continue to liberate thinking, especially to integrate Marxist-Leninist and Mao Zedong Thought with the reality of the four modernizations, study new situations, and solve new problems. He said that the situation of ideological rigidity and semi-rigidity still exists within the party, and there are still some comrades who have lingering concerns that have not been resolved. It will take a long time and a great effort to resolve them. Therefore, he proposed that we should further study, propagate, and implement the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee and integrate adherence to the four basic principles with the liberation of thinking.
In May, the leaders of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Anhui Provincial Committee pointed out at the provincial committee work conference that we need to distinguish between the mainstream and the tributary when looking at the situation. In the previous period, some people used the opportunity of promoting democracy and liberating thinking from the right-wing perspective to spread skepticism and denial of the four basic principles. There were also a few people in society who advocated anarchism and extreme democratization. This is the tributary. After conveying and implementing the speech of the leaders of the central government on "Four Insistences," this situation has quickly changed. We must not be confused by these tributaries. There is currently another incorrect trend denying the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee. Some people seized upon these tributary phenomena and exaggerated them, attacking the party's line as "rightist" and claiming that the policies of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee were "biased." We must also pay full attention to these trends appearing in the guise of "leftist." This shows that the thinking of many people is still in a state of rigidity. Therefore, we must correctly understand the situation, firmly establish our political direction, continue to implement the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, continue to liberate thinking, and deepen the discussion on the issue of truth standards. This discussion goes beyond any theoretical discussion on the ideological front since the founding of New China. It is a Marxist educational and ideological liberation movement of profound significance after the Yan'an Rectification Movement.
In May, the leaders of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Jiangxi Provincial Committee delivered a speech at the provincial committee work conference, calling on all party organizations at all levels in the province to adhere to the policy of liberating thinking, taking pragmatic actions, seeking truth from facts, and unity, and unite the ideological thoughts within and outside the party around the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee. The Jiangxi Provincial Committee work conference believes that as long as we follow the decision of the Third Plenary Session, adhere to the ideological line that practice is the sole criterion of truth, adhere to deepening practice, investigation, and research, and follow the mass line, the current problems and difficulties can be completely resolved.
In early June, the leaders of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Guangdong Provincial Committee pointed out at the cadre meetings at the provincial, municipal, and county levels in the province that we should pay attention to opposing the interference of incorrect ideological trends from both "left" and right-wing perspectives. Compared to right-wing trends, left-wing trends are more likely to confuse people and pose greater harm to us, so we need to be vigilant. The appearance of both left-wing and right-wing trends is not because the spirit of the Third Plenary Session has been implemented comprehensively, but rather because we have only initially implemented the spirit. It is the "beginning," not the "excessive." Therefore, we must continue to study the documents of the Third Plenary Session, and in many aspects, we need to supplement the discussion on the standard of truth. We must continue to educate on the ideological line of dialectical materialism.
The responsible person of the Hubei Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China pointed out at the enlarged meeting of the Standing Committee of the Provincial Committee that there are differences in views on the guiding principles and policies of the Third Plenary Session within our party and among cadres. A trend of doubt or opposition to the spirit of the Third Plenary Session has emerged. Some comrades believe that after the Third Plenary Session, "the policies went right". This misunderstanding is due to a lack of comprehensive and correct understanding of the guiding principles and policies of the Third Plenary Session, and the confusion between some problems that inevitably arise during the implementation of the spirit of the Third Plenary Session and the guiding principles and policies determined by the Third Plenary Session. Therefore, it is necessary to continue to emancipate our minds and eliminate the influence of the ultraleft trend among cadres.
The person in charge of the General Political Department of the People's Liberation Army also made a request to the whole army to continue to study and learn the lesson that practice is the sole criterion for testing truth, and further eradicate the lingering influence of the ultra-leftist line of Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". Subsequently, the decision was made at the enlarged meeting of the Navy Party Committee to start a comprehensive and in-depth study and discussion on the lesson of practice being the sole criterion for testing truth, and to seriously address the issue of ideological line and supplement the discussion on the standard of truth.
3. The nationwide launch of the discussion and supplement of the lesson on the standard of truth
Some leaders at the central level, especially Deng Xiaoping, attached great importance to the discussion and supplement of the lesson on the standard of truth. On July 29, 1979, when he met with the participants of the enlarged meeting of the Navy Party Committee, he said: "At the beginning, there were many people who opposed the proposition that practice is the sole criterion for testing truth, but the overwhelming majority of cadres and masses nationwide gradually accepted it. This debate is not over yet, and the Navy is considering making up for the lesson, which is very important. The discussion on the standard of truth is the foundation of construction. Without solving the problem of ideological line and emancipating the mind, a correct political line cannot be formulated or implemented. Therefore, do not underestimate the significance of the debate on whether practice is the sole criterion for testing truth. Its essence lies in whether we adhere to Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought."
In mid-August of the same year, Deng Xiaoping made an inspection tour to Tianjin. At that time, the Tianjin Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China was holding an enlarged meeting of the Standing Committee. Deng Xiaoping listened to the work report of the members of the Standing Committee of the Municipal Committee and made an important speech on implementing the guiding principles and policies of the Third Plenary Session, deepening the understanding of the party's political line, ideological line, and organizational line in the new era, and particularly on conducting in-depth discussion on the issue of practice being the sole criterion for testing truth. According to Deng Xiaoping's speech, the responsible person of the Tianjin Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed that to adhere to the party's political line of the Third Plenary Session, we must emancipate our minds and carry out a comprehensive discussion on the issue of the standard of truth. We must make great efforts to supplement this lesson from the municipal committee to grassroots units. Particularly, the leading comrades at the district, county, and bureau levels must study diligently.
On September 29, 1979, Ye Jianying delivered a speech at the celebration of the 30th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China. In his speech, he proposed: "We must carry out widespread and in-depth study and discussion on the standard of truth throughout the country, on all fronts and industries, from leadership authorities to grassroots units, and education on the ideological line of dialectical materialism. Particularly, the main responsible cadres must take the lead in emancipating their minds and be resolute. The responsibility of the leadership lies in further guiding the thinking of the broad cadre masses towards realizing the political line of the Four Modernizations." This speech was discussed and passed at the Fourth Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, so it can be regarded as the deployment and requirement of the central committee for the discussion and supplement of the lesson on the standard of truth.
Before and after this, all provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the central government, and various troops of the People's Liberation Army, under the unified leadership and deployment of local or troop party committees, successively conducted "make-up lessons" on the issue of truth standards. Starting from the summer and autumn of 1979, the "make-up lessons" on the issue of truth standards were carried out nationwide and reached a peak in the autumn and winter of that year. This "make-up lessons" went far beyond the scope and depth of the discussions in 1978, especially going deep into the grassroots level, causing strong resonance among the vast number of grassroots cadres and masses, and forming a true and large-scale discussion. In fact, this large-scale discussion lasted until June 1981, when the Sixth Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Communist Party made the resolution on "Several Historical Issues of the Communist Party of China Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China", essentially completing the rectification of ideological confusion and disorder, and thus concluding the "make-up lessons".
The "make-up lessons" on the issue of truth standards were not only a continuation of the discussions on the issue of truth standards in 1978 in the new situation, but also a widespread promotion of the Marxist ideological line and an further promotion and implementation of the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee.
III. Through the Resolution on "Several Historical Issues of the Communist Party of China Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China"
After the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, the Party carried out a large-scale rectification of the damage caused by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" in various fields during the "Cultural Revolution". At the same time, it also cleared and corrected some of the "left" mistakes that occurred before the "Cultural Revolution". Based on this, the Party conducted a comprehensive review and summary of the history of socialist revolution and construction since the founding of the People's Republic of China, and drafted and passed the Resolution on "Several Historical Issues of the Communist Party of China Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China".
1. The objective requirement to summarize historical experience and lessons
As early as the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the CPC, Deng Xiaoping raised the issue of summarizing the history of the "Cultural Revolution". He pointed out that it is necessary to summarize the shortcomings and mistakes that occurred during the "Cultural Revolution" when appropriate, as it is necessary to unify the Party's understanding. The "Cultural Revolution" has become a stage in the development of China's socialist history and needs to be summarized, but there is no need to rush, a scientific evaluation of this historical stage requires serious research. Deng Xiaoping's opinion was accepted by the whole Party and included in the communique of the plenum.
After the plenum, the central leadership began to undertake specific work in this regard. In September 1979, just before the 30th anniversary of the founding of New China, the CPC Central Committee organized cadres engaged in theoretical work to conduct a comprehensive study and summary of the history of the past 30 years since the founding of New China, and drafted a speech, which was then widely solicited for opinions within and outside the Party. From September 25th to 28th, the CPC Central Committee held the Fourth Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, where the speech drafted by Ye Jianying was discussed and passed.
On September 29th, Ye Jianying, on behalf of the CPC Central Committee, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, and the State Council, delivered a long speech at the celebration of the 30th anniversary of the founding of New China. He comprehensively reviewed the history of the past 30 years since the founding of New China and pointed out that our achievements over the past 30 years are great, and it is completely wrong not to see these great achievements. Of course, we know that the road we have traveled has not been smooth. We have experienced relatively smooth development as well as serious setbacks. Compared with the arduous efforts made by the whole nation and the superiority of the socialist system, our achievements are far from enough. We must carefully sum up the experience and lessons and strive for greater achievements.
Ye Jianying reviewed in his speech: After the founding of New China, within a short period of three years, we healed the wounds caused by the long-term war, successfully completed the remaining tasks of the democratic revolution, and while providing assistance in the Korean War, we restored the national economy to the highest level in the history of old China.
Then, in 1956, we successfully carried out the socialist transformation of agriculture, handicraft industry, and capitalist industry and commerce, completed the development of the national economy and the first Five-Year Plan, and achieved brilliant achievements in socialist revolution and construction. However, faced with tremendous victory, we became careless. In 1957, there was an error in responding to the attack by bourgeois rightists, which led to an expansion of the problem. In 1958, there was a violation of objective laws in guiding economic work, deviating from the principles of in-depth investigation, experimentation, and everything through trial, and committing errors of arbitrary command, exaggeration, and "communist wind". In 1959, there was an inappropriate struggle within the Party against so-called right-wing opportunism.
Regarding the "Cultural Revolution," Ye Jianying pointed out that the starting point for launching the "Cultural Revolution" was to oppose and prevent revisionism. For a ruling proletarian party, it must always be vigilant and prevent itself from embarking on the path of internal oppression of the people and pursuit of hegemony externally. The problem lies in the incorrect assessment of the internal and national situation at the time of launching the "Cultural Revolution" and a lack of accurate explanation of what constitutes revisionism. This also deviated from the principle of democratic centralism and adopted incorrect approaches and methods in the struggle. Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four," as counter-revolutionaries, took advantage of this error to push it to the extreme and carried out a decade-long campaign of counter-revolutionary destruction in our country, resulting in a great catastrophe for the Chinese people and the most serious setback to the socialist cause since the establishment of New China.
After reviewing the history since the establishment of New China, Ye Jianying summarized the following lessons: (1) The fundamental purpose of socialist revolution is to liberate productive forces. Therefore, after the proletariat seizes state power and establishes a socialist system, the focus must be steadfastly placed on economic construction, vigorously developing social productive forces, and gradually improving people's lives. (2) It is necessary to make scientifically objective analysis of the domestic class conditions and class struggle situation after the establishment of the socialist system and adopt correct policies and methods. (3) It is essential to correctly understand the relationship between the masses, classes, political parties, and leaders, especially important in socialist society. (4) It is necessary to further improve party discipline and socialist legal systems, effectively safeguard the democratic rights of all party members and citizens, and institutionalize and legalize democratic and socialist democracy within the party.
Ye Jianying's speech above indicates that the Communist Party of China is an honest and great proletarian party that dares to acknowledge its mistakes. It also demonstrates that the Communist Party of China, after a long period of setbacks and mistakes, has correctly summed up its lessons and has become more mature.
2. Evaluate Mao Zedong correctly and have a scientific understanding of Mao Zedong Thought
At that time, when the central committee of the party was summarizing the history since the establishment of New China, it encountered a complex problem of how to scientifically and correctly evaluate Mao Zedong's successes and failures throughout his life. This is because, on the one hand, Mao Zedong was the principal leader of the Communist Party of China and the main creator of the People's Republic of China, and he had immortal merits in the Chinese revolution and the liberation of the Chinese nation, making him beloved by the Chinese people. On the other hand, Mao Zedong made serious "left" mistakes in his later years, which led to the occurrence of the disaster of the "Cultural Revolution." At the same time, how to evaluate Mao Zedong is an unavoidable issue when summarizing the history of the party since the establishment of New China. Whether or not we can evaluate such a leader is a key factor in whether the party's work of rectification and putting things in order can ultimately succeed.
After the Party's Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, as the rectification work progressed and the "left" mistakes were gradually corrected, especially with the in-depth discussion of the question of the criterion of truth, the long-standing personal superstitions were shattered. People no longer regarded Mao Zedong as a god, nor as a perfect and flawless revolutionary leader. At that time, there were two biases in how to evaluate Mao Zedong's merits and failures. One bias was that some people were still influenced by personal worship and refused to acknowledge the fact that Mao Zedong made mistakes. The other bias was that due to resentment towards the consequences caused by the "left" mistakes on the party, the country, their own families, or individuals, some people had an extreme mentality and attributed all the mistakes to Mao Zedong personally. Obviously, both of these biases are detrimental to making a correct evaluation of Mao Zedong, as well as to correcting the mistakes of the "left" and scientifically summarizing historical experiences. In response to the above situation, the Party Central Committee, especially older revolutionaries like Deng Xiaoping, called on people to emancipate their minds, break through barriers, and guide people on how to objectively and pragmatically evaluate Mao Zedong's achievements and mistakes and fully and accurately understand Mao Zedong Thought.
On March 30, 1979, in his speech "Upholding the Four Cardinal Principles," Deng Xiaoping addressed the erroneous trend of opposing Mao Zedong Thought that existed in society at that time. He pointed out that the series of victories achieved in the Chinese revolution and construction were inseparable from Mao Zedong Thought, and Mao Zedong made immortal contributions to the Chinese people. However, Mao Zedong, like anyone else, had his shortcomings and mistakes. When analyzing his shortcomings and mistakes, we should certainly recognize individual responsibility, but what is more important is to analyze the complex historical background. Only in this way can we approach history and historical figures with fairness, scientific rigor, and a Marxist perspective.
In August 1980, when answering a question from Italian journalist Fara Chi, Deng Xiaoping explained the evaluation of Mao Zedong by the Communist Party of China and its attitude towards Mao Zedong Thought. He pointed out that Chairman Mao's achievements are paramount. He was the main architect of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China. His contributions to the Chinese people cannot be denied. He rescued the party and the people from crises multiple times. Without Chairman Mao, at the very least, the Chinese people would have had to grope in the darkness for a longer time. Mao Zedong Thought is the guiding ideology of our party. Mao Zedong Thought is primarily the thought of Comrade Mao Zedong, but it is not solely his creation. The older generation of revolutionaries also participated in the establishment and development of Mao Zedong Thought.
Regarding the mistakes Mao Zedong made in his later years, Deng Xiaoping pointed out that some unhealthy factors and thoughts gradually emerged, mainly some "leftist" ideas. The errors started in the late 1950s. During his lifetime, Mao did not effectively carry forward good practices, such as democratic centralism and the mass line. He did not establish or form sound systems, which ultimately led to the "Cultural Revolution." Mao Zedong made political mistakes. These mistakes were not minor. On the other hand, these mistakes were exploited by the Lin Biao and "Gang of Four" counterrevolutionary groups. Their goal was to plot a power seizure. Therefore, we should differentiate between Mao Zedong's mistakes and the crimes of Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four." Chairman Mao's mistakes are secondary; we must objectively analyze his later mistakes and continue to uphold Mao Zedong Thought.
From Deng Xiaoping's response to the journalist's question, it can be seen that the correct evaluation of Mao Zedong's achievements and mistakes by Chinese Communists formed a sharp contrast to the approach of Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev, who completely denied the achievements of Joseph Stalin. This signifies the greatness and maturity of the Communist Party of China.
Subsequently, from March 1980 to June 1981, during the drafting process of the Central Committee's Resolution on Several Historical Issues Concerning the Party since the Founding of the People's Republic of China, Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized the need to establish Mao Zedong's historical status and to uphold and develop Mao Zedong Thought. He pointed out that the evaluation of Mao Zedong and the explanation of Mao Zedong Thought are not only about Mao Zedong as an individual; they are inseparable from the entire history of our party and our country. Regarding Mao Zedong's mistakes, we must criticize them unequivocally, but we must also be objective, analyze various situations, and remain steadfast in adhering to Mao Zedong Thought. Mao Zedong Thought has educated an entire generation of our party. What we are now advocating, which is to correct the chaos caused by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four," criticize the mistakes of Mao Zedong in his later years, and return to the correct path of Mao Zedong Thought, is a restoration of order.
Other older comrades, setting aside personal grievances, have made contributions from the standpoint of the party and the people's interests, and played an exemplary role in making a correct evaluation of Mao Zedong's achievements and mistakes.
Huang Kecheng is a veteran Communist Party member who has been persecuted for a long time since 1959 due to "left" leaning mistakes. He is a leader who was criticized and dealt with by Mao Zedong at the Lushan Conference, but he still highly affirms Mao Zedong's historical achievements. In November 1980, he discussed the issue of how to evaluate Mao Zedong and his ideology at a meeting of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection. He started by talking about history and reviewed Mao Zedong's significant contributions to the Chinese revolution. At the same time, he pointed out that we should have a correct attitude towards Mao Zedong's mistakes. If we attribute all the mistakes made by our party since the establishment of New China to Mao Zedong and let him bear the responsibility alone, it does not conform to historical facts. In the past, when liberating all of China and building New China, we, the old Communist Party members, all took responsibility and made significant contributions. If we now attribute all the mistakes to one person, it seems as if we had no part in it, which is unfair. We should all share the responsibility that we should share, which conforms to historical facts and materialism. Huang Kecheng emphasized: some comrades have said many extreme things about Chairman Mao, and some even speak as if he had no achievements at all. I think this is incorrect and not only fundamentally violates the facts but is also very detrimental to our party and the people. It is understandable that some comrades, especially those who have suffered setbacks and persecutions, have some passionate emotions. Everyone knows that I also faced some difficulties during Chairman Mao's later years. But I believe that for such important issues, we must not let emotions and personal grievances cloud our judgment. We can only proceed from the fundamental interests of the entire party and country.
Huang Kecheng's speech was later compiled into an article published in the People's Daily on April 10, 1981. His article had a tremendous social impact and deeply touched many people. If a comrade who has suffered so much hardship can impartially and justly treat history, what reason do others have to be emotional and vent personal grievances? It is precisely the spirit of pragmatism and broad-mindedness of the older generation of revolutionaries that has set an example for the whole party and the people to correctly evaluate Mao Zedong and understand Mao Zedong's ideology, gradually leading to a consensus among the entire party and the people.
3. Drafting and Adoption of the "Resolution on Party History Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China"
With the deepening of rectification work and the gradual consensus among the entire party and the people in evaluating Mao Zedong's merits and mistakes, the conditions for a comprehensive summary of the history of the Party since the founding of New China have gradually matured. Therefore, the Central Committee of the Party started drafting the "Resolution on Party History Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China."
Shortly after Ye Jianying's speech on the 30th anniversary of the National Day, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China began the drafting work of the "Resolution on Party History Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China" in November 1979. At that time, the work was led by the Politburo and the Secretariat of the Central Committee, and it was chaired by leaders of the Central Committee such as Deng Xiaoping and Hu Yaobang. The specific work of the drafting group was mainly carried out by Hu Qiaomu. Deng Xiaoping attached great importance to the drafting of the resolution and provided guiding comments on the draft and revisions several times.
In March 1980, the drafting group proposed a preliminary concept for the resolution. On March 19th of the same month, Deng Xiaoping put forward three opinions regarding the drafting of the resolution: (1) establish the historical position of Comrade Mao Zedong, uphold and develop Mao Zedong's ideology, which is the most essential point. (2) When analyzing the major events in the 30-year history of the People's Republic of China, it is necessary to conduct a realistic analysis of what is correct and what is wrong, including a fair evaluation of the achievements and mistakes of some responsible comrades. A basic summary of the past should be made through this resolution. This summary should be concise rather than detailed, aiming to guide everyone to unite and look forward. On April 1 of that same year, he also expressed his opinions on the overall design of the draft resolution and talked about his views on the 17-year history of China before the "Cultural Revolution" after the establishment of the People's Republic of China.
On June 27, after reading the draft resolution, Deng Xiaoping further pointed out that the focus should be on what Mao Zedong Thought is and what are the correct aspects of Comrade Mao Zedong, while the wrong aspects should be criticized, but in an appropriate manner. Simply criticizing Comrade Mao Zedong's personal mistakes cannot solve the problem, the most important thing is an institutional issue.
