The entire party must seriously study the works of Comrade Deng Xiaoping and make it play a significant guiding role in China's great process of socialist modernization.
From the Fourth Plenary Session to the Fifth Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the CPC, the second-generation central leadership collective with Deng Xiaoping as the core smoothly handed over power to the third-generation central leadership collective with Jiang Zemin as the core, ensuring the stability and continuity of the party's policies and the stability of the country, and allowing the reform and opening up as well as the socialist modernization process to continue advancing. This fully demonstrates the political maturity and organizational strength of the party, and also provides the most important political and organizational guarantee for maintaining long-term stability of the country and pushing forward the great cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics into the 21st century.
III. The Publication of Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour and the Initial Establishment of Deng Xiaoping's Theoretical Guidance Position
In the 1990s, the theoretical literature on socialist experience entered a new era. Socialist countries in Eastern Europe experienced dramatic changes, the Soviet Union declared its dissolution, and some countries and regions around China, especially in Southeast Asia, showed signs of accelerated economic development. The world order presented a trend of political multipolarity and economic globalization. This posed severe challenges to China, but also provided new development opportunities.
The governance and rectification that started in 1988, although achieved great success in stabilizing the economy, resulted in a slowdown in economic development. In 1989 and 1990, the growth rate of our country's economy was 4.1% and 3.8% respectively. Deng Xiaoping was extremely concerned about this. On March 3, 1990, during a conversation with the central leadership, he pointed out: "We must particularly pay attention to the problem of the sliding economic development speed. This is not just an economic problem; it is actually a political problem. Whether China can withstand the pressure of hegemonism and power politics, adhere to our socialist system, depends crucially on whether we can achieve faster growth speed and realize our development strategy." Faced with the complex situation at home and abroad, some people became confused and doubtful about China's reform and opening-up, lacking confidence in the future of socialism.
1. Publication of Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Speech
At a critical moment when the historical development of the Party and the country was again at a crossroads, from January 18 to February 21, 1992, the 88-year-old Deng Xiaoping visited Wuhan, Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Shanghai, and other places, delivering speeches of great importance. He comprehensively summarized the experiences in exploring the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics by the Party and the people since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, and clearly answered many major theoretical and policy questions that had often troubled and constrained people's thoughts since the reform and opening-up. The Southern Tour Speech elucidated the following ten key points:
(1) We must unwaveringly adhere to the basic line that will last for 100 years and propose that reform is also to liberate productivity. Deng Xiaoping pointed out that revolution liberates productivity, and reform also liberates productivity. In the past, we only emphasized developing productivity under socialist conditions and did not fully discuss the need to liberate productivity through reform. We should speak comprehensively about both liberating and developing productivity. He emphasized that it is crucial to adhere to the line, principles, and policies since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, and the key lies in adhering to the "one central task, two basic points". "Without adhering to socialism, without reform and opening-up, without developing the economy, and without improving people's lives, there is only a dead end. The basic line must be adhered to for 100 years without wavering. Only by adhering to this line will the people believe in you and support you. Anyone who wants to change the line, principles, and policies since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee will be rejected by the ordinary people and will be overthrown."
(2) Introduced the "Three Favorable Standards" for judging the correctness of reform and opening-up. The 13th National Congress of the Party had a significant impact on upholding the Party's basic line centered on economic construction based on Mao Zedong's ideas in "On the Coalition Government". In order to continue to dispel people's doubts about reform and opening-up, Deng Xiaoping further pointed out in the Southern Tour Speech that we should have more courage in reform and opening-up, dare to experiment. For those things that have been identified, we should boldly try and boldly explore. A key experience in Shenzhen is daring to take risks. Who can claim to have absolute certainty and no risk when doing anything? Without daring to take risks, we cannot make progress in reform and opening up. It is all about fear of too much capitalism and taking the capitalist road. The crux of the matter is whether we should prioritize "capital" or "socialism." In response to the debates on establishing special economic zones for a certain period of time, he clearly stated, "The criteria for judgment should mainly depend on whether it benefits the development of socialist productive forces, enhances the comprehensive national strength of socialist countries, and improves people's standard of living." "Special economic zones should be affiliated with socialism, not capitalism." He also said that different opinions on the policy of reform and opening up should be allowed, but there should not be endless debates because it would waste time and prevent any accomplishments.
(3) It was clearly stated that planning and the market are not the essential differences between socialism and capitalism; socialism can also adopt a market economy. As early as 1979, Deng Xiaoping pointed out that we cannot say that a market economy only exists in capitalist societies; socialism can also adopt a market economy. He continued to focus on and study this issue, speaking about it more than ten times, and believed that there is no fundamental contradiction between socialism and a market economy. He emphasized, "Don't think that implementing a market economy means following the capitalist road, it's not like that at all. It serves socialism, it is socialism." In the Southern Tour Speech, he once again emphasized, "Whether there should be more planning or more market is not the essential difference between socialism and capitalism. Planned economy does not equal socialism, capitalism also has planned elements; a market economy does not equal capitalism, socialism also has elements of the market. Planning and the market are both economic means." He also demanded that socialism boldly absorb and learn from all advanced management methods and operational models that reflect modern socialized production laws in countries around the world, including developed capitalist countries. This viewpoint had a decisive impact on the official proposal of the theory of socialist market economy at the 14th Party Congress, eventually leading to China's transformation from a planned economy to a socialist market economy.
(4) For the first time, the essence of socialism was clearly defined to correct the unscientific understanding of socialism's essence. What is the essence of socialism? From 160 years of moving from utopian socialism to scientific socialism, communists have pursued socialism as an ideal, but they have never posed the question in this way before, and the "canon" of Marxist-Leninist works has also never defined this question. People have simply been accustomed to thinking that socialism means public ownership, distribution according to work, planned economy, proletarian dictatorship, and guided by Marxism, and so on. These elements are undoubtedly important for building socialism, but considering them as the understanding of socialism's essence is not scientific. This does not correspond to the general principle of historical materialism that defines the social form from the perspective of the movement of the contradiction between productive forces and production relations, and it deviates from the understanding of the fundamental contradiction in socialist society - the contradiction between production relations and productive forces, as well as the contradiction between superstructure and economic base. These elements, which were ambiguously regarded as the essence of socialism, belong to the content of production relations and superstructure, completely neglecting the requirements of developing productive forces. This was a cognitive root of past mistakes made in the exploration of socialism. Deng Xiaoping, in the mid-1980s, deeply reflected on the lessons of building socialism in our country and earnestly pointed out, "Although we are also practicing socialism now, we are not up to par in reality." One important reason for this is that we did not regard concentrating our efforts on developing productive forces as the fundamental task of socialism. With such a painful lesson, Deng Xiaoping first raised the issue of the essence of socialism in the Southern Talk. He pointed out: "The essence of socialism is to liberate productive forces, develop productive forces, eliminate exploitation, eliminate polarization, and ultimately achieve common prosperity." This new definition of the essence of socialism highlights the decisive role of productive forces and the contradiction between productive forces and relations of production, as well as the contradiction between economic base and superstructure, thus laying a theoretical foundation for the Party's fundamental task theory and primary task theory of socialism.
(5) Emphasizing seizing opportunities and developing oneself, the key is to develop the economy, and puts forward the important idea that "development is the hard truth". Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized: Now, some countries and regions around us are developing their economies faster than we are, and if we don't develop or develop too slowly, there will be problems when people make comparisons. So, if we can develop, we should not hinder it. In places where conditions permit, we should speed up development as much as possible, as long as we focus on benefits, quality, and develop an outward-oriented economy, there is nothing to worry about. The important thing is to seize opportunities. Our country's economic development must always strive to take another step every few years. Of course, it is not encouraging unrealistic high speed, but rather solid, efficient, and coordinated development. He made it clear: "For a developing country like ours, the economy needs to develop a little faster. It is impossible to always be calm and steady. We should pay attention to stable and coordinated development, but stability and coordination are relative, not absolute. Development is the hard truth." Developing the economy requires not only seizing opportunities, but also relying on science and education. Science should be promoted, and there is hope only by relying on science.
(6) Deng Xiaoping proposed that China should be vigilant against the right, but the main focus should be on preventing the "left" strategic estimation. Since the reform and opening up, Deng Xiaoping has consistently fought against both the left and right erroneous tendencies, but he has repeatedly pointed out that the main focus is on combating the "left". He made it even clearer in the Southern Talk: "Now, there are influences from the right and the left, but the deeply rooted influences are from the 'left'. Some theorists and politicians scare people with big hats, not by the right, but by the 'left'. The 'left' carries a revolutionary color, as if the more 'left' the more revolutionary. The 'left' things have been terrible in our Party's history! Something good, but suddenly ruined by 'left' things. The right can bury socialism, and the 'left' can also bury socialism. China should be vigilant against the right, but the main focus is on preventing the 'left'." This thought-provoking conclusion is a profound summary of the Party's historical experience, the historical experience of other socialist countries, and the fresh experience of the main tendencies that have emerged since the reform and opening up. It has important guiding significance for our party to adhere to the basic line for 100 years without wavering and to maintain a clear mind in strategic estimation.
(7) It is proposed to adhere to the "two hands approach" and both hands must be firm. Deng Xiaoping, based on the lessons from the political turbulence in the 1980s, clearly pointed out: "We must adhere to the two hands approach, one hand for reform and opening up, and the other hand for cracking down on various criminal activities. Both hands must be firm. We cannot be weak in cracking down on various criminal activities and eliminating various ugly phenomena." In response to the goal of Guangdong catching up with the "Four Asian Tigers" in 20 years, he warned comrades in Guangdong that not only the economy should improve, but also the social order and social atmosphere should be improved. "Both cultural constructions must surpass theirs. This is the socialism with Chinese characteristics." He emphasized that corruption should be opposed throughout the entire process of reform and opening up. For cadres and Communist Party members, building a clean government should be a major task. It still depends on the rule of law, and we should rely more on the rule of law. As long as our productive forces develop and maintain a certain rate of economic growth, adhere to the "two hands approach", we can promote the construction of socialist spiritual civilization.
(8) Emphasizing that the correct political line must be guaranteed by the correct organizational line, the key to lasting stability of the country lies in the Communist Party itself. Deng Xiaoping stressed when implementing the transition of the party's new and old leadership collectives: "The key to China's problems is that the Communist Party must have a good Political Bureau, especially a good Standing Committee. As long as there are no problems with this link, China will be as stable as Mount Tai." "The most crucial thing is to have a united leadership core. If we can maintain this for fifty years, sixty years, socialist China will be invincible." In the southern tour speech, he further discussed this issue from the perspective of the relationship between the political line and the organizational line, pointing out: "Whether China's affairs can be done well, whether socialism and reform and opening up can be adhered to, whether the economy can develop faster, and whether the country can maintain lasting stability, to some extent, it depends on the people." We must pay attention to cultivating people and select people who are both virtuous and talented according to the standards of "revolutionization, youthfulness, knowledge, and specialization" into our leadership. Imperialism conducts peaceful evolution and places its hopes on the next few generations. Therefore, we must educate our army well, educate our dictatorship institutions well, educate our Communist Party members well, and educate our people and youth well. "If China were to have problems, it would still stem from within the Communist Party. We must remain clear on this issue... We say that the party's basic line must be in control for 100 years and must ensure lasting stability, and this relies on this aspect."
(9) Emphasizing the consolidation and development of the socialist system requires a long historical stage. Whether socialist society is a brief transitional period or a long historical era is a problem that has not been solved by Marx, Lenin, or Mao Zedong. Based on previous views, although socialism is also considered a lower stage of communism, the lack of understanding of the long-term nature of communism has led to a greater emphasis on the transitional nature of socialism. This is a theoretical root of the rush for success that all socialist countries have made. After experiencing the three-year "Great Leap Forward" in China, Mao Zedong also emphasized that socialism is a quite long historical period, but he mainly spoke from the perspective of class struggle. Deng Xiaoping summed up the historical lessons of socialist development and, with the strategic thinking of a politician and the profound vision of a historian, warned the entire party: "We have only been engaged in socialism for a few decades and are still in the primary stage. It will take a long historical stage, several generations, even several tens of generations of unremitting efforts for us to consolidate and develop the socialist system. We must not take it lightly."
(10) The essence of Marxism has been scientifically summarized, emphasizing the need to educate the youth in the understanding of the laws of human social development through historical materialism. Although Deng Xiaoping claimed to have read few books, he possessed abundant political wisdom and a high level of theoretical understanding. He made a scientific summary of the fundamental aspects of Marxism and pointed out: "Seeking truth from facts is the essence of Marxism. We should advocate this and not advocate textbooks. The success of our reform and opening up is not achieved through textbooks, but through practice, through seeking truth from facts." "We have been talking about Marxism for a lifetime, but in fact, Marxism is not mysterious. Marxism is something very down-to-earth, very plain." Based on this, he proposed that "when studying Marxism and Leninism, we must be meticulous and focus on practicality." He emphasized that Marxism is a science that uses historical materialism to reveal the laws of human social development, and more and more people in the world will support Marxism. After a long process of development, socialism will inevitably replace capitalism as the general trend of social historical development. Although some countries have experienced serious twists and setbacks that weakened socialism, the people, having undergone trials and tribulations, will learn from them and promote the development of socialism in a healthier direction. We must continue to advance along the path of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. "If in a hundred years from the founding of the People's Republic, we can develop our country into a moderately developed country, it will be remarkable! From now until the middle of the next century, it will be a crucial period, and we must work hard. The burden on our shoulders is heavy, and our responsibility is great!"
Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Speech is extremely rich in content. In a certain sense, it not only embodies the concentrated expression of Deng Xiaoping's thoughts on reform and opening up but also marks the development of his theoretical thinking reaching a new height. This is mainly manifested in two aspects: on the one hand, the Southern Tour Speech is a systematic work, not only discussing its content in a structured framework, providing comprehensive answers to many important questions such as what is socialism and how to build socialism, but also compared to his other works, it is a comprehensive theoretical document that forms a relatively complete system of personal thoughts. On the other hand, the Southern Tour Speech has given many new ideas to the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics. The above ten points are not only the new development of the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics but also reflect the new realm it has reached. Not only does it have profound and insightful ideas, it also has a serious theoretical depth, and the language expression is also very distinct and thorough, with a fascinating sense of novelty. The Southern Talks are an important part of Deng Xiaoping's enrichment and development of the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics in his later years, and it is also "another declaration of emancipating the mind and seeking truth from facts in advancing the reform, opening up and modernization to a new stage".
2. The preliminary establishment of Deng Xiaoping's theory and its guiding position
In mid-October 1992, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China was held. The main tasks of the congress were: to take Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics as a guide, comprehensively summarize the great practice and basic experience of reform and opening up over the past 14 years, determine the strategic deployment for the future period, seize favorable opportunities, accelerate the pace of reform, opening up and modernization, and achieve greater victory in the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics. This congress made three decisions of far-reaching historical significance: first, the preliminary establishment of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics as the guiding position of the whole Party; second, clarifying the goal of economic system reform in our country is to establish a socialist market economy system; and third, requiring the entire Party to seize opportunities, accelerate development, and focus on promoting economic construction. With Deng Xiaoping's Southern Talks and the 14th National Congress of the Party as the milestones, the cause of socialist reform, opening up and modernization entered a new stage of development.
Since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the Party has continuously enriched its understanding of the socialist road with Chinese characteristics in the practice of reform and opening up, gradually forming the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics. The formation of this theory mainly went through three stages of development:
The first stage was from the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Communist Party of China at the end of 1978 to the 12th National Congress of the Party in 1982. In the process of rectifying mistakes and starting reform, Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics gradually took shape. Starting from the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the Communist Party of China earnestly rectified and corrected the past "left" mistakes, successfully completed the rectification of guiding ideology, and through the summary of historical experience and the practice of reform and opening up, re-established the correct combination of the basic principles of Marxism and the practice of socialist construction in China. In this process, under the guidance of Deng Xiaoping, the Party put forward a series of new guidelines and policies on the construction of socialism in China, forming several new understandings about what socialism is and how to build socialism. The "Resolution on Several Historical Issues Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China" in 1981 summarized these new understandings as ten main viewpoints, which can be regarded as the embryonic form of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. At the 12th National Congress of the Party, Deng Xiaoping proposed to "build socialism with Chinese characteristics", which enabled the Party to achieve a second historic leap in the sinicization of Marxism and gave clear thematic achievements to this leap.
The second stage was from the 12th National Congress of the Party in 1982 to the 13th National Congress of the Party in 1987. In the process of the comprehensive opening up of reform and opening up, Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics formed its basic outline. The comprehensive opening up went through the process from rural reform to urban reform, from economic system reform to various other system reforms, and from revitalizing the domestic economy to opening up to the outside world. The deepening of reform urgently required theoretical guidance. During this period, Deng Xiaoping repeatedly raised the primary and fundamental theoretical question of understanding "what socialism is and how to build socialism". In October 1984, the Decision on Economic System Reform passed at the Third Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee of the Party put forward that the socialist economy is a "planned commodity economy on the basis of public ownership", breaking through the traditional notion of opposing planned economy and commodity economy. In 1987, the 13th National Congress of the Party systematically expounded the theory of the primary stage of socialism. Together with the theory of socialist commodity economy, it has become one of the two major new achievements in the process of Marxist Sinicization, providing strong theoretical guidance for reform and opening up. The 13th National Congress of the Party highly evaluated the great significance of opening up and building a socialist path with Chinese characteristics since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party, and referred to it as the second historical leap combining Marxism with Chinese practice, and named the theoretical achievements of this leap as "the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics". The 13th National Congress of the Party listed twelve major points of this theory, which are: (1) the view of liberating the mind, seeking truth from facts, and taking practice as the sole criterion for testing truth; (2) the view that the construction of socialism must be based on the national conditions and follow its own path; (3) the view that under the conditions of economic and cultural backwardness, the construction of socialism must go through a long primary stage; (4) the view that the fundamental task of socialist society is to develop productive forces and concentrate the forces to achieve modernization; (5) the view that the socialist economy is a planned commodity economy; (6) the view that reform is the important driving force for the development of socialist society, and opening up is a necessary condition for realizing socialist modernization; (7) the view that socialist democracy and socialist spiritual civilization are important features of socialism; (8) the view that the four fundamental principles must be combined with the general principle of adhering to reform and opening up, and they cannot be separated from each other; (9) the view that "one country, two systems" should be used to achieve national unity; (10) the view that the party's style of governance is related to the life and death of the Party; (11) the view that relations with foreign communist parties and other political parties should be developed based on the principles of independence, complete equality, mutual respect, and non-interference in internal affairs; (12) the view that peace and development are the themes of the contemporary world. "These points constitute the outline of the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, and they preliminarily answer the basic questions of the stage, tasks, driving forces, conditions, layout, and international environment of socialist construction in our country, and plan our scientific path of progress."
The third stage is from the 13th National Congress of the Party to the 14th National Congress of the Party, which is the stage for the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics by Deng Xiaoping to mature and form a scientific system. In the late 1980s and early 1990s, China's reform entered a critical stage, and serious political turmoil occurred both domestically and internationally. At this critical historical juncture, the Communist Party of China firmly relied on the people, resolutely adhered to the four cardinal principles, safeguarded the country's independence, security, and stability, unwaveringly adhered to the centrality of economic construction, and steadfastly promoted reform and opening up. The cause of building socialism with Chinese characteristics not only successfully withstood severe tests, but the theory that guides this cause - Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics - has also been further improved.
In 1990, the 7th Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Party adopted the "Recommendations on Formulating the Ten-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the 'Eighth Five-Year Plan'", summarizing the basic principles and basic practices of building socialism with Chinese characteristics since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party as twelve principles. These twelve principles are: (1) Adhere to the system of people's democratic dictatorship based on the leadership of the working class and the alliance of workers and peasants; (2) Uphold the development of social productive forces as the fundamental task of socialism; (3) Continuously improve the economic, political, and other management systems of socialism through reform; (4) Expand opening up to the outside world through various forms such as developing economic and trade relations, utilizing foreign capital, and introducing advanced technology; (5) Maintain a socialist system with public ownership as the mainstay and multiple economic components coexisting; (6) Actively develop a planned socialist commodity economy; (7) Implement a distribution system with remuneration according to work as the main form and other distribution methods as supplements; (8) Adhere to the guidance of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, constantly improve the ideological, moral, scientific, and cultural qualities of the entire nation, and build a socialist spiritual civilization; (9) Establish and develop equal and mutually beneficial, united, and prosperous socialist ethnic relations, insisting on and improving the system of regional ethnic autonomy; (10) Promote the gradual realization of the great cause of national reunification in accordance with the concept and practice of "one country, two systems"; (11) Adhere to an independent and peaceful foreign policy, develop friendly relations with all countries on the basis of the Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence; (12) Adhere to the leadership of the Communist Party, continuously improve the Party's leadership system, style, and methods, and make the Party always the strong core of the socialist cause. Some of these principles have been consistently adhered to by the Party for decades, and there are new developments under new historical conditions; some are summaries of the fresh experiences in modernization construction and reform and opening up over the past decade, embodying Deng Xiaoping's outstanding contributions to inheriting and developing Mao Zedong Thought under new historical conditions. The summary of these twelve principles represents a further deepening of the understanding of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
In 1991, Jiang Zemin summarized the main content of the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics from the three aspects of economy, politics, and culture in his speech at the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Party. In early 1992, Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Talk further summarized the basic experiences since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Party, and profoundly answered many major issues that had long plagued and restricted people's thinking. This not only marked the elevation of Deng Xiaoping's thought to a new height but also brought the Party's understanding of the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics to a new level. Based on these theoretical advancements, the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party summarized the content of the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics once again and for the first time used the term "Comrade Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics".
The nine aspects that the Fourteenth National Congress summarized as "Comrade Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics" are as follows:
(1) Regarding the issue of the socialist development path, emphasize the need to follow our own path, not take books as dogma, not mechanically copy foreign models, take Marxism as guidance, take practice as the sole criterion for testing truth, liberate thinking, seek truth from facts, respect the pioneering spirit of the masses, and build socialism with Chinese characteristics.
(2) On the issue of the development stage, make the scientific judgment that our country is still in the primary stage of socialism, emphasizing that this is a very long historical stage of at least several hundred years. All guidelines and policies must be based on this basic national condition and not be divorced from reality or surpass the stage.
(3) On the issue of the fundamental task of socialism, point out that the essence of socialism is to liberate and develop the productive forces, eliminate exploitation, eradicate polarization, and ultimately achieve common prosperity. The development of productive forces must be given top priority, with economic construction as the central task, and promote comprehensive social progress. The criterion for judging the success or failure of various tasks ultimately comes down to whether they are "favorable to" the three aspects.
(4) Regarding the issue of the driving force of socialist development, emphasize that reform is a revolution and the only way to liberate productive forces and achieve China's modernization. At the same time, emphasize that opening up to the outside world is an indispensable means for reform and construction. We should absorb and utilize all the achievements of advanced civilization created by countries including capitalist ones to develop socialism.
(5) On the issue of external conditions for socialist construction, it is pointed out that peace and development are the two major themes of the contemporary world. It is necessary to adhere to an independent and peaceful diplomatic policy to strive for a favorable international environment for our country's modernization construction.
(6) On the issue of political guarantees for socialist construction, it emphasizes the need to adhere to the four cardinal principles. It is not only a guarantee for the healthy development of reform, opening up, and modernization construction, but also needs to obtain new era content from reform, opening up, and modernization construction.
(7) On the issue of strategic steps, it is proposed that the basic realization of modernization should be done in three stages. It is necessary to allow and encourage some regions and some people to become prosperous through hard work, in order to gradually achieve common prosperity in more regions and among more people.
(8) On the issue of leadership and reliance, it emphasizes that the Communist Party is the leadership core of the socialist cause. The Party must adapt to the needs of reform, opening up, and modernization construction, continuously improve and strengthen its leadership in all aspects of work, and improve and strengthen its own construction. It must rely on the broad masses of workers, peasants, intellectuals, the unity of all ethnic groups, and the broadest united front of all socialist workers, patriotic supporters of socialism, and patriotic supporters of national reunification.
(9) On the issue of national reunification, it proposes the creative idea of "one country, two systems" to promote the great cause of peaceful reunification of the motherland. 
The summaries of the above nine aspects indicate that Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics has formed a relatively complete scientific system. The report of the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China pointed out that this scientific theoretical system has gradually formed and developed in the historical conditions where peace and development have become the main theme of the times, in the process of China's reform, opening up, and socialist modernization construction, and based on summarizing the historical experiences of China's socialist victories and setbacks and learning from the historical experiences of success and failure of other socialist countries. The report highly evaluates the great significance of this theory and points out that it "for the first time systematically and preliminarily answers a series of basic questions about how to build socialism and how to consolidate and develop socialism in countries that are relatively economically and culturally backward like China, using new ideas and viewpoints, and inheriting and developing Marxism", "it is Marxism of contemporary China, a powerful ideological weapon that guides us to achieve new historical tasks".
In view of the theoretical significance and guiding role of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China put forward the strategic task of arming the whole Party with this theory, "learning Marxist-Leninist-Mao Zedong Thought, with the central content being the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics". In the amended Party Constitution of the 14th National Congress, the great significance of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics is written into it, which preliminarily establishes its guiding position in the whole Party.
Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, summarized and named by the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, is the first important theoretical achievement in which Marxism is combined with China's practice, and it is also the latest achievement of exploring Marxist sinicization since the reform and opening up. Based on it, the Communist Party of China has continuously summarized new experiences in reform, opening up, and modernization construction, and has achieved one theoretical innovation after another in the new century.
Chapter 7: The Socialist Market Economy System and the Basic Program of the Primary Stage of Socialism
I. The final establishment of the goal of market economy system reform and the formulation of action guidelines
The debate on how to reform China's economic system, whether it is to make adjustments within the existing planned economic system framework or to establish a new market economy system as the goal, has been accompanying the comprehensive progress of reform and opening up. It is both an economic problem and a political problem, which relates to the overall socialist modernization construction. The party has made unremitting explorations on this issue, which is a process of continuous ideological liberation and progressively clearer understanding. The previous discussion on the economic system reform decision made at the Third Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China partially touched on this issue. Here, we will review the ideological understanding of the central decision-making layer systematically.
As early as a certain meeting of the State Council held from July to September 1978, someone proposed that the role of the law of value should be exerted more. In December 1978, in the outline drafted by Deng Xiaoping for the speech "Liberate the Mind, Seek Truth from Facts, Unite as One, Look Forward" there was such a paragraph, "The contradiction between autonomy and state planning, mainly regulated by the law of value and supply-demand relationship (product quality)", that is, regulated through the market. This was Deng Xiaoping's initial expression of his thoughts on regulating economic activities through the market.
In March 1979, Chen Yun proposed in the "Outline on the Issue of Planning and Market", "During the entire socialist period, there must be two types of economies: (1) the planned economy part (planned and proportionate part); (2) the market-regulated part (that is, production not planned but based on changes in market supply and demand, a part that involves blind adjustment). The first part is the basic and primary part; the second part is the subordinate and secondary part but also necessary." He also pointed out, "In the future economic adjustment and system reform, adjusting the proportion between planning and market will account for a large proportion. It is not necessarily that the increase in the planned economy part will lead to an absolute decrease in the amount of the market economy part. It may very well increase correspondingly." Since then, the initiation and unfolding process of the reforms have proven Chen Yun's foresight. China's economic system reform did not break the framework of the planned system at the beginning. On the one hand, it focused on the role of the market and the law of value within the planned system, appropriately reducing the proportion of directive planning and increasing the proportion of guidance planning; on the other hand, it focused on expanding the scope of market regulation outside the planned system. In this way, both the guidance planning within the planned system and the market regulation outside the planned system increased, and the laws of the market were reflected both within and outside the planned system. Practice has proven that the importance of the market in economic development cannot be ignored, and a socialist economy cannot do without the regulatory role of the market. Deng Xiaoping provided a more explicit explanation of this, and he was the first to connect the market economy with socialism.
In November 1979, Deng Xiaoping pointed out during a meeting with foreign guests, "To say that a market economy only exists in capitalist society, that only capitalism has a market economy, is definitely incorrect. Why can't socialism have a market economy? This cannot be said to be capitalism. We are primarily a planned economy, but we also combine it with a market economy, which is a socialist market economy." Here, Deng Xiaoping explicitly used the term "socialist market economy". In June 1981, the Resolution on Certain Questions in the History of Our Party Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China, passed at the Sixth Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, when summarizing the road of socialist modernization construction in our country, proposed to "give full play to the auxiliary role of market regulation." This term was confirmed as the principle of "planned economy as the mainstay and market regulation as the complement" in the report of the 12th National Congress of the Communist Party of China. This reflects the level of understanding and recognition of this issue at that time.
The significant contribution of the Decision on Economic System Reform passed at the Third Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in 1984 was to resolve the issue of the unity between socialism and the commodity economy. However, it did not solve the problem of the unity between socialism and the market economy. The traditional notion that socialism cannot adopt a market economy still had a considerable influence. Nevertheless, when the Decision proposed that the socialist economy is "a planned commodity economy based on public ownership," it pointed out that implementing a planned economy does not mean relying solely on mandatory plans; indicative planning is also a concrete form of planning. This provided a theoretical basis for gradually reducing the scope of mandatory planning, continuously expanding the scope of market regulation, and promoting market-oriented reforms. The 13th National Congress of the Communist Party of China further pointed out that "the new system of planned commodity economy under socialism should be a system in which planning and the market are intrinsically unified." Afterward, the term "planned economy as the mainstay" was no longer mentioned in central documents. The Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed the establishment of an economic system and operational mechanism that combines planned economy and market regulation to adapt to the development of a planned commodity economy.
Since the Third Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, various regions have vigorously developed the commodity economy, and market-oriented reforms have been continuously expanding and deepening. At the same time, in terms of theory, there have been a series of debates on the nature of the market economy, whether China should implement a market economy, and other issues. The focus of the debate is whether a market economy should be associated with "socialism" or "capitalism." Deng Xiaoping made clear statements on this issue and reiterated the view that "there is no fundamental contradiction between socialism and the market economy" multiple times. He emphasized that it is necessary to understand theoretically that the difference between capitalism and socialism does not lie in whether it is a planned economy or a market economy. The following is a summary of Deng Xiaoping's multiple discussions on the market economy: In addition to the statement mentioned in November 1979, the second time was in January 1980 when discussing the search for a development path that conforms to China's reality in "The Current Situation and Tasks." It proposed combining "planned regulation and market regulation." The third time was in July 1982 when talking with officials from the National Development and Reform Commission. "Compared with capitalism, socialism's superiority lies in its ability to achieve overall coordination, concentrate resources, and ensure key points. The shortcomings lie in the inadequate use of the market and the lack of vitality in the economy. How to resolve the relationship between planning and the market? If resolved properly, it will be very beneficial to economic development. If not, it will be disastrous." The fourth and fifth times were evaluations of the Decision on Economic System Reform passed at the Third Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee. The fourth time was an impromptu speech given when the Decision was passed at the plenary session on October 20, 1984, stating that the Decision is the political economy combining Marxist basic principles with China's socialist practice. The fifth time was two days later when speaking at the Central Advisory Commission, stating that the Decision discussed new ideas that our ancestors had not discussed. The sixth time was during a conversation with a delegation of American entrepreneurs in October 1985, explicitly stating, "There is no fundamental contradiction between socialism and the market economy. The problem is how to develop productive forces more effectively. In the past, we have been implementing a planned economy, but many years of practice have proven that, in a sense, only implementing a planned economy will restrict the development of productive forces. Combining planned economy and market economy can better unleash productive forces and accelerate economic development." The seventh time was in February 1987 when talking with several senior officials of the central government, saying, "Why do people say that when we discuss the market, it's capitalism, and only planning is socialism? Planning and the market are both methods. As long as they benefit the development of productive forces, they can be used." It serves socialism, it is socialist; it serves capitalism, it is capitalist. It seems that talking about planning is socialism, but that is not correct. Japan also has a planning department, and the United States also has plans. We used to learn from the Soviet Union and implemented a planned economy. Later, we emphasized the primacy of planned economy, but now we no longer talk about it. The eighth time was in September 1988 when listening to an economic work report. It was said that macro-management should be reflected in the credibility of the central government. Now we are moving towards a moderately prosperous society. Although it does not directly involve planning and market issues literally, it is based on the implementation of a socialist market economy. Later, it emphasized the central macro-control under the conditions of a socialist market economy, which is an important authoritative basis. The ninth time was on June 9, 1989, in a speech: "We must continue to adhere to the combination of planned economy and market regulation, this cannot be changed. In practical work, during adjustment periods, we can strengthen or have more planning, and at another time, have more market regulation, making it more flexible." The tenth time was in December 1990, during a conversation with several responsible leaders of the central government: "We must understand in theory that the distinction between capitalism and socialism is not about whether it is planning or market. Socialism also has a market economy, and capitalism also has planned control. ... Don't think that engaging in a market economy means taking the capitalist road, it's not like that." The eleventh time was in early 1991 during an inspection in Shanghai: "Don't think that discussing a planned economy means socialism, or discussing a market economy means capitalism. It's not like that. Both are means, and the market can also serve socialism." The twelfth time is the Southern tour mentioned in the text. In the 1992 Southern tour, specifically addressing the debate about planning and market being "socialist" or "capitalist", Deng Xiaoping pointed out: whether there is more planning or more market is not the essential difference between socialism and capitalism. Planned economy does not equal socialism, and capitalism also has planning; market economy does not equal capitalism, and socialism also has a market. Planning and market are both economic means. This provides a thorough and incisive answer to the long-standing theoretical question of whether socialism can conduct a market economy, fundamentally removing the ideological constraints that regard planned economy as the basic characteristic of socialism, and laying the ideological and theoretical foundation for establishing a socialist market economy system.
During the preparations for the 14th Party Congress, the Party Central Committee repeatedly studied and made decisions on establishing the goal model of economic system reform. On June 9, 1992, Jiang Zemin gave a report at the Central Party School, clearly putting forward the proposition of establishing a socialist market economy system. He first elaborated on Deng Xiaoping's idea that "socialism can also have a market". Through more than a decade of reform and opening up, we have gained a deeper understanding. In the past, we often only saw the negative impact of the spontaneity of the market, but seldom saw the positive role of the market in motivating enterprise competition and promoting economic development, especially in the way that the market also allocates resources and optimizes resource allocation. This is a one-sided understanding. Of course, emphasizing the advantages of the market does not mean that the market is comprehensive and omnipotent; the market also has obvious limitations. Therefore, it is also necessary to exploit the advantages of planned regulation to make up for and resist the negative effects of market regulation, in order to ensure the comprehensive development of the entire economy. He also pointed out: it is imperative to fundamentally reform the highly centralized planned economic system, otherwise it will be impossible to achieve modernization in our country. How to reform, what are the goals? He said that there are three approaches to establishing a new economic system: first, to establish a socialist commodity economic system that combines planning and the market; second, to establish a socialist planned market economic system; third, to establish a socialist market economic system. After soliciting opinions from various parties and making careful comparisons, the central committee "tends to use the term socialist market economic system". On June 12th, Jiang Zemin talked about his ideas to Deng Xiaoping. Deng Xiaoping immediately expressed his support for this approach and said that, in fact, we are already doing this and Shenzhen is a socialist market economy. Subsequently, the party committees of 30 provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities all expressed their agreement with the term socialist market economic system.
In the autumn of 1992, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party formally proposed the goal of establishing a socialist market economic system. Jiang Zemin pointed out in the report of the 14th National Congress that the goal of China's economic system reform is to establish a socialist market economic system in order to further liberate and develop productive forces. The socialist market economic system to be established in China is meant to make the market play a fundamental role in resource allocation under the macro-control of the socialist state, to meet the requirements of the law of value in economic activities and adapt to changes in supply and demand. By utilizing the functions of price leverage and the competition mechanism, resources are allocated to sectors with better efficiency, and enterprises are given pressure and motivation to achieve the survival of the fittest. With the advantage of the market's sensitive response to various economic signals, timely coordination of production and demand is promoted. At the same time, it must be acknowledged that the market has its own weaknesses and negative aspects, and it is necessary to strengthen and improve the macro-control of the economy by the state. The report also points out that the socialist market economic system is combined with the basic socialist economic system. In terms of ownership structure, public ownership, including the economy under the ownership of the whole people and collective ownership, is the main body, while individual economy, private economy, and foreign-funded economy serve as supplements. Various economic components develop together in the long term, and different economic components can voluntarily practice various forms of joint operation. State-owned enterprises, collective enterprises, and other enterprises all participate in the market and exert the leading role of state-owned enterprises through equal competition. In terms of distribution system, the principle of distribution according to work is the mainstay, and other distribution methods serve as supplements, taking into account both efficiency and fairness. In terms of macro-control, the current interests of the people are combined with long-term interests, local interests are combined with overall interests, and the advantages of both planning and the market are better utilized. In March 1993, the first session of the 8th National People's Congress made amendments to the Constitution, changing "the country implements a socialist planned economy" to "the country implements a socialist market economy". The socialist market economy was written into the Constitution.
The establishment of the goal of the socialist market economic system marks a new leap in the Party's understanding of scientific socialist theory and the practice of reform and opening up. From the initial proposal of using the market's regulatory role as an auxiliary in the reform, to the establishment of the goal of a socialist market economic system at the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party, it took a total of 14 years. The final establishment of this goal is a major achievement of the Party's arduous exploration in the practice of reform and opening up and modernization construction, and it is also an inevitable result of the in-depth development of the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics. This new decision makes the direction of China's economic system reform and socialist modernization construction more clear.
According to the decisions of the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the Party Central Committee and the State Council are speeding up the advancement of various reforms while also actively formulating a general plan for establishing a socialist market economy. In November 1993, the Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China passed the Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Several Issues Concerning the Establishment of a Socialist Market Economic System, which put forth a relatively complete vision and plan for how to establish a socialist market economic system. The Decision points out that the establishment of a socialist market economic system aims to enable the market, under the macroeconomic regulation of the state, to play a fundamental role in resource allocation, liberate and develop productivity to the maximum extent, enhance the overall national strength, rapidly improve people's living standards, and fully leverage the advantages of the socialist system. To achieve this goal, the Decision elaborates on five main aspects of establishing a socialist market economic system: first, adhering to the principle of the dominant position of public ownership and the common development of various economic sectors, further transforming the operational mechanisms of state-owned enterprises, and establishing modern corporate systems that are market-oriented, clear on property rights, accountable, with a clear separation between government and enterprises, and scientifically managed; second, establishing a nationwide unified and open market system, integrating urban and rural markets, connecting domestic markets with international markets, and promoting the optimized allocation of resources; third, transforming the government's function of economic management, establishing a sound macroeconomic regulation system primarily through indirect means to ensure the healthy operation of the national economy; fourth, establishing an income distribution system that prioritizes efficiency and fairness, with the principle of distribution based on work, encouraging certain regions and certain people to become prosperous first, and following the path of common prosperity; fifth, establishing a multi-level social security system that provides social security measures adapted to China's national conditions for urban and rural residents, and promoting economic development and social stability. These five aspects are the basic components of the initial construction of a socialist market economic system. These aspects are interconnected and mutually restrictive, forming an organic whole. The Decision consists of 50 articles and forms the overall framework for comprehensive reforms centered around the reform of the socialist market economic system.
At the closing session of the plenary session, Jiang Zemin pointed out that the Decision is based on the theory of "building socialism with Chinese characteristics" put forward by Deng Xiaoping and the spirit of the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China. It further elaborates on the goals and basic principles of economic system reform, and represents the action plan for economic system reform undertaken by the Party in the 1990s. The Decision has preliminarily addressed how to integrate the basic socialist system with the market economic system and how to transform the old system into the new system. It will effectively promote the pace of reform in establishing a socialist market economic system and serve as a guide to establish the new system in a planned and step-by-step manner, laying a solid economic system foundation for China to reach the economic level of moderately developed countries by the middle of the 21st century.
II. The comprehensive implementation of the reform of the socialist market economic system
With the establishment of the goals for the reform of the socialist market economic system at the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China and the Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, China's reform and opening up has entered a new stage of overall transition from a planned economy to a market economy. After the Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the central leadership collective led by Jiang Zemin continued to explore the path of deepening reform regarding the aforementioned basic aspects of the socialist market economic system, proposing important ideas and policies, and actively and steadily pushing forward the comprehensive reform of the market economic system. The most important aspects are as follows.
1. Actively promoting the reform of state-owned enterprises and establishing a modern corporate system
State-owned enterprises are the mainstay of China's national economy, and the reform of state-owned enterprises is the central task of economic system reform. The modern corporate system, with public ownership as the mainstay, is the foundation of the socialist market economy. The direction of reform of state-owned enterprises determined by the Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China is to establish a modern corporate system. This is an inevitable requirement for the development of large-scale socialized production and the socialist market economy, and an effective manifestation of the combination of public ownership and the market economy. It signifies that the train of thought for China's economic system reform has shifted from policy adjustments focused on devolving power and granting benefits, tax and fee reforms, and separating powers and responsibilities in the past, to the stage of institutional innovation centered on the reform of the property rights system realized through public ownership. This is a huge change in the reform mindset and an important manifestation of the deepening of the reform. To this end, the central government has focused on the development of large and medium-sized enterprises, while also allowing for the revitalization of small state-owned enterprises, promoting the optimization and restructuring of state-owned assets through efforts to promote enterprise consolidation, reorganization, mergers, and bankruptcies. Starting from 1994, the State Council successively determined: firstly, to pilot the establishment of a modern enterprise system in 100 large and medium-sized state-owned enterprises; to pilot the optimization of capital structure and asset restructuring in 18 cities; to focus on key state-owned backbone enterprises related to national economy and people's livelihood; to develop enterprise groups that span regions, industries, and technology to trade combinations, and initially organize pilot projects for 56 enterprise groups. Extensive transformations into corporate and shareholding systems were carried out in the pilot enterprises, accumulating a lot of experience in establishing a modern enterprise system in large and medium-sized state-owned enterprises. Various operating methods and organizational forms were adopted for small state-owned enterprises. By the end of 1993, nearly 4,000 enterprises had conducted shareholding pilot projects nationwide in accordance with standardized requirements. Laws and regulations on shareholding were gradually established. Shareholding became an effective way to transform enterprise management mechanisms and establish a modern enterprise system.
2. Cultivate and develop the market system, vigorously promote financial system and price system reforms
The key to establishing the socialist market economic system is to give full play to the fundamental role of the market mechanism in resource allocation, which requires the cultivation and development of the market system. While continuing to develop commodity markets, special attention should be given to the development of the means of production market, actively cultivating financial markets including bonds and stocks, and developing technology, labor, information, and real estate markets to quickly form a unified and open national market system. The significant breakthrough made in the "Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Some Issues Concerning the Establishment of the Socialist Market Economic System" (referred to as "the Decision") adopted at the Third Plenary Session of the 14th CPC Central Committee was the first mention of the "labor market". According to Marx's "Capital", labor power only becomes a commodity under the capitalist system. The practice of reform and opening-up has shown that in the primary stage of socialism, due to the existence of various forms of ownership, labor power still has a commodity nature and can create surplus value. The influx of a large number of rural migrant workers into urban employment constitutes a huge labor market. Recognizing the existence of the labor market that objectively exists can not only protect the legitimate rights and interests of laborers through labor laws but also promote the optimization allocation of labor resources. The "Decision" changed the usual term "labor service market" to "labor market," which is a significant ideological liberation.
The development of the market economy relies on financial markets, which play a central role. Shortly after the Third Plenary Session of the 12th CPC Central Committee adopted the Decision on Economic System Reform, Deng Xiaoping pointed out: "Our banks used to be currency issuing companies, treasury houses, not real banks. The pace of financial reform should be accelerated. We must truly turn banks into banks." In the early 1990s, when talking about the development of Pudong, he also pointed out: "Finance is very important and is the core of a modern economy. If finance is well managed, the whole situation will be alive." Shanghai used to be a financial center and a place for free currency exchange, and will continue to be so in the future. In November 1990 and July 1992, authorized by the State Council and approved by the People's Bank of China, the Shanghai and Shenzhen Stock Exchanges were established successively, realizing centralized trading of stocks and forming a national securities trading market. This also became an important symbol of the formation of China's capital market and financial system reform. Since 1994, China has gradually established a macroeconomic regulation and control system under the leadership of the State Council, with an independent central bank implementing monetary policy. It separates policy finance from commercial finance, establishes a financial organizational system with state-owned commercial banks as the main body and multiple financial institutions coexisting, and establishes a unified, open, competitively regulated financial market system. Subsequently, the exchange rate of the renminbi was aligned with the market exchange rate, and foreign exchange became freely convertible under current account transactions. A managed, single, floating exchange rate system based on market supply and demand was established, which played an important role in further connecting domestic and foreign markets, improving the external economic environment, attracting foreign investment and developing an open economy.
The reform of the price management system was one of the earliest reforms initiated in the economic system reform, and it has been continuously adjusted. With consecutive years of abundant agricultural harvests and increasingly sufficient agricultural product supply, by 1993, the prices and operations of most agricultural products, including grain, had been liberalized, and the previous quantitative allocation of grain had been transformed into market supply. The ration coupons and grain certificates for urban residents were completely abolished. The prices of most production materials were unified from "dual-track prices" to a single market price. The proportion of market prices in the total retail sales of social commodities increased from 50.3% in 1991 to 93.8% in 1993, establishing the dominant position of market prices in the price system. During this period, economic means, legal means, and necessary administrative means were used, and an price control system mainly based on economic means was established. This marked the smooth progress of a major reform that was considered most likely to cause social disturbances. This is another major achievement of the reform and opening up.
3. Establishing and improving the macroeconomic regulation and control system, actively promoting fiscal and tax system and investment system reforms
The socialist market economy system established in China aims to better integrate planning and market mechanisms. The main task of macroeconomic regulation and control is to maintain the basic balance of the overall economic volume, promote the optimization of economic structure, guide the sustained, rapid, and healthy development of the national economy, and promote comprehensive social progress. The main economic methods used are to establish mechanisms for coordination and restraint among planning, finance, and fiscal systems, and to strengthen comprehensive coordination of economic operations.
Actively promoting fiscal and tax system reforms has been a key focus of establishing and improving the macroeconomic regulation and control system since the Third Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. In December 1993, the State Council decided to implement a separate tax system, dividing various incomes into fixed incomes for central finance, fixed incomes for local finance, and shared incomes between central and local finance. Correspondingly, the tax collection and management system was adjusted to establish regulated distribution relationships between central and local levels, ensuring the unified financial power and responsibilities of governments at all levels, gradually increasing the proportion of fiscal revenue to the gross domestic product (GDP), appropriately increasing the proportion of central fiscal revenue to enhance the capability of central macroeconomic regulation and control. At the same time, based on the principles of uniform tax law, fair tax burden, simplified tax system, and reasonable division of powers, the value-added tax was mainly implemented, transforming product taxes into consumption taxes, and imposing business taxes on the service industry. A progressive tax system for personal income tax was adopted, gradually forming a fair and competitive environment. Since 1997, further adjustments have been made to the tax policies of the financial and insurance industries, gradually aligning China's tax system with international rules.
Another important measure to strengthen the macroeconomic regulation and control system is to actively promote the reform of the investment and financing system. This mainly involves further strengthening the dominant position of enterprises in investment and financing, and introducing more market competition mechanisms in investment and financing. The system of capitalization is implemented for various operating fixed asset investment projects, and the construction of investment projects must be carried out after the capitalization is implemented. Various financing methods have been introduced in the infrastructure, basic industries, and public utilities' infrastructure construction, extensively absorbing funds from all walks of society and promoting investment and financing to achieve the maximum economic and social benefits.
4. Deepen the reform of the foreign trade system and establish an operating mechanism that adapts to the international economic rules.
To establish a socialist market economic system, it is necessary to fully utilize both the international and domestic markets and resources. This requires regulating foreign economic activities and deepening the reform of the foreign trade system. At that time, three measures were mainly taken.
First, the mandatory planned import for foreign trade was canceled and replaced with a guiding plan. For goods needed for domestic production, construction, and market demand, enterprises organize imports on their own based on market conditions, reducing the number of quota goods and regulating the management methods of imported quota goods. Second, enterprises that meet the conditions are granted import and export operating rights, changing the status of lag in the transformation of foreign trade enterprise operating mechanisms, improving their adaptability to the increasingly fierce international market competition, and cultivating and expanding a group of large foreign trade enterprises with international competitiveness. Third, combining international practices to improve foreign trade laws and regulations, and accelerate the integration of the foreign trade system with international standards, while reducing the overall tariff level. Starting from April 1, 1996, the overall tariff level for more than 4,000 imported goods was reduced to 23%, and it was further reduced to around 17% by October 1, 1997. These measures not only help more competitive foreign goods enter the Chinese market but also promote China's economic development and accelerate its entry into the World Trade Organization.
The transition from a planned economy to a socialist market economy can be described as "crossing the river by feeling the stones." This cannot be criticized. Without experience, opening up a path can only be done in this way. This is the practice theory of Marxism. Through the aforementioned reforms and other reforms, this difficult transition has been basically achieved, and the marketization and socialization of the national economy have significantly improved, and economic vitality has noticeably increased. All of this has created favorable conditions for the continued improvement and perfection of the socialist market economic system.
III. The critical moment in the historical development and the grand banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory held high
After Deng Xiaoping passed away on February 19, 1997, whether the Communist Party of China could continue to hold high the grand banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, and whether China's reform, opening up, and modernization construction could continue to advance along the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics opened up by Deng Xiaoping became a major issue of concern for the entire party, the whole nation, and the world's attention. The Party Central Committee with Jiang Zemin as the core gave a clear answer to this key question concerning the overall development of China. This is: inheriting Deng Xiaoping's will, holding high the banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, and resolutely advancing along the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics pioneered by Deng Xiaoping.
The "Letter to the Party, the Army, and the People of All Ethnic Groups in the Country" issued by the Central Committee and the eulogy by Jiang Zemin at the memorial service for Deng Xiaoping highly evaluated Deng Xiaoping's magnificent revolutionary career of more than seventy years and his immortal contributions to the independence and liberation of the Chinese nation and the socialist modernization of China. The eulogy emphasized that the most precious wealth left to us by Deng Xiaoping is the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics that he established and the basic line of the Party formulated under the guidance of this theory. This is the action guide that must be followed. Raising the banner of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics even higher on the new journey of the new century, better implementing the Party's basic line, is the firm determination and belief of our Party's central leadership collective, as well as the consensus and desire of the whole Party, the army, and the people of all ethnic groups.
On May 29th, Jiang Zemin delivered a speech at the graduation ceremony of the provincial and ministerial-level advanced studies class at the Central Party School, once again emphasizing the issue of holding high the banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory. He said that in the new era of socialist reform, opening up and modernization, and on the new journey across the new century, we must hold high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics to guide our entire cause and all our work. This is an unshakable conclusion drawn by the Party from history and reality. The issue of the banner is crucial. The banner is the direction, and the banner is the image. We must have a high degree of consciousness and firmness on this issue, and we must not waver no matter what difficulties or risks we encounter.
In September 1997, the 15th National Congress of the Party was held, and Jiang Zemin delivered the report titled "Hold High the Great Banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory and Comprehensively Advance the Construction of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics to the 21st Century." The report, from a historical perspective, discussed the great changes in the Chinese nation over a century, pointing out that our nation has experienced three historic and enormous changes in the 20th century, producing three great leaders at the forefront of the times: Sun Yat-sen, who led the 1911 Revolution and overthrew the autocratic system that had ruled China for thousands of years; Mao Zedong, who led the victory of the new democratic revolution, the establishment of New China, and the socialist system; and Deng Xiaoping, who led the reform and opening up and the socialist modernization construction, which is known as the new great revolution. The third historic and enormous change has successfully opened up a new path of building socialism with Chinese characteristics for achieving the rejuvenation of the Chinese nation, the prosperity of the country, and the happiness of the people. The exuberance and vitality of socialism in China have attracted worldwide attention. Deng Xiaoping's great contributions to China and the world have received sincere respect and admiration from the Chinese people and peoples around the world.
The report of the 15th National Congress of the Party further expounded the historical position of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, and for the first time used the term "Deng Xiaoping Theory". Jiang Zemin pointed out: The Communist Party of China attaches great importance to theoretical guidance. The Communist Party of China, under the guidance of Marxism-Leninism, has integrated it with Chinese reality and achieved two historic leaps, producing two major theoretical achievements. The main creator of the first leap is Mao Zedong, and our Party calls it Mao Zedong Thought.
