"The main creator of the second leap is the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, and its main creator is Deng Xiaoping, and our Party calls it Deng Xiaoping Theory." The report of the 15th National Congress of the Party stated when evaluating the historical position of Deng Xiaoping's theory: Deng Xiaoping Theory is "the correct theory that guides the Chinese people to achieve the socialist modernization in the victory of the reform and opening up. In contemporary China, only the theory of Deng Xiaoping, which combines Marxism with the practice and characteristics of contemporary China, can solve the problems facing socialism. Deng Xiaoping Theory is the Marxism of contemporary China and represents a new stage of Marxist development in China.
The report points out that Deng Xiaoping Theory has become a new stage of the development of Marxism in China for the following reasons: First, Deng Xiaoping Theory insists on liberating the mind, seeking truth from facts, inheriting from predecessors, breaking new ground on the basis of new practices, and opening up new horizons for Marxism. Second, Deng Xiaoping Theory adheres to the basic achievements of scientific socialism theory and practice, grasps the fundamental questions of "what is socialism and how to build socialism," profoundly reveals the essence of socialism, and raises the understanding of socialism to a new scientific level. Third, Deng Xiaoping Theory adopts a broad Marxist perspective to observe the world, conducts correct analysis of the modern era's characteristics and the overall international situation, the success and failure of other socialist countries, the gains and losses of developing countries in seeking development, and the development trends and contradictions of developed countries, making new scientific judgments. Fourth, Deng Xiaoping Theory is a scientific system of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics gradually formed and developed based on the historical conditions of peace and development becoming the theme of the times, the practice of reform, opening up, and modernization in our country, and the summary of the historical experience of socialist construction in our country and lessons from the rise and fall of other socialist countries. This theory systematically answers a series of essential questions about the development path, stages, fundamental tasks, driving forces, external conditions, political guarantees, strategic steps, party leadership and support, national reunification, etc. of Chinese socialism, and guides our party in formulating the basic line in the primary stage of socialism. It is a comprehensive scientific system that encompasses philosophy, political economy, scientific socialism, and other fields, covering aspects such as economy, politics, science and technology, education, culture, ethnicity, military, foreign affairs, united front, and party building. Therefore, Jiang Zemin said, "The soul of our congress is to hold high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory."
"In contemporary China, Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory form a unified scientific system. Upholding Deng Xiaoping Theory means genuinely upholding Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought. Holding high the banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory means genuinely holding high the banner of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought." The amendment to the Party Constitution adopted by the congress further established Deng Xiaoping Theory as the guiding ideology of the party and explicitly stipulated that the Communist Party of China takes Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory as its action guide.
The congress also provided new interpretations and summaries of the theory of the primary stage of socialism, which is considered the foundational theory of Deng Xiaoping Theory, enriching and developing the theory first expounded at the 13th National Congress of the Party. This mainly includes the following points: 
(1) It is the first time to explicitly state that our country will remain in the primary stage of socialism for a long period. The comprehensive reform has entered the stage of tackling difficulties, facing numerous contradictions and difficulties, and new doubts need to be clarified. This leads to a further understanding of China's national conditions, the firm belief in the party's basic line and basic policies at the current stage. Only with a correct understanding of the basic national conditions can we believe in why we must implement the current line and policies and not adopt other lines and policies. The report clearly states, "We must proceed from reality in all our work, and the biggest reality is that China is now in and will remain in the primary stage of socialism for a long time. To understand 'what is socialism and how to build socialism,' we must understand what socialism in the primary stage is and how to build socialism in this stage." It is precisely for this reason that the 15th National Congress of the Party once again emphasized the issue of the primary stage of socialism and reinterpreted this theory.
(2) In discussing the definition of the content and characteristics of the primary stage of socialism, we have reached a new height in addressing the questions of "what is socialism and how to build socialism". "What is socialism and how to build socialism" is a fundamental question that Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized based on China's historical experiences. After the publication of Volume 3 of "Selected Works of Deng Xiaoping" in November 1993, the whole Party engaged in studying and discussing this fundamental question, raising the understanding of socialism to a new level. The important characteristic highlighted by the 15th National Congress of the Party regarding the primary stage of socialism is the analysis of the question from this standpoint, which provides a more profound understanding. From this standpoint, the analysis of the content and characteristics of the primary stage of socialism emphasizes that it is a dynamic process of continuous improvement and transformation from one state to another. The 13th National Congress of the Party outlined five basic characteristics of the primary stage. The 15th National Congress of the Party reexamined these characteristics based on new experiences, expanding them into a comprehensive list of nine aspects, including general features, the development of material civilization, the development of spiritual civilization, and the development of political civilization. The summary provided by the 15th National Congress of the Party regarding the basic characteristics of the primary stage of socialism is as follows: The primary stage of socialism is a historical stage characterized by gradually overcoming underdevelopment and achieving the basic modernization of socialism. It is a historical stage in which a predominantly agricultural country with a large rural population and predominantly manual labor gradually transforms into an industrialized country with a majority of non-agricultural population, including modern agriculture and modern service industry. It is a historical stage in which a predominantly natural economy and a semi-natural economy gradually transform into a highly market-oriented economy. It is a historical stage in which a population with a significant illiteracy and semi-literacy rate and backwardness in science, technology, education, and culture gradually transforms into a state with relatively developed science, technology, education, and culture. It is a historical stage in which a population with a significant poverty rate and a low standard of living gradually transforms into a state where the entire population is relatively prosperous. It is a historical stage in which economic and cultural imbalances between regions gradually narrow through development that occurs in certain regions before others. It is a historical stage in which, through reform and exploration, a relatively mature and dynamic socialist market economy system, socialist democratic political system, and other systems are established and improved. It is a historical stage in which the broader population firmly establishes the common ideal of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, strengthens self-reliance, strives for progress, works diligently and frugally, and simultaneously develops material civilization and spiritual civilization. It is a historical stage in which the gap with the world's advanced level gradually narrows, and on the basis of socialism, the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation is achieved.
(3) According to the spirit of Deng Xiaoping's speeches in the southern tour, the primary stage of socialism is affirmed to require at least 100 years. The contradiction between the increasing material and cultural needs of the people, which is the main contradiction in society, and the backwardness of social productive forces will "penetrate the entire process and all aspects of social life in our country during the primary stage of socialism". Only by firmly grasping this main contradiction "can we observe and grasp the overall situation of social contradictions clearly and effectively promote the resolution of various social contradictions", thereby providing a more solid foundation for the statement that "development is the key to solving all problems, and China must rely on its own development".
(4) For the first time, the relationship between "reform, development, and stability", which was proposed after the 14th National Congress of the Party, was included and emphasized within the historical framework of the primary stage of socialism. This not only clarifies the strategic position of handling this relationship in the overall construction of socialist modernization but also further establishes it as a long-term basic policy applicable to the entire primary stage of socialism. This has improved the understanding of the status of the relationship between "reform, development, and stability" and enriched the basic issues that should be grasped during the primary stage of socialism.
The 15th National Congress of the Party's reinterpreted theory on the primary stage of socialism not only makes this fundamental theory of Deng Xiaoping's more in line with the spirit of the times but also provides the theoretical basis for the third-generation leadership to propose a basic outline for the primary stage of socialism.
IV. The formation of the basic outline of the primary stage of socialism.
The 15th National Congress of the Party, based on Deng Xiaoping Theory and the Party's basic line, focused on the goal of building a prosperous, democratic, civilized socialist modern country, and proposed the Party's basic program for the primary stage of socialism in a comparatively complete manner for the first time. If it can be said that the clear summary of the Party's basic line after the first exposition of the theory of the primary stage of socialism is a major theoretical contribution of the 13th National Congress of the Party, then the clear proposal of the Party's basic program in this period at a new height when re-expounding the issue of the primary stage of socialism is a major theoretical contribution of the 15th National Congress of the Party.
The Party's understanding of the basic program for the primary stage of socialism has also gone through an exploration process. As early as 1979, Ye Jianying, on behalf of the Party Central Committee, proposed the goal of comprehensive modernization in his speech commemorating the 30th anniversary of the founding of New China. This is also what Deng Xiaoping reiterated in his subsequent speeches: "Our country has entered a new period of socialist modernization. We must significantly increase social productive forces, reform and improve the socialist economic and political systems, develop highly democratic socialism and a complete socialist legal system. We must simultaneously develop a high level of material civilization, improve the scientific and cultural level of the whole nation, develop a noble and diverse cultural life, and build a highly advanced socialist spiritual civilization." Since then, Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized that there are many tasks in building socialism with Chinese characteristics, and we must adhere to the comprehensive development and progress of socialist society under the precondition of economic construction, without neglecting one for the other. For this reason, he proposed a series of "dual-track" strategic thinking and policies, demanding that during the entire process of reform, opening up, and modernization, we must both promote reform and opening up and crack down on crime, both promote economic construction and advance democracy and the rule of law, both promote material civilization and spiritual civilization. He stressed the need to "grasp both tracks and be equally strong in both". Therefore, Deng Xiaoping Theory is a theory of the comprehensive construction and comprehensive development of the economic, political, and cultural aspects of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
At the Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Party Central Committee, Jiang Zemin pointed out that for the line and a series of basic policies since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, we must be firm and unwavering, and comprehensively implement and consistently adhere to them. In December 1990, the Recommendations of the 7th Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Party on Formulating the Ten-year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the "Eighth Five-Year Plan" put forward several principles for building socialism with Chinese characteristics, involving various aspects such as the economy, politics, and culture. On July 1, 1991, in his speech at the celebration of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Party, Jiang Zemin made a relatively systematic summary of the basic content of the economy, politics, and culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics in accordance with Mao Zedong's discussion on the new democratic revolution. He pointed out:
(1) To build the economy of socialism with Chinese characteristics, we must adhere to the socialist public ownership of the means of production as the mainstay, allow and encourage the development of other economic sectors appropriately, not go for a single public ownership system that is detached from the level of productivity development, and not undermine the leading position of the public ownership economy, and must not privatize. We must establish a distribution system with remuneration according to work as the main form and other forms as supplements, overcoming egalitarianism and preventing polarization, and gradually realize common prosperity for all the people. We must establish an economic system and operational mechanism that adapts to the development of the socialist planned commodity economy, combines planning with market regulation, and plays a positive role in market regulation under the guidance of state laws, regulations, and plans. We must overcome the drawbacks of excessive centralization and over-regulation in the past, but must not overly decentralize and weaken macro-control.
(2) To build the political system of socialism with Chinese characteristics, we must adhere to the people's democratic dictatorship led by the working class and based on the alliance of workers and peasants, and must not weaken or abandon the people's democratic dictatorship. We must adhere to and improve the system of people's congresses and must not adopt the Western parliamentary system. We must adhere to and improve the system of multiparty cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, and must not weaken or negate the leadership of the Communist Party, and must not adopt the Western multi-party system.
(3) To build a culture with Chinese socialist characteristics, we must be guided by Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought, and not engage in the diversification of guiding ideologies. We must adhere to the direction of serving the people and serving socialism, as well as the policy of letting a hundred flowers bloom and a hundred schools of thought contend. We should promote and develop socialist culture, and not allow the proliferation of anything that harms the people, contaminates socialism, or opposes socialism. We must inherit and carry forward the fine cultural traditions of our nation, while fully embodying the spirit of the socialist era. We should base ourselves on our own country, while also absorbing the outstanding achievements of world culture. We must not engage in cultural nihilism or complete westernization. Jiang Zemin emphasized that "the economic, political, and cultural aspects of socialism with Chinese characteristics are an organic whole and inseparable." We must firmly grasp the basic requirements for socialism with Chinese characteristics in the economic, political, and cultural aspects.
Since Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Speech in 1992 and the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, our country has achieved new significant accomplishments in economic, political, and cultural development, and the content of building socialism with Chinese characteristics in these aspects has become richer. Based on this foundation, the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, building on the theoretical content of building socialism with Chinese characteristics summarized by the 14th National Congress led by Deng Xiaoping, further summarized the experience in the economic, political, and cultural aspects of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, and made more insightful explanations on what is socialism with Chinese characteristics in the primary stage, and how to build such an economy, politics, and culture. It formally put forward the party's basic program for the primary stage of socialism. This basic program, revolving around the party's basic line and the goal of socialist modernization, puts forward requirements and tasks in the economic, political, and cultural aspects.
(1) "Building a socialist economy with Chinese characteristics" means developing a market economy under the conditions of socialism, and continuously liberating and developing productive forces. This requires adhering to and improving the basic economic system with socialist public ownership as the mainstay and the common development of diverse forms of ownership; adhering to and improving the socialist market economy system, allowing the market to play a fundamental role in resource allocation under the macro-control of the state; adhering to and improving various distribution methods with remuneration based on labor as the mainstay, allowing some regions and some people to become prosperous first so as to drive and help those who are not wealthy, gradually achieving common prosperity; and adhering to and improving opening up to the outside world, actively participating in international economic cooperation and competition, ensuring the sustained, rapid, and healthy development of the national economy, and allowing the people to share the fruits of economic prosperity. The notion of "developing a market economy under the conditions of socialism, and continuously liberating and developing productive forces" is a new addition based on the summary of Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Speech. It is taken as a fundamental characteristic of building a socialist economy with Chinese characteristics, highlighting a new understanding of the essential requirements of socialism and new approaches to achieving these requirements. It helps us grasp the most essential aspects of building a socialist economy with Chinese characteristics. The report also provides a clearer and more comprehensive explanation of the basic economic system, market economy system, various distribution methods, and opening up to the outside world, which are related to how to build such an economy. The content in the part of the report on economic system reform and development strategy is, in fact, a specific elaboration of building a socialist economy with Chinese characteristics. It breaks through long-standing traditional concepts on a series of issues and further reflects the requirements for developing the economy in the primary stage of socialism.
(2) "Building a socialist political system with Chinese characteristics" means, under the leadership of the Communist Party of China and based on the people being the masters of the country, governing the country according to law and developing socialist democracy. This requires adhering to and improving the people's democratic dictatorship led by the working class and based on the alliance of workers and peasants; adhering to and improving the system of people's congresses and the system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party, as well as the system of regional ethnic autonomy, promoting democracy, improving the legal system, and building a socialist rule of law state. It aims to achieve social stability, clean and efficient government, unity and harmony among all ethnic groups, and a lively political situation. Compared to the content of the speech in July 1991, it emphasizes the overall requirement of "governing the country according to law and developing socialist democracy". In the enumerated basic political systems, the system of ethnic regional autonomy has been added, which is very necessary and in line with the characteristics of our multi-ethnic country in terms of political systems. Since then, the party literature has mentioned that this is a fundamental political system in the current stage of our country. It also adds the requirement of "building a socialist rule of law country" and "clean and efficient government", reflecting both the desires of the broad masses of the people and the efforts the party needs to make to achieve the goal of democratic politics. Taking these two points as the content of building a socialist political system with Chinese characteristics embodies a major progress in the party's democratic and rule of law ideology.
(3) "Building a socialist culture with Chinese characteristics" means, guided by Marxism, aiming to cultivate citizens with ideals, morality, culture, and discipline, developing a socialist culture that is modern, global, future-oriented, national, scientific, and popular. This requires persistently arming the whole party and educating the people with Deng Xiaoping Theory, striving to improve the ideological and moral qualities and educational, scientific, and cultural levels of the entire nation, adhering to the direction of serving the people and socialism, promoting diversity and vigorous academic and artistic activities. It is about building a socialist spiritual civilization that is based on the reality of China, inherits the excellent traditions of history and culture, and absorbs the beneficial achievements of foreign cultures. The content here is based on the speech from July 1991 and has absorbed the new achievements of the resolution on strengthening the construction of socialist spiritual civilization in the sixth plenary session of the 14th Central Committee of the Party in October 1996, thus deepening the understanding. In order to answer concisely and comprehensively what is Chinese socialism with distinctive characteristics, the aforementioned passage "guided by Marxism, aiming to cultivate citizens with ideals, morality, culture, and discipline, developing a socialist culture that is modern, global, future-oriented, national, scientific, and popular" integrates Deng Xiaoping's ideology, encompasses various requirements, and highlights the characteristic of keeping pace with the times. In order to achieve this goal, the "how to build" aspects mentioned, including the requirements of building a socialist culture with Chinese characteristics for the construction of spiritual civilization.
The above basic goals and policies for building the economy, politics, and culture with Chinese characteristics constitute the Party's basic program for the primary stage of socialism. Jiang Zemin pointed out in the report to the 15th National Congress of the Party: "This program is an important content of Deng Xiaoping Theory, representing the unfolding of the Party's basic line in the fields of the economy, politics, and culture and serving as a scientific summary of the main experiences of these years." The proposal of this basic program has important guiding significance for unifying the thinking of the whole Party and uniting people of all ethnic groups throughout the country to strive for the cause of building socialism with Chinese characteristics.
Chapter 8: Developing Socialist Democracy and Building Socialist Spiritual Civilization with Chinese Characteristics
I. Actively promoting the construction of socialist democracy
The construction of democratic politics is an important part of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. After entering the new stage of reform and opening up, the Party Central Committee, with Jiang Zemin as the core, deepened its understanding of China's national conditions and the changing situation, and adopted more practical measures to promote political system reform and build a socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics, achieving fruitful results in institutional construction and other aspects.
1. The proposal of the guideline "actively and steadily promote political system reform"
Deng Xiaoping was the chief designer of reform and opening up and modernization construction, as well as the chief designer of political system reform. In his speeches, he clearly stated the fundamental goals and overall framework of political system reform in China. After the Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee, the Party Central Committee, with Jiang Zemin as the core, consistently adhered to Deng Xiaoping's ideas on political system reform and further proposed the guideline of "actively and steadily promoting political system reform". In July 1995, Jiang Zemin pointed out, "While implementing economic system reforms, we actively and steadily promote political system reforms and strive to build a socialist democratic political system with Chinese characteristics." In his speech at the commemoration of the 20th anniversary of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in December 1998, he continued to emphasize, "We must actively and steadily promote political system reforms. This is an inherent requirement for the self-improvement and development of our socialist political system, and it is also an important decision made by our Party based on the summary of historical and practical experiences." This decision is a fundamental guideline of great significance in the course of China's political system reform and development.
The guideline of "actively and steadily promoting political system reforms" has two implications. Firstly, political system reforms continue to progress without interruption, despite accusations from some domestic and foreign sources regarding political disputes. As stated in the report of the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, "We actively promote political system reforms, giving significant development to socialist democracy and the establishment of the rule of law." Following this, the Communist Party of China has made tremendous efforts to strengthen the basic political system, improve democratic centralism, and enhance the scientific and democratic mechanisms for decision-making, as well as to strengthen grassroots democracy construction. Therefore, claims that political system reforms in China have stalled are unfounded. Secondly, the basic guideline for promoting political system reforms is to do so "actively and steadily." The term "actively" means that political system reforms must not cease and must advance with a positive attitude. Particularly when the economic system reforms enter a critical stage and the socialist market economy system needs further improvement, political system reforms must be adapted accordingly. As the economic system reforms deepen, the defects in certain specific leadership systems and work mechanisms will become institutional barriers to economic and social development. Jiang Zemin pointed out in June 2000 that in order to achieve a relatively perfect new socialist market economy system, a series of deep-rooted problems need to be resolved, including "the government's management system and operation mechanism, as well as the leadership system of the Party and the country, which all require deeper reforms to further improve and enhance." Regarding systemic innovation, "it is necessary to continuously improve various aspects of the system that are in line with the requirements of developing a socialist market economy and comprehensively constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics." The term "steadily" is used because political system reforms are an extremely complex undertaking with great difficulties. According to Deng Xiaoping, even until the mid-1980s, "we still hadn't completely figured it out". "This issue is very difficult, each reform involves a wide range of people and matters, it is profound, and touches the interests of many individuals. It will encounter many obstacles, so it needs to be approached with caution... Our country is so large, the situation is so complex, and reforms are not easy. Therefore, decision-making must be careful." Jiang Zemin pointed out in the report of the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, "The construction of a socialist democratic politics is an incremental historical process that needs to be approached step by step and in an orderly manner, taking into account our national conditions and under the leadership of the Party." Therefore, political system reforms cannot be rushed and can only be pursued with an "active and steady" approach.
Based on Deng Xiaoping's overall goals for political system reform and the specific requirements of "figuring it out", further integrate and advance the train of thought for political system reforms. Jiang Zemin stated in the report of the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, "At present and in the future, the main tasks of political system reform are: developing democracy, strengthening the rule of law, implementing the separation of government and enterprises, streamlining institutions, improving the system of democratic supervision, and maintaining stability and unity." In April 2001, he proposed six principles for advancing political system reforms:
(1) Reform the leadership system of the Party and the state, not to weaken the leadership of the Party, but to strengthen and improve it. To be conducive to consolidating the socialist system, to be conducive to consolidating the leadership of the party, and to be conducive to the development of social productive forces under the leadership of the party and the socialist system.
(2) The goal of reform is to always maintain the vitality of the party and the country, overcome bureaucracy, improve work efficiency, expand grassroots democracy, and mobilize the enthusiasm of grassroots workers, farmers, and intellectuals.
(3) Persistently strengthen and improve internal party democracy to continuously promote the development of people's democracy.
(4) The success of reform depends on whether the country's political situation is stable, whether it can enhance the unity of the people of all ethnic groups, improve people's lives, and whether productive forces can achieve sustained development.
(5) We must not discard the superiority of our socialist system and should not adopt the so-called Western democracy system. The content and steps of reform should be determined based on our own practices and circumstances.
(6) Political system reform is very complex, and every measure involves the interests of millions of people. It should be carried out in a step-by-step, orderly manner under leadership.
These principles have made the thinking for promoting political system reform along a positive, prudent, and correct path increasingly firm and clear.
2. Improve the system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party of China
The system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party of China is a basic political system of our country and an important aspect of political system reform. In 1987, when the 13th National Congress of the Party put forward the task of political system reform, it proposed to improve the "system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party of China."
After the 13th National Congress of the Party, members of the democratic parties in Beijing and non-party members put forward their views and opinions on the issue of "multi-party cooperation." In early January 1989, Deng Xiaoping commented after reading: "An ad hoc group can be organized (with members from democratic parties), specifically to formulate a plan for the participation and supervision responsibilities of members of the democratic parties, to be completed within a year, and to be implemented starting next year." According to Deng Xiaoping's instructions, the ad hoc group consisted of leaders of the democratic parties and officials from the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, the State Council, the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, the Central Organization Department, the Central Propaganda Department, the United Front Work Department, and other relevant departments. After more than a year of efforts, the drafting work was completed. In February 1990, the People's Daily published the "Opinions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Adhering to and Improving the System of Multi-Party Cooperation and Political Consultation under the Leadership of the Communist Party of China" (referred to as the "Opinions"), making provisions on various issues.
(1) Regarding the form of political consultation. "Opinions" summarize the effective experience between the Communist Party of China and the democratic parties since the founding of the People's Republic of China, and propose the following forms of consultation: First, the main leaders of the Communist Party of China should invite the main leaders of the democratic parties and representatives of non-party individuals to hold high-level, small-scale talks as needed, freely discussing common concerns, exchanging ideas, and seeking opinions. Second, the Communist Party of China should hold symposiums for the democratic parties and non-party individuals, briefing or exchanging important information, conveying important documents, and listening to policy suggestions or discussions on certain topics proposed by the democratic parties and non-party individuals. Third, in addition to conference consultations, the democratic parties and non-party individuals can submit written policy suggestions to the Communist Party of China on major issues concerning the national political direction and modernization construction, or invite responsible leaders of the Communist Party of China for direct conversations.
(2) Regarding the role of democratic parties in the People's Congress. "Opinions" stipulate that members of democratic parties and non-party individuals should account for an appropriate proportion among national deputies, members of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, and members of the specialized standing committees, and qualified members of democratic parties and non-party individuals with corresponding expertise can be hired as advisors to the specialized standing committees. People's Congress at the provincial, autonomous region, and municipality levels should ensure that members of democratic parties and non-party individuals account for an appropriate proportion. In the People's Congress at the city, prefecture, and county levels, the proportion of non-party individuals should be ensured. For cities, prefectures, and counties with democratic party organizations, members of democratic parties should account for an appropriate proportion in the People's Congress.
(3) Regarding the appointment of members of democratic parties and non-party individuals to leadership positions in various levels of government and judicial institutions. "Opinions" suggest taking practical measures to select and assign members of democratic parties and non-party individuals to leadership positions in the State Council and its relevant ministries and commissions, as well as county-level and higher local governments and their relevant departments. Qualified members of democratic parties and non-party individuals should be elected to leadership positions in procuratorate and judicial organs. A group of qualified democratic party members and non-party individuals with specialized knowledge should be appointed as special inspectors, prosecutors, auditors, and education supervisors. Members of democratic parties and non-party individuals can participate in the investigation of major cases organized by government supervisory, auditing, industrial and commercial departments, as well as inspections related to taxation.
(4) Regarding the role of democratic parties in the People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC). The CPPCC should become an important place for parties, people's organizations, and representatives from all sectors to unite, cooperate, and participate in political consultation. "Opinions" explicitly stipulate that in various meetings of the CPPCC, the freedom to criticize and express different opinions should be effectively guaranteed for CPPCC members. Democratic parties and non-party individuals should be assured a certain proportion among members of the CPPCC Standing Committee and CPPCC leadership. Democratic party members and non-party individuals should participate in the specialized committees of the CPPCC, and a certain number of democratic party members and non-party individuals should hold full-time leadership positions in the CPPCC organs, truly possessing duties, powers, and responsibilities.
The purpose of the Communist Party of China's formulation of this "Opinion" is to further enhance the role of democratic parties in political consultation and democratic supervision. In accordance with this requirement, "Opinions" specify a series of issues regarding the democratic parties' political consultation: firstly, the purpose of participating in political consultation is clearly stated; secondly, the differences between the system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation led by the Communist Party of China and the multi-party system in the West are clearly pointed out; thirdly, the relationship between the Communist Party of China and the democratic parties is clearly defined; fourthly, the basic principles of cooperation between the Communist Party of China and the democratic parties are further clarified; fifthly, the basic points of the democratic parties' political consultation are indicated; sixthly, the general principles for the democratic parties to exercise supervisory roles are specified; seventhly, the activity guidelines for the democratic parties are regulated.
This "Opinion" is a summary of the positive and negative experiences of the system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation led by the Communist Party of China through long-term revolutionary and construction practices. In terms of practice, it is a sign of the institutionalization and standardization of the system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party of China. In terms of theory, it enriches and develops the theory of Marxist party relations by summarizing the long-term cooperation between the Communist Party of China and various democratic parties. The formulation and implementation of this "Opinion" is an important step in promoting political system reform and strengthening the construction of socialist democratic politics. It has significant and far-reaching implications for fully leveraging the advantages of the socialist system led by the Communist Party of China and developing socialist democratic politics. In December 2000, Jiang Zemin pointed out in his speech at the national united front work conference, "The system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation led by the Communist Party is the crystallization of the political experience and wisdom of the Chinese people. The prominent feature of our political system lies in the leadership of the Communist Party, the cooperation of multiple parties, the Communist Party in power, and the participation of multiple parties in politics. The democratic parties are not opposition parties or parties outside the government, but friendly parties and participating parties that closely cooperate with the Communist Party. The Communist Party and the democratic parties engage in democratic consultation and scientific decision-making on major state issues, concentrating their efforts on accomplishing major tasks. The Communist Party and the democratic parties supervise each other, promoting the improvement of Communist Party leadership and the strengthening of the construction of participating parties. This not only avoids the political turmoil caused by multi-party competition and confrontation, but also avoids the various drawbacks caused by one-party dictatorship and lack of supervision. The great advantage of our party system lies here, and this is also the fundamental difference from the one-party system and multi-party system in foreign countries." This speech made a profound summary of the political advantages of this basic political system and enriched the theory of Marxist China-style democratic political construction.
3. Developing grassroots autonomy and expanding grassroots democracy
There was a significant change in the overall thinking of political system reform before and after the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China. Before the 14th National Congress, the main approach was to promote it from top to bottom. After the 14th National Congress, based on the principle of addressing easy issues before difficult ones, the focus shifted to promoting the construction of grassroots democratic political systems through a combination of bottom-up and top-down approaches, positioning it as one of the socialist democratic systems that must be adhered to and improved.
The main contents of the construction of grassroots democratic politics include: strengthening the autonomy of rural villagers, establishing and improving villagers' committees; promoting and improving the system of residents' autonomy in urban communities; fully leveraging the role of enterprise workers' congresses, institutionalizing workers' participation in democratic management. Regarding the autonomy of rural villagers, after the legal status of villagers' committees as grassroots mass self-governing organizations in rural areas was established in the Constitution passed in 1982, the Standing Committee of the Sixth National People's Congress passed the "Organic Law of the Villagers' Committees of the People's Republic of China (Trial)" in November 1987, which clearly defined the nature, functions, and related issues of villagers' committees. In November 1994, the Communist Party of China issued a notice, requiring various localities to conscientiously implement this law when strengthening the construction of grassroots Party organizations in rural areas,establishing and improving villagers' committees and village groups, improving the system of villagers' autonomy, and better utilizing the self-management, self-education, and self-service capabilities of grassroots mass self-governing organizations. Regarding the construction of the system of residents' autonomy in urban communities, after the system of residents' committees was written into the Constitution of the People's Republic of China in 1982, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress enacted the "Organic Law of Urban Residents' Committees" in 1989, which provided legal guarantees for the development of urban residents' committees. Regarding workers' congresses, as the basic system for implementing democratic management and coordinating labor relations in enterprises, it increasingly emphasizes its irreplaceable role in promoting democratic management, protecting the legitimate rights and interests of workers, and advancing the stable development of enterprises.
The 15th National Congress of the Communist Party fully affirmed and recognized the practice of expanding grassroots democracy and ensuring the direct exercise of democratic rights by the people, considering it as the most extensive practice of socialist democracy. It further demanded the improvement of democratic election systems and the implementation of transparency in governmental affairs and finance at the grassroots level. It emphasized the importance of allowing the masses to participate in discussions and decision-making regarding grassroots public affairs and public welfare, as well as implementing democratic supervision over cadres. The democratic management system in enterprises and institutions, with workers' congresses as its basic form, should also be continued, improved, and utilized to involve workers in reforms and management, and protect their legitimate rights and interests. The Congress also emphasized the need to rectify behaviors that suppress democracy or enforce orders. In accordance with these requirements, in April 1998, the General Office of the Central Committee of the Communist Party and the General Office of the State Council issued the "Notice on the Universal Implementation of Village Affairs Transparency and Democratic Management Systems in Rural Areas," which put forward more specific requirements for improving democratic elections, decision-making, management, and supervision. In the same year, in June, the State Council presented the "Revised Draft of the Organic Law of the Village Committee of the People's Republic of China," which was reviewed and passed by the Standing Committee of the Ninth National People's Congress in November of the same year. Subsequently, the work of electing members of village committees through democratic elections began in rural areas across the country, and the system of village self-governance gradually improved. By the end of 2004, there were 644,000 village committees established nationwide. The majority of provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities had completed the turnover elections of the fifth and sixth committees.
In terms of urban grassroots democratic development, in 1999, the Ministry of Civil Affairs carried out community development pilot projects in 26 urban areas nationwide, strengthening the construction of residents' committees and implementing democratic elections, decision-making, management, and supervision. By the end of 2004, 71,375 residents' committees had been established nationwide. As of September 2004, 595,000 workers' congresses had been established in enterprises and institutions, covering 78.36 million workers, accounting for 58.5%.
With the deepening of economic system reform, the central government has emphasized the active role of workers' congresses in democratic management and supervision in state-owned enterprises. In October 1998, Jiang Zemin stated, "Implementing democratic management by workers and the masses in state-owned enterprises, just like implementing village self-governance in rural areas, is an important creation of our construction of socialist democratic politics with Chinese characteristics. In carrying out various work in enterprises, democratic management by workers and the masses can only be strengthened and must not be weakened. The more significant the issues related to enterprise reform, development, and the vital interests of the masses, the more we must genuinely listen to the opinions of the workers through workers' congresses and other forms, truly achieve collective consultation and concerted efforts, and jointly promote the operation, management, and efficiency of enterprises." Workers' congresses in many enterprises have played a positive role in grassroots political development and enterprise reform and development.
II. Implementing the basic strategy of governing the country in accordance with the law
The development of socialist democracy must be closely integrated with the improvement of socialist legal system. This is an important task and inevitable requirement for the development of socialist democratic politics. One important aspect of advancing political system reform is to continuously strengthen the construction of socialist legal systems. The 13th National Congress of the Communist Party made new explorations in strengthening the construction of socialist legal systems when it discussed political system reform, gradually institutionalizing and legalizing socialist democratic politics in China. Guided by this ideology, the construction of legal systems and other systems in China has steadily progressed. In April 1990, the Central Committee issued the "Circular on Maintaining Social Stability and Strengthening Political and Legal Work," which stated, "Strengthening socialist democracy and legal systems is an important aspect of improving the socialist system and an important guarantee for maintaining social stability." To strengthen the leadership of political and legal work, political and legal committees were reestablished from the central to local levels.
In 1992, while establishing the goal of reforming the socialist market economy system, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China (CPC) put forward new requirements for improving socialist legal system. Jiang Zemin pointed out, "Strengthening legislation, especially formulating and improving laws and regulations that safeguard reform and opening up, strengthen macroeconomic management, and regulate microeconomic behavior, is an urgent requirement for establishing the socialist market economy system." After the 14th National Congress, through the reform practice of establishing the socialist market economy system, the CPC Central Committee repeatedly emphasized that the establishment and improvement of the socialist market economy system must be regulated and guaranteed by comprehensive legal frameworks. Economic management must be carried out using legal means, and there must be a unity between reform and opening up and the construction of the legal system. Therefore, the "Decision on Several Issues concerning the Establishment of the Socialist Market Economy System" (1993) specifically outlined the goals of legal construction, including following the principles specified in the Constitution, accelerating economic legislation, further improving civil and commercial laws, criminal laws, and laws related to state institutions and administrative management. By the end of the 20th century, a legal system adapted to the socialist market economy should be established. It also called for reforms to improve the judicial system and administrative law enforcement mechanism, enhance the standards of judiciary and administrative law enforcement, establish sound law enforcement supervision mechanisms and legal service institutions, carry out in-depth legal education, and enhance the legal consciousness and rule of law awareness of the entire society. These goals reflect the need for the development of the socialist market economy and embody the requirement of governing the country according to the law.
Starting from December 1994, the CPC Central Committee began irregularly organizing legal lectures at the Huiren Hall in Zhongnanhai. The members of the Politburo Standing Committee, the Central Secretariat, and the State Council's leaders took the lead in attending and studying legal knowledge, creating an atmosphere in the Party and the whole society to willingly learn the law, apply the law, and enhance legal awareness. In February 1996, during the third legal lecture organized by the central authorities, Jiang Zemin proposed the idea of "governing the country according to the law." In his summary speech, he said that strengthening the construction of the socialist legal system and governing the country according to the law is an important component of Deng Xiaoping Theory on building socialism with Chinese characteristics, as well as a crucial guideline for our Party and government to manage state and social affairs. Realizing and adhering to the rule of law means gradually making all work of the country more standardized and institutionalized, allowing broad masses of people to participate in the country's management, economic and cultural affairs, and social affairs according to the provisions of the Constitution and laws through various channels and forms under the leadership of the Party. This also means gradually achieving institutionalization and institutionalization of socialist democracy. Realizing and adhering to the rule of law has significant importance for promoting sustained, rapid and healthy economic development, comprehensive social progress, and ensuring long-term stability of the country. In March of the same year, during the 4th session of the 8th National People's Congress, "governing the country according to the law" was established as the goal and direction of the political system reform and was written into the "Ninth Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the Outline of the Long-Range Goals for the Year 2010" approved at the session.
In 1997, when making strategic arrangements for the development across the century, the 15th National Congress of the CPC elevated "governing the country according to the law" to a more prominent position as a governance strategy. The report of the 15th National Congress of the CPC stated: The democratic development must be closely combined with the improvement of the legal system to implement governance according to the law. Governing the country according to the law and building a socialist legal system are the fundamental strategies for the Party to lead the people in governing the country, the objective needs of developing the socialist market economy, important signs of social progress, and important guarantees for long-term stability of the country. In March 1999, the 2nd session of the 9th National People's Congress passed a constitutional amendment that fixed "governing the country according to the law and building a socialist legal system" in the form of a fundamental law of the state.
Since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CPC Central Committee, China has made great achievements in socialist legal construction. In terms of legislation, in addition to amending the Constitution and four amendments to the Constitution, by the end of 2002, the National People's Congress and its Standing Committee had formulated 297 laws and passed decisions on 125 legal issues. The State Council formulated 933 administrative regulations. China's socialist legal system has taken shape preliminarily. After the 15th National Congress of the CPC, guided by the basic strategy of "governing the country according to the law and building a socialist legal system," efforts have been made to further strengthen legislation and promote judicial system reform, striving to achieve the goal of forming a socialist legal system with Chinese characteristics by 2010.
III. Enrichment and Development of the Socialist Spiritual Civilization Construction Ideology in Practice
While promoting reform and opening up and focusing on economic development, the ideology of building socialist spiritual civilization has gradually been enriched. The Resolution on the Guiding Principles for the Construction of Socialist Spiritual Civilization, adopted in September 1986, played an important role in the practice of spiritual civilization construction. In early 1992, Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Speech elevated the construction of spiritual civilization to a new height, emphasizing the need to both grasp economic development and strengthen the construction of the two civilizations, surpassing capitalism. The 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China made it clear that "both material civilization and spiritual civilization must be well developed in order to have socialism with Chinese characteristics," and it included the construction of socialist spiritual civilization as one of the driving forces for the development of socialism with Chinese characteristics, emphasizing the importance of spiritual civilization construction. These statements not only further clarified the important position of spiritual civilization construction in the development of socialism with Chinese characteristics, but also further clarified the basic principles for constructing spiritual civilization. The principle of "emphasizing the construction of spiritual civilization" is a scientific conclusion drawn from summarizing past lessons. It requires the use of methods such as discussion, reasoning, education, and guidance to solve issues of ideological nature. Only by persisting in "emphasizing construction" in this way can the enthusiasm and creativity of the broad masses of the people be fully mobilized to construct socialism with Chinese characteristics that is vibrant and full of vitality. This is a significant step forward in guiding the construction of socialist spiritual civilization.
Under the promotion of the Southern Tour Speech and the spirit of the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the Central Committee of the Party has explored new theories and practices in strengthening ideological and moral construction, as well as the development of education, science, and culture, and has made new progress.
In terms of strengthening ideological and moral construction, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China emphasized the need to vigorously carry out education on the Party's basic line, patriotism, collectivism, and socialist ideology among the people of all ethnic groups, especially young people, in order to establish correct ideals, beliefs, and values. After the congress, various forms of education activities on patriotism, collectivism, and socialism were widely carried out throughout society. On August 23, 1994, the Communist Party of China Central Committee promulgated the "Outline for the Implementation of Patriotic Education," which provided clear principles, main contents, and work priorities for patriotic education, and required relevant departments at all levels to regard patriotism as the fundamental project for strengthening the construction of socialist spiritual civilization. On August 30, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China promulgated the "Opinions on Further Strengthening and Improving Moral Education in Schools," which required the education front to take a historical perspective and recognize the importance of moral education in the new era with a strategic vision. In accordance with the central requirements, party committees at all levels made plans and deployments for carrying out patriotic education universally, and made efforts to improve the construction of patriotic education bases and create a social atmosphere for patriotic education.
In terms of propaganda and ideological work, Jiang Zemin, in his speech at the National Conference on Propaganda and Ideological Work in January 1994, proposed that propaganda and ideological work must arm people with scientific theories, guide public opinion correctly, shape people with noble spirits, and inspire people with excellent works, continuously cultivating and fostering generations of socialistic new individuals with ideals, morals, culture, and discipline, and playing a strong role in providing ideological and public opinion support for the great cause of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics. This is not only the guiding principle for cultural publicity in the new era, but also has an important guiding role in improving the effectiveness of various measures for spiritual civilization construction.
In terms of developing the education sector, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China further emphasized the need to prioritize education and strive to improve the ideological, moral, and scientific literacy of the whole nation, which is the fundamental plan for realizing the modernization of our country. In light of this, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China solemnly announced that by the end of the 20th century, the eradication of illiteracy among young and middle-aged adults and the basic realization of a nine-year compulsory education system would be achieved. The China Youth Development Foundation launched the "Hope Project" in October 1989, which aims to rescue out-of-school youth and support education in impoverished areas through social fundraising. After the implementation of this project, it immediately received widespread support from all sectors of society. In May 1990, the first "Hope Elementary School" was established in Jinzhai County, Anhui Province. The launch of the "Hope Project" is like building a bridge for impoverished children to access education, effectively promoting the development of education.
In terms of cultural development, it emphasizes the promotion of the main theme of the times. In 1991, advocated by the CPC Central Committee, the Propaganda Department organized the implementation of the "Five Ones Project" aimed at promoting the main theme of the times and excellent traditional culture in the spiritual civilization construction. Provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the Central Government, and central state organs participate in the evaluation. Each year, one good book, one good play, one excellent film, one excellent TV series, and one good theoretical article are produced (later adding one good song, one good radio drama, one good TV theoretical special, etc.). After the implementation of this project, outstanding works that promote the main theme of the times and enthusiastically extol the reform and opening up and socialist modernization construction continue to emerge, making efforts to address major theoretical and practical issues in reality.
With the gradual implementation of various measures for spiritual civilization construction, the relationship between spiritual civilization construction and economic and social development has become increasingly close. In September 1995, at the Fifth Plenary Session of the 14th CPC Central Committee and the Fourth Session of the Eighth National People's Congress in March 1996, the resolution on the "Ninth Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the 2010 Vision" and the report on the resolution incorporated spiritual civilization construction into the planning of economic and social development.
In order to strengthen the Party's guidance on spiritual civilization construction under the conditions of the socialist market economy system, the Sixth Plenary Session of the 14th CPC Central Committee in October 1996 passed the "Resolution on Several Important Issues in Strengthening the Construction of Socialist Spiritual Civilization" (referred to as the "Resolution"). This is the second resolution issued by the Party Central Committee within ten years for the purpose of strengthening the construction of socialist spiritual civilization. This resolution focuses on the grand goal of China's development across the century, further clarifies the guiding ideology, overall requirements, and main goals for the construction of socialist spiritual civilization in the future 15 years. The "Resolution" points out that the guiding ideology and overall requirements for spiritual civilization construction are: guided by Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, adhere to the Party's basic line and basic principles, strengthen the construction of ideology and morality, develop education, science and culture, arm people with scientific theories, guide public opinions correctly, shape people with noble spirits, inspire people with outstanding works, cultivate socialist citizens with ideals, morals, culture, and discipline, improve the ideological and ethical quality and scientific and cultural quality of the entire nation, unite and mobilize all ethnic peoples to build our country into a prosperous, democratic, and civilized socialist modernized country.
Regarding the main goals of the construction of socialist spiritual civilization from 1996 to 2010, the "Resolution" stipulates: firmly establish the common ideal of building socialism with Chinese characteristics among the whole nation, firmly establish the unwavering belief in adhering to the Party's basic line; achieve significant improvement in the quality of citizens, with ideological and moral cultivation, scientific education level, and democratic legal concept as the main contents; achieve significant improvement in the quality of cultural life, with active, healthy, colorful, and service-oriented demands as the main requirements; achieve significant improvement in the degree of urban and rural civilization, with social atmosphere, public order, and living environment as the main indicators; and form a good situation of coordinated development between material civilization construction and spiritual civilization construction nationwide.
"The Resolution" provides a preliminary summary of the experience of carrying out spiritual civilization construction in the new situation of socialist market economy. It fully affirms that the development of socialist market economy is conducive to enhancing people's self-awareness, competition awareness, efficiency awareness, democratic and legal awareness, and pioneering and innovative spirit. At the same time, it clearly points out that the weaknesses and negative aspects of the market will also be reflected in spiritual life. Strengthening spiritual civilization construction requires guiding people to handle the relationships between competition and cooperation, autonomy and supervision, efficiency and fairness, early prosperity and late prosperity, economic efficiency and social benefits. It advocates giving priority to the interests of the state and the people while fully respecting the legitimate interests of individual citizens, strictly preventing the introduction of the principle of commodity exchange in economic activities into the political life of the Party and the administrative work of state organs. These experiences reflect the Party's new thinking on the issue of spiritual civilization construction under market economy conditions. The "Resolution" adopted at the Sixth Plenary Session of the 14th CPC Central Committee marks a new level of the Party's understanding of spiritual civilization construction.
After the Sixth Plenary Session of the 14th CPC Central Committee, various regions and departments, in order to implement the spirit of the plenary session, have included increasing investment in spiritual civilization construction and carrying out mass spiritual civilization creation activities as important contents in formulating development plans and long-term goals. In order to ensure the implementation of the "Resolution" organizationally, in May 1997, the CPC Central Committee decided to establish the Central Committee for the Guiding of Spiritual Civilization Construction as the decision-making body for guiding the construction of national spiritual civilization. Subsequently, corresponding institutions were established in various provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities to strengthen spiritual civilization construction. Mass activities with the main content of creating civilized cities, civilized towns and villages, and civilized industries have thrived all over the country, presenting a vivid scene of all parties jointly building and the masses actively participating, creating a favorable atmosphere for reform, opening up, and economic construction.
IV. Developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics
Developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics is an inevitable requirement for comprehensively promoting the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and it is also the goal of socialist spiritual civilization construction. The leading collective of the Central Committee with Jiang Zemin as the core made concerted efforts to explore a correct path for the development of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics.
In his speech celebrating the 40th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1989, Jiang Zemin pointed out: "In essence, the construction of spiritual civilization is to improve the quality of the whole nation and cultivate 'new people' with the 'four virtues'. It is inconceivable that a nation without a strong spiritual pillar can stand on its own among the nations of the world." He emphasized the need to actively absorb all excellent achievements from our country's historical culture and foreign cultures, and "oppose national nihilism and worship of foreign things that negate traditional Chinese culture". In his speech commemorating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Communist Party of China in 1991, Jiang Zemin elaborated on the guiding ideology, basic elements, and development direction of socialist cultural construction. He pointed out that we must "resist and eliminate all backward and decadent ideological and cultural influences, and constantly create a new, advanced, and healthy socialist culture." "Only by deeply rooted in the Chinese soil and relying on the power of the people, facing modernization, facing the world, and facing the future, can we create a socialist culture worthy of the great era." Here, the seed of developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics has sprouted.
In 1997, the report of the 15th CPC National Congress provided an exposition of the program for building socialist culture with Chinese characteristics, adding the requirement of developing "a scientific, popular, and socialist culture that is rooted in the nation, inherits the fine cultural traditions of history, and absorbs beneficial achievements from foreign cultures." The new summary of "building a socialist culture with Chinese characteristics" by the 15th CPC National Congress highlights its "cultural" nature and is connected to the connotation of socialist spiritual civilization in the basic sense. Jiang Zemin pointed out: "As for the main content of the culture with Chinese characteristics, it is consistent with the socialist spiritual civilization we have consistently advocated since the reform and opening up. Culture is relative to the economy and politics." Spiritual civilization is relative to material civilization. Only with the coordinated development of economy, politics, and culture, and only when both civilizations are well established, can it be considered as socialism with Chinese characteristics." Here, it clearly explains the different corresponding relationships between "civilization" and "culture". It is based on this understanding that, in order to gradually improve their respective corresponding relationships, starting from the 15th National Party Congress, this new expression of changing perspective has become a symbol of the transformation of the theory of socialist spiritual civilization construction towards the development of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics.
After Jiang Zemin's speech on the "Three Represents" in February 2000, the idea of developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics became increasingly prominent. In the important ideology of the "Three Represents," the concept of "advanced culture" not only attracted special attention but also closely linked the development of advanced culture with the party's construction. Jiang Zemin said, "Because our party represents the forward direction of advanced culture, all party comrades must always adhere to the guidance of Marxism, strive to inherit and develop all the fine cultural traditions of the Chinese nation, learn and absorb all the excellent cultural achievements from foreign countries, thereby continuously creating and promoting socialist culture with Chinese characteristics, achieving the coordinated development of socialist material civilization and spiritual civilization, and promoting comprehensive progress in society." In his speech on July 1, 2001, Jiang Zemin reviewed the forward direction of the Chinese Communist Party representing advanced culture from a historical perspective, and expounded on the theory and practice principles of the Chinese Communist Party continuing to represent the forward direction of China's advanced culture from a current perspective. He pointed out, "Our party must always represent the forward direction of China's advanced culture, that is, the party's theory, line, program, policy, and all work must strive to embody the requirements of developing a modern, world-oriented, future-oriented, national, scientific, and popular socialist culture, promote the continuous improvement of the ideological, moral, and scientific cultural qualities of the entire nation, and provide spiritual and intellectual support for our country's economic development and social progress." He also said, "In contemporary China, developing advanced culture means developing the culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics, which is the construction of socialist spiritual civilization." Therefore, the relationship between the three concepts of "advanced culture," "culture with Chinese characteristics," and "socialist spiritual civilization" becomes clear at a glance, and their connotations are equivalent. The speech on July 1st also discussed comprehensively grasping the dialectical relationship between the construction of the two civilizations, firmly grasping the development trend and requirements of China's advanced culture, the fundamental task of developing socialist culture, and the relationship between the development of socialist culture and the inheritance and promotion of all excellent cultures, as well as fully reflecting the spirit of the times and the spirit of creativity. Thus, the basic framework for developing the advanced culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics was constructed. The report of the 16th National Party Congress in 2002 further elaborated on the chapters of "economic construction and economic system reform," "political construction and political system reform," and "cultural construction and cultural system reform." In the chapter on "cultural construction and cultural system reform," a comprehensive discussion was conducted on the content of socialist advanced culture with Chinese characteristics, and the overall requirements for developing socialist advanced culture with Chinese characteristics in the new century were put forward.
Based on Jiang Zemin's above explication, developing advanced culture with Chinese characteristics in socialism with Chinese characteristics generally includes the following basic principles.
First, adhere to the guidance of Marxism. Jiang Zemin pointed out, "What kind of cultural direction to adhere to and promote, is a banner for a political party in terms of ideology and spirit." Adhering to the guiding position of Marxism, in terms of guiding ideology, diversity is never allowed, and it is the fundamental principle of building Chinese socialist culture.
Second, adhere to the fundamental task of cultivating "Four-Have" citizens as the construction of socialist advanced culture with Chinese characteristics. "The fundamental task of developing socialist culture is to cultivate generation after generation of citizens who have ideals, morals, culture, and discipline. "This is a comprehensive requirement for the overall quality of all citizens. Whether it is about the construction of socialist spiritual civilization or the development of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics, this task must be undertaken. It is the fundamental driving force for the progress and development of the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
The third is to adhere to the direction of "two orientations" and the policy of "the Two Centenaries". Serving the people and serving socialism are the fundamental purposes of developing socialist culture. "Let a hundred flowers bloom and a hundred schools of thought contend" is the basic policy for building socialist culture. After the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party, Deng Xiaoping and Jiang Zemin emphasized many times that the policy of "the Two Centenaries" must not be changed or abandoned and must be firmly adhered to forever. The policy of "the Two Centenaries" reflects the characteristics and laws of the development of cultural undertakings and is the fundamental policy for promoting the prosperity and development of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics.
The fourth is to adhere to the development orientation of "facing modernization, facing the world, and facing the future". The "three orientations" guarantee that the construction of socialist culture with Chinese characteristics has distinct characteristics of the times. To achieve the "three orientations", it is necessary to simultaneously adhere to the policy of "using the past for the present and using foreign things for China". "We must extract the essence from the national traditional culture, discard the dross, combine it with the characteristics of the times, make innovations, and continuously promote its development. We must also actively absorb all the outstanding cultural achievements created by humanity and integrate them into the socialist culture with Chinese characteristics. Only by deeply rooted in the Chinese land and relying on the strength of the people, facing modernization, facing the world, and facing the future, can we create a socialist culture that is worthy of the great times."
The fifth is to adhere to the characteristics and characteristics of the "national, scientific, and popular culture" of socialist culture with Chinese characteristics. Its "nationality" lies in its deep origins in the five thousand years of civilization history of the Chinese nation and its roots in the practice of socialism with Chinese characteristics; it not only has national forms that the people enjoy, but also reflects the rich content of the people's modern way of life, mode of thinking, moral sentiments, aesthetic tastes, and fashion habits. Its "scientificity" lies in its advocacy of science, opposition to superstition, and resolute struggle against all feudal ignorance and pseudo-science. Its "popularity" lies in its origin from the people, its service to the people, its education of the people, and its enjoyment by the people.
