The cultivation and selection of leaders who possess both virtue and talent is the fundamental plan for the long-term stability of the party and the country. The work of building a high-quality cadre team began in the 1980s, and further accelerated in the 1990s.
In 1991, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China made a special decision on "strengthening the cultivation and education of young cadres," which clearly stated the need to strengthen strict requirements and management for young cadres, strengthen ideological and theoretical education, and provide them with practical experiences through exchanges and rotations. In October 1992, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China explicitly proposed to cultivate and select successors of the socialist cause in accordance with the principles of the "four modernizations" of the cadre team and having both virtue and talent. In September 1994, the Fourth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed two major strategic tasks: the cultivation and selection of leaders who possess both virtue and talent. At the same time, it also put forward four requirements for the reform of the cadre system: first, expanding the democracy in the selection and appointment of leaders. Whether elected or appointed, leaders must follow the mass line and involve the masses more through democratic recommendations, opinion tests, or democratic evaluations. Second, improve the evaluation system for leaders and align it with the system of promotion, demotion, rewards, and punishments. Third, earnestly implement the system of exchanging leaders and combine it with the system of term limits and the evasion system. Fourth, strengthen the supervision and inspection of the work of selecting and appointing leaders, resolutely prevent and correct irregularities in personnel matters. The principles proposed by the 14th National Congress and the Fourth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee clearly provide guiding opinions on the cultivation and selection of leaders who possess both virtue and talent from the perspectives of the 1990s. These principles and requirements are clearly oriented, fully reflect characteristics of democracy and openness, are easy to implement, and have strong guiding effects.
To implement the spirits of the 14th National Congress and the Fourth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee, the National Organization Work Conference was held in Beijing from November 30 to December 3, 1994. The conference focused on studying and deploying the work of cultivating and selecting leaders who possess both virtue and talent, and strengthening the construction of leadership teams at all levels. On November 30, Hu Jintao delivered a report titled "Cultivate and Select Leaders Who Possess Both Virtue and Talent, and Build Leadership Teams at All Levels to Serve as Strong Collectives to Implement the Party's Basic Line." He proposed making comprehensive improvement in the quality of cadres at the county level and above as a focal point of future cadre work. On December 2, Jiang Zemin emphasized in his speech at the conference that in the current and future periods, cadre team construction must focus on completing two strategic tasks: first, comprehensively improving the quality of existing leaders and building leadership teams at the county level and above well; second, promptly cultivating and selecting outstanding young cadres, striving to cultivate a large number of leaders who can assume important responsibilities across the century. The speeches by Jiang Zemin and Hu Jintao further clarified the key work priorities for the cultivation and selection of leaders who possess both virtue and talent. In order to effectively strengthen the work of cultivating and selecting leading cadres, in January 1995, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) issued the "Notice of the Central Committee of the CPC on Intensifying the Training and Selection of Outstanding Young Cadres," requiring organizations at all levels to improve and strengthen the work of reserve cadres, so that there are sufficient reserve candidates for leadership teams at all levels; increase training efforts and comprehensively enhance the quality of young cadres; in the training and selection of young cadres, it is necessary to focus on the healthy growth of a generation. In accordance with the above-mentioned requirements, party committees at the central and local levels have generally strengthened the work of cadre training and education.
While strengthening cadre training and education, the work of rational selection of cadres was also put on the agenda. In January 1995, the Central Committee of the CPC issued a notice on the issue of training and selecting outstanding young cadres, clearly stating the goals, principles, and requirements for selecting young cadres. In February 1995, the Central Committee of the CPC issued the "Interim Regulations on the Selection and Appointment of Leading Cadres in Party and Government Organizations," which clearly stipulated the principles, conditions, procedures, and methods for selecting and appointing cadres in the form of regulations. On June 21, 1996, Jiang Zemin made an important speech titled "Efforts to Build a High-Quality Cadre Team" at a symposium commemorating the 75th anniversary of the founding of the CPC, further proposing to improve the political and professional qualities of party cadres according to five criteria: First, they must have lofty communist ideals, adhere to the correct political direction, firmly follow the road of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and resolutely implement the Party's basic theories, basic lines, and various policies; second, they must strive to practice the purpose of the Party's wholehearted service to the people, maintain close contact with the masses, especially the working class and farmers, and resolutely safeguard the interests of the people; third, they must free their minds, seek truth from facts, proceed from the actual situation, be good at pioneering and advancing, and have a dialectical and materialistic thinking method and work method; fourth, they must exemplify observing discipline and upholding the law, maintain integrity and self-discipline, carry forward the spirit of hard work, consciously reject corruption and prevent deviation, and resolutely oppose negative and corrupt phenomena; fifth, they must study hard, work diligently and professionally, continuously accumulate knowledge and experience, and have the professional knowledge and abilities to do their jobs well.
After 1996, with the joint efforts of the central and local party committees, the work of cadre selection and appointment gradually moved towards institutionalization and standardization. In August 2000, the central government issued the "Outline of Deepening the Reform of Cadre Personnel System," which clearly stipulated the basic goals, principles and policies, as well as the reform of cadre personnel system in party and government organs and state-owned enterprise personnel system. In July 2002, based on the requirements of the new century, new stage, and new tasks, and on the basis of absorbing the achievements of the cadre personnel system reform since 1995, the central government revised and improved the "Interim Regulations on the Selection and Appointment of Leading Cadres in Party and Government Organizations," and promulgated the "Regulations on the Selection and Appointment of Leading Cadres in Party and Government Organizations," which made more scientific, standardized and rigorous regulations on the basic principles, procedures, methods, and aspects of expanding democracy and strengthening supervision in the selection and appointment of cadres, providing basic regulations and guarantees for preventing and governing irregularities in personnel management at the source, and promoting the institutionalization, democratization, and standardization of cadre work. In 2004, the central government further intensified the reform of the cadre personnel system, and successively issued five documents, including the "Interim Provisions on the Open Selection of Leading Cadres in Party and Government Organizations" and the "Interim Provisions on Competitive Selection and Placement of Party and Government Organs," and combined with the previously issued "Notice on the Cleanup of Party and Government Leaders Holding Concurrent Positions in Enterprises" in early 2004, which were collectively referred to as the "5+1" documents. These documents, together with the "Civil Servants Law of the People's Republic of China" issued in 2005, provide systematic and clear regulations for the selection and appointment of leading cadres. The promulgation of these policies and regulations further improves the selection and appointment system of leading cadres, and the work of selecting and appointing leading cadres has gradually moved towards institutionalization and standardization, thereby effectively guaranteeing the emergence of outstanding talents and timely cooperation and succession of leading cadres at all levels.
III. Strengthen Party Conduct and Intensify the Fight against Corruption
How can a political party maintain a healthy body? This has been a historical issue that Marxist thinkers have been striving for. Since the 1990s, with the development and changes in society, the Communist Party of China has gradually put forward and formed a set of institutions and ideas in the practice of combating corruption and advocating integrity. These institutions and ideas reflect the original development and creation of Chinese Communists in the process of Marxist Sinicization.
In the new stage of reform and opening up, as China transitions from a planned economy to a socialist market economy, due to the incomplete elimination of the drawbacks of the old system and the insufficient legal system, there are still some weak links in supervision and management. In addition, some regions and departments neglect ideological and political work, resulting in the spread and development of passive corruption in some party and government organs and law enforcement agencies.
In response to the severe situation of the fight against corruption, the CPC Central Committee and the State Council have actively taken targeted measures. As early as the beginning of the reform and opening up, the Party began to pay attention to the problem of opposing wrongful practices. The 13th National Congress of the Party in 1987 formally put forward the guideline of "strictly governing the Party". After the 13th National Congress, a series of measures for building a clean government were gradually introduced. From August 20th to 25th, 1993, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection held its second plenary session in Beijing. Jiang Zemin proposed at the meeting that we should start from three aspects to do a good job in the fight against corruption: first, leading cadres at all levels should take the lead in being honest and self-disciplined; second, focus on investigating and handling a number of major cases, with particular emphasis on cases involving party and government leadership organs, judicial departments, administrative law enforcement departments, and personnel in economic management departments; third, firmly grasp the outstanding problems in the local area, within the department, and within the unit, and put an end to the few wrongful practices that the masses are most dissatisfied with. These three requirements directly targeted the "three organs and one department" - party and government leadership organs, leading cadres,and judicial organs, administrative law enforcement agencies, economic management departments, and their personnel. Based on Jiang Zemin's speech spirit and the needs of the fight against corruption, the plenary session formulated five provisions regarding the problem of corruption among county-level and above leading cadres: first, no engagement in business or intervening in paid intermediary activities, and no provision of any preferential conditions for spouses, children, and relatives to engage in business activities; second, no part-time positions (including honorary positions) in various economic entities, and those approved for individual cases should not receive any remuneration; not allowed to reimburse expenses that should be paid personally by subordinates and other enterprises and institutions; third, no buying or selling of stocks; fourth, no accepting gifts or various valuable securities in official activities; not allowed to accept credit cards presented by subordinate units and other institutions, and not allowed to use credit cards issued by the unit for personal use; fifth, no using public funds to obtain various forms of club memberships, and not allowed to participate in high-consumption entertainment activities using public funds.
On October 5th, 1993, the CPC Central Committee and the State Council issued a decision on implementing several tasks in the recent period regarding the fight against corruption, re-emphasizing the three tasks proposed at the second plenary session of the central disciplinary inspection commission and the "five provisions" for leading cadres. In February 1994, the third plenary meeting of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing. Based on the "Five Guidelines" proposed at the Second Plenary Session, the meeting once again put forward and reiterated the following requirements: 1. It is not allowed to violate regulations to purchase and replace imported luxury cars. It is not allowed to use authority to exchange, borrow, and allocate funds to purchase cars for enterprises and subordinate units. It is not allowed to use loans, fund-raising, and special funds to purchase small cars for leaders' use. County (city) party and government organs and units are not allowed to purchase small cars if they owe workers' wages. 2. It is not allowed to violate the regulations on housing system reform promulgated by the State Council to pressure purchase houses. It is not allowed to use authority to provide preferential conditions for oneself and one's children, relatives, and friends to purchase houses. It is not allowed to use public funds beyond the standard for personal house decoration. 3. Leaders should travel light and live frugally during domestic official activities. Accommodation and meals should not exceed the local reception standards. It is not allowed to hold special dance parties for leaders. 4. It is not allowed to waste public funds and resources through excessive celebration of personal and family weddings, funerals, weddings, job transfers, birthdays, and moving into new homes, let alone using public funds and resources to profit personally. 5. It is not allowed to use authority to withhold public funds without repayment. It is not allowed to use public funds to purchase houses for oneself and relatives or engage in profit-making activities. In May, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection also formulated the "New Five Guidelines" for clean and self-disciplined leadership. 
In order to further implement the above-mentioned work arrangements of the Party Central Committee and the State Council on fighting corruption, in June 1994, the Communist Party of China Central Committee decided to organize 20 investigation teams to conduct supervision and inspection at 24 central state organs and 24 provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the central government. Based on the investigations, in January 1995, the Fifth Plenary Session of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection made four additional provisions on clean and self-disciplined leadership: 1. It is not allowed to appropriate discounts, intermediary fees, and gifts received during business and management activities for personal use. It is not allowed to receive wages and bonuses for part-time positions in violation of regulations. 2. Personal private business and enterprise operation are not allowed. Providing various conveniences for family members and friends to operate businesses using authority is not allowed. 3. It is not allowed to occupy multiple houses in violation of regulations. It is not allowed to use public funds to purchase or build houses that exceed the standards. 4. During the period of non-policy losses and wage arrears for employees and teachers in enterprises, it is not allowed to purchase cars. It is not allowed to purchase imported luxury cars such as Benz, Lincoln, Cadillac, and Duke. In April, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection also formulated and implemented handling opinions on clean and self-disciplined leadership. The provisions include: not allowed to build private houses in violation of regulations; not allowed to participate in fundraising for house construction in violation of regulations; not allowed to use military police license plates and foreign license plates; not allowed to use public funds and company vehicles to learn driving techniques without approval; not allowed to participate in entertainment activities such as business singing and dancing halls and nightclubs paid with public funds; not allowed to accept invitations in domestic interactions with units and individuals that may affect the impartial performance of official duties.
The above-mentioned provisions and opinions have put forward clear requirements for clean and self-disciplined leadership, which have made the anti-corruption work basically follow a set of regulations. Based on this, in January 1996, the Sixth Plenary Session of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China put forward again the three working patterns of clean and self-disciplined leadership, investigating and dealing with illegal and disciplinary cases, and correcting the misconduct in departments and industries. The conference also specially emphasized that provincial and ministerial-level leading cadres must abide by the regulations on clean and self-disciplined leadership, abide by party discipline and national laws, be the first to do what is required of subordinates, and firmly refrain from doing what is prohibited. The conference proposed the establishment of a responsibility system for the fight against corruption. For serious corruption issues occurring in the local area, departments, families, and relatives, the responsibilities of the leaders should be investigated. 
In order to ensure that the regulations regarding the clean and disciplined behavior of relevant leadership cadres are effectively implemented, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI) has also taken a series of concrete measures. First, senior cadres are dispatched to local areas and departments to conduct inspections, responsible for understanding the implementation of the Party's lines, policies, and principles by provincial and ministerial-level leadership teams and their members, as well as the situation of clean governance. They directly report to the CCDI and promptly report to the Party Central Committee. Secondly, it is stipulated that the local disciplinary commission of the Party and the department have the power to conduct preliminary verification if they discover violations of Party discipline by the same level Party committee or its members, and they can directly report to the higher-level discipline inspection commission. No organization or individual has the right to interfere or obstruct such actions. Thirdly, the local disciplinary commission of the Party and the department are required to report to the higher-level discipline inspection commission at the same time as reporting to the same level Party committee when they receive reports and accusations against members of the same level Party committee. No one has the right to withhold such reports.
While continuously improving the various regulations mentioned above, the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee and the State Council have further improved relevant institutions and mechanisms. In terms of institutional construction, after the 16th National Congress of the CPC, the CPC Central Committee with Hu Jintao as the General Secretary attached great importance to the construction and innovation of the anti-corruption system, focusing on preventing and solving corruption issues from the source. The 3rd Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the CPC first proposed the establishment and improvement of a punitive and preventive corruption system that is compatible with the socialist market economy system, giving equal emphasis to education, supervision, and institutions. Subsequently, the 4th Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee put forward the sixteen-character guideline for party building, clean governance, and anti-corruption in the new situation, namely "address both symptoms and root causes, comprehensively regulate, punish and prevent, and emphasize prevention", and called for the establishment of an education, institution, and supervision-based punitive and preventive corruption system. In December 2004, the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee deliberated and approved the "Outline for the Establishment of a Sound Punitive and Preventive Corruption System with Equal Emphasis on Education, Institution, and Supervision". It clarifies the guiding ideology, main objectives, and working principles for the establishment of a punitive and preventive corruption system. The main objective is to establish the basic framework of the punitive and preventive corruption system by 2010. After further efforts, the system of punishment and prevention of corruption, with long-term mechanisms for moral and ideological education, an institutional system for anti-corruption, and a monitoring mechanism for the exercise of power, should be completed. The working principles are as follows: (1) adhere to and improve the socialist market economy system, develop socialist democratic politics, construct an advanced socialist culture, and build a harmonious socialist society; (2) give equal emphasis to education, institution, and supervision; (3) unite scientificity, systematicness, and feasibility; (4) combine inheritance with innovation. The "Outline" is a guiding document for the current and future periods for carrying out party conduct and clean governance and anti-corruption work. In January 2005, the CPC Central Committee distributed the "Outline" nationwide, requiring all levels of Party committees and governments to effectively implement various anti-corruption tasks.
In the process of promoting the construction of the anti-corruption system, the Party and the state have also successively promulgated a series of laws and regulations to continuously enrich and improve the content of the anti-corruption system. In December 2003, the CPC Central Committee issued the "Regulations on Discipline Inspection within the Communist Party of China (Trial)". For the first time, it comprehensively regulated the key points, approaches, and methods of internal Party supervision in the form of Party regulations, explicitly pointing out that the key targets of internal Party supervision are leadership organs and cadres at all levels, especially the main leaders of leadership teams at all levels. In December 2003, the CPC Central Committee issued the revised "Regulations on Disciplinary Actions of the Communist Party of China", which made specific and clear provisions on the handling of various disciplinary violations by Party members in the new situation. In accordance with the goal of establishing a power operation mechanism with a reasonable structure, scientific configuration, strict procedures, and effective constraints, the Communist Party of China combines the institutional construction of strengthening power constraints with effective supervision of cadres. In September 2004, the Central Committee promulgated and implemented the "Regulations on the Protection of Rights of Communist Party Members." The General Office of the Central Committee has also issued regulations such as the "Interim Measures for the Supervision and Inspection of the Selection and Appointment of Party and Government Leading Cadres" and the "Interim Provisions on the Open Selection of Party and Government Leading Cadres." In July 2005, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection discussed and adopted the "Provisions on the Assistance of the Discipline Inspection Commission in Organizing and Coordinating Anti-Corruption Work (Trial)." In April 2007, the State Council issued the "Regulations on Administrative Discipline of Government Civil Servants." In addition, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection has also formulated a series of supporting regulations in collaboration with relevant departments, such as the "Interim Provisions on the Inspection Work of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China" and the "Opinions on the Fulfillment of Supervision Duties by the Discipline Inspection Group Sent by the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the CPC." The promulgation of these laws and regulations has initially formed a party supervision system with the Party Constitution as the core, the supervision regulations as the backbone, and a series of supporting regulations as important supplements.
The establishment and improvement of a sound system for punishing and preventing corruption is a major decision made by the Party Central Committee based on summarizing historical experience and scientifically judging the situation. It is also a further deepening of the Party's understanding of the governing law and the law of anti-corruption and upholding integrity. The establishment and gradual improvement of this system, in conjunction with the maintenance of activities to enhance the advanced nature of Communist Party members, effectively strengthens the Party's governance capacity and advanced construction, and enhances the Party's ability to resist corruption and risks in the development of the socialist market economy conditions.
IV. The formation and establishment of the important thought of the "Three Represents" and its guiding position
Since the Fourth Plenary Session of the Thirteenth Central Committee, the Party Central Collective Leadership with Jiang Zemin as the core, has upheld the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, accurately grasped the characteristics of the times, scientifically judged the historical position of our Party, centered around the theme of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, concentrated the wisdom of the whole Party, and carried out theoretical innovation with great courage in Marxism. The important thought of the "Three Represents" was put forward. After further enrichment and development, the important thought of the "Three Represents" was formally established as the guiding ideology of the Party at the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China in 2002.
1. The formation of the important thought of the "Three Represents"
Through continuous summarization of the Party's historical experience and the practical experience since the Fourth Plenary Session of the Thirteenth Central Committee, the Party Central Leadership with Jiang Zemin as the core has increasingly deepened its understanding of what socialism is, how to build socialism, what kind of Party to build, and how to build the Party. This laid a foundation for clarifying the important thought of the "Three Represents." On this basis, on February 20, 2000, Jiang Zemin put forward the requirement of the "Five Always" at the education conference on the "Three Emphases" for leading cadres in Gaozhoushi, Maoming, Guangdong Province. The "Five Always" means "We must ensure that the Party always maintains the character of the vanguard of the working class, always represents the interests of the broadest masses of the people, always represents the development demands of the advanced productive forces, always leads the people of all ethnic groups in promoting the development of social productive forces, and always plays a strong and core leadership role, and we must further build the Party ideologically, organizationally and in style in accordance with the new historical conditions." After attending the conference in Gaozhou, Jiang Zemin conducted inspections in Shenzhen, Shunde, and Guangzhou from February 21 to 25. On the 24th, he presided over a symposium on party building work in Guangzhou, where he further put forward the complete thought of the "Three Represents." At the meeting, Jiang Zemin said, "By summing up the history of our Party for more than 70 years, an important conclusion can be drawn. That is, the reason why our Party has won the support of the people is that in various historical periods of revolution, construction, and reform, our Party has always represented the development requirements of China's advanced social productive forces, represented the advancement direction of China's advanced culture, represented the fundamental interests of China's vast majority of people, and through the formulation of correct lines, principles, and policies, has unremittingly struggled for the fundamental interests of the country and the people..." "In the new historical conditions, all Communist Party members and leading cadres must deeply understand and firmly grasp the 'Three Represents' in order to guide their own thoughts and actions. Only by doing so can they truly become qualified party members and qualified party leaders." This is Jiang Zemin's creative answer to the important question of what kind of party to build and how to build the party, based on the new changes in the international and domestic situation at the turn of the century, following the Fourth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee and the 15th National Congress. This answer made the overall goal and task of party building more clear, and the direction of party building more distinct.
The introduction of the important thoughts of the "Three Represents" has caused strong reactions both inside and outside the party and at home and abroad. The whole Party and the whole country have enthusiastically carried out studies and research, continuously deepening their understanding of these important thoughts. Based on this, Jiang Zemin also successively expounded on strengthening and improving party leadership under the new situation from different angles at the economic work conference, united front work conference, and the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection conference held by the central authorities, enriching and improving the important thoughts of the "Three Represents".
After the introduction of the important thoughts of the "Three Represents", the central leadership focused on two aspects of work to implement these important thoughts:
Firstly, conducting learning and education activities on the important thoughts of the "Three Represents". On November 30, 2000, the General Office of the CPC Central Committee formulated the "Opinions on Carrying out Learning and Education Activities on the Important Thoughts of the 'Three Represents' in Rural Areas," which required the leadership teams and grassroots cadres at the county (city) departments, townships, and villages nationwide to carry out planned and step-by-step learning and education activities on the important thoughts of the "Three Represents" for about two years starting from the winter of 2000 and the spring of 2001. Party committees and governments at all levels quickly formulated implementation plans. Many provinces, municipalities, and counties also implemented a system of responsibilities, established contact points, conducted in-depth investigations and research at the grassroots level, and provided on-the-ground guidance. Through the implementation of these activities, the ideological and working styles of grassroots cadres in rural areas have clearly improved, further promoting the development of the rural economy and the improvement of farmers' lives, and achieving the effect of "cadres receiving education, and farmers benefiting".
Secondly, taking party building as a key topic, and conducting extensive thematic research. The central departments formed research groups to conduct investigations and research, listen to opinions extensively, and understand the situation in various aspects. In addition to this, various regions and many departments have also carried out research in various forms, providing valuable materials for thinking about and solving party building problems under the new situation. Party comrades have gained some achievements and consensus through research and discussions, but they also deeply feel that there are still many problems that need to be studied and resolved. In this regard, Jiang Zemin proposed at the Fifth Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee held in October 2000: "To enable all Party comrades to deeply understand and comprehensively and correctly grasp the requirements of the 'Three Represents', there is still a lot of work to be done. First, we need to further study the combination of theory and practice in order to form a consensus and provide answers." In January 2001, Jiang Zemin emphasized in his speech at the National Propaganda Department Ministers' Meeting that, when commemorating the 80th anniversary of the establishment of the Communist Party of China, it is necessary to "deeply carry out the propaganda and education of the 'Three Represents' throughout the Party" and "make efforts to study, promote, and implement the requirements of the 'Three Represents' well".
On July 1, 2001, the CPC Central Committee held a grand ceremony to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the establishment of the Communist Party of China in Beijing. Jiang Zemin delivered an important speech at the meeting, systematically expounding on the scientific connotation of the important thoughts of the "Three Represents". Jiang Zemin pointed out: Our party must always represent the development requirements of China's advanced productive forces. This means that the party's theories, guidelines, principles, policies, and all work must strive to conform to the laws of productive force development, embody the requirements of continuously promoting the liberation and development of social productive forces, especially the requirements to promote the development of advanced productive forces and continuously improve the living standards of the people. Our party must always represent the progressive direction of China's advanced culture. This means that the party's theories, guidelines, principles, policies, and all work must strive to reflect the requirements of developing a modern, globalized, and future-oriented socialist culture that is national, scientific, and popular. It must also promote the continuous improvement of the ideological and moral qualities and scientific and cultural qualities of the entire nation, providing spiritual and intellectual support for the development of our economy and social progress. Our party must always represent the fundamental interests of the broadest masses of the Chinese people. This means that the party's theories, guidelines, principles, policies, and all work must adhere to the fundamental interests of the people as the starting point and ultimate goal, fully give play to the enthusiasm, initiative, and creativity of the masses, and ensure that the people continuously obtain tangible economic, political, and cultural benefits on the basis of continuous social development and progress.
In the "July 1st Speech," Jiang Zemin not only comprehensively expounded the scientific connotation and basic content of the important thought of the "Three Represents," but also clearly pointed out how to implement it. After the "July 1st Speech" was delivered, the central government and various regions held a series of theoretical seminars to study the spirit of Jiang Zemin's "July 1st Speech." The Central Propaganda Department formed an important speech promotion group consisting of relevant department leaders and theoretical workers to spread the spirit of the "July 1st Speech" to central government bodies and across the country, achieving good results. The Central Organization Department established a research group composed of relevant departments to continue carrying out a series of special surveys on the issue of party construction in the new situation. A nationwide wave of learning and practicing the "Three Represents" has formed.
With the deepening of the study and practice activities of the "Three Represents," people have gained a deeper understanding of how to build the party in accordance with the requirements of the "Three Represents."
On May 31, 2002, Jiang Zemin delivered an important speech at the graduation ceremony of the Central Party School for provincial and ministerial-level cadre training classes. He further elaborated on the guiding significance and essence of the important thought of the "Three Represents" in light of the situation, tasks, and work principles that the party faces in the new century and new stage. He pointed out that to create a new situation in the cause of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, we must hold high the banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, and comprehensively implement the requirements of the "Three Represents." The "Three Represents" is in line with Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory, and reflects the new requirements of the development and changes in the contemporary world and China for the work of the party and the state. The "Three Represents" is the foundation, the governing principles, and the source of strength for our party. It is a powerful theoretical weapon for strengthening and improving the party's construction and promoting the self-improvement and development of our country's socialist system.
He emphasized that the key to implementing the requirements of the "Three Represents" lies in advancing with the times, the core lies in maintaining the party's advanced nature, and the essence lies in governing for the people. All party members must firmly grasp this fundamental requirement and constantly enhance their consciousness and determination to implement the requirements of the "Three Represents." At the same time, he also elaborated on the importance of adhering to the party's ideological line and promoting theoretical innovation, emphasizing the need to uphold the ideological line of emancipating the mind and seeking truth from facts and promote the spirit of advancing with the times. This is the decisive factor for the party to maintain its advanced nature and creativity under the conditions of long-term governance. Whether our party can always achieve this will determine the future and destiny of China.
This speech further unified the thinking of the whole party and made sufficient preparations for the convening of the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China and the establishment of the guiding status of the important thought of the "Three Represents" throughout the party.
From November 8th to 14th, 2002, the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing. This congress formally established the "Three Represents" important thought as the guiding ideology of the Party. The Congress report, after summarizing the precious experience accumulated by our party in the past thirteen years, clearly pointed out: "These experiences, summed up in the historical experience since the establishment of the party, can be summarized as follows: our party must always represent the development requirements of China's advanced productive forces, represent the advancement direction of China's advanced culture, and represent the fundamental interests of the broadest masses of the Chinese people."
The important thought of the "Three Represents" was proposed on the basis of scientifically judging the historical position of the Party. To implement the important thought of the "Three Represents," the entire Party must always maintain a spirit of keeping pace with the times, continuously explore new frontiers in the development of Marxist theory, treat development as the Party's top priority in governing the country, constantly create new situations in modernization construction, mobilize all positive factors the most extensively and fully, continuously add new strength to the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation, and advance party building with a spirit of reform, continuously injecting new vitality into the Party's organization. In short, the important thought of the "Three Represents" is about development and progress. The entire Party must constantly liberate their thinking, continuously develop new theories, and continuously create new practices, implement the important thought of the "Three Represents" in various areas of socialist modernization construction, and reflect it in various aspects of Party building, so that our Party always moves in sync with the development of the times and shares a common destiny with the people.
The report comprehensively and concisely explains the epochal background, historical status, scientific connotation, spiritual essence, and guiding significance of the important thought of the "Three Represents" through a series of expositions. In general, the important thought of the "Three Represents" is to continue exploring by creatively applying Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, especially Deng Xiaoping Theory, closely integrating with the new situation of the times, the new requirements of the vast Chinese people, and the new practices of China's reform, opening up, and modernization, for answering the questions of what socialism is and how to build socialism. It includes adhering to and improving the basic economic system of socialist public ownership as the mainstay and the common development of multiple ownership economies; adhering to and improving the distribution system dominated by the principle of distribution according to work and the coexistence of multiple distribution methods; establishing a socialist market economic system; promoting strategic adjustments to the economic structure and transforming the growth mode; advancing the development of the western region and promoting coordinated regional development; implementing a combination of "bringing in" and "going global" strategies; developing socialist democracy; constructing a socialist rule of law state; developing socialist advanced culture; promoting the coordinated development of material civilization, political civilization, and spiritual civilization in socialism; promoting multipolarity in the world and democratization of international relations; and correctly dealing with and mastering economic globalization, promoting common development, etc. These are a series of innovative theoretical achievements. On the question of building the Party and what kind of Party to build, it adheres to examining itself from the perspective of the requirements of the development of the times, strengthens and improves itself with the spirit of reform, effectively addresses the two major historical tasks of improving the Party's leadership level and governance capacity, and comprehensively promotes a new great project of Party building, forming a new understanding of Party building.
It is precisely because the important thought of the "Three Represents" has formed a set of new theoretical achievements that the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China established the important thought of the "Three Represents" as the guiding ideology of the Party alongside Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory. Establishing the important thought of the "Three Represents" as the guiding ideology of the Party is a historic decision of this congress and also a historic contribution. On the basis of a series of discussions at the 16th National Congress, the Party Constitution Amendment adopted at the conference incorporated the important thought of the "Three Represents" into the Party Constitution, along with Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory, as the action guide for the Communist Party of China. It clearly stipulates that the Communist Party of China is the vanguard of the Chinese working class, as well as the vanguard of the Chinese people and the Chinese nation. It is the leading core of the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics, representing the development requirements of China's advanced productive forces, the progressive direction of China's advanced culture, and the fundamental interests of the broadest people. The Communist Party of China takes Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the important thought of the "Three Represents" as its action guide, which is the guiding ideology that the Party must adhere to for a long time. Just as the 7th National Congress of the Party established Mao Zedong Thought as the guiding ideology of the Party, and the 15th National Congress of the Party established Deng Xiaoping Theory as the guiding ideology of the Party, which played an extremely important role in the victorious development of China's revolution and construction, the 16th National Congress established the important thought of the "Three Represents" as the guiding ideology of the Party, which will also play an extremely important role in creating a new situation in the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
After the important thought of the "Three Represents" was incorporated into the Party Constitution at the 16th National Congress, on March 14, 2004, the 2nd Session of the 10th National People's Congress passed the Amendment to the Constitution of the People's Republic of China, incorporating the important thought of the "Three Represents" into the Constitution, establishing its guiding position in our country's political and social life. This is of great significance to our Party and country. In the new century and new stage, the Communist Party of China is to hold high the banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of the "Three Represents", adhere to the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and lead the people in striving for the comprehensive construction of a well-off society and the basic realization of modernization.
2. The significant historical significance of the establishment of the important thought of the "Three Represents" as the guiding ideology of the Party
The establishment of the important thought of the "Three Represents" as the guiding ideology of the Party has significant historical significance in the development history of Marxism, especially the development history of scientific socialism.
Firstly, it has pushed Marxism to a new height in the new era and theoretical level. The important thought of the "Three Represents" is the product of China's reform and opening-up and the practice of socialist modernization. This important thought stands at the height of China's development and the world's development. Based on the inheritance of the understanding of Marxism, it further answers the questions of "what is socialism, and how to build socialism" and creatively answers the questions of "what kind of party to build and how to build it", greatly enriching the theoretical treasury of Marxism and opening up a new realm for the development of Marxist theory. The formation of the important thought of the "Three Represents" and its establishment as the guiding ideology of the whole Party, especially its important guiding role in practice in our country's economic and social development, indicates that the Communist Party of China has reached a new theoretical height in understanding the laws of Party governance, socialist construction, and the development of human society.
Secondly, it has endowed Marxism with a new era connotation. The important thought of the "Three Represents" is the inheritance and development of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory. This important thought, starting from the new reality of China and the world, through continuous summary of practical experience and theoretical summarization of the spirit of the times and practical requirements, creatively combines the construction of the Party with the development and changes of today's world and the development trend of contemporary China, the self-improvement and development of the socialist system of our country, and the grand goal and various tasks of realizing socialism with Chinese characteristics, endowing the nature of the Party, its purposes, guiding ideology, and historical tasks with distinct era connotation and characteristics. Therefore, this important thought reflects the new requirements of the developments and changes in the world and China for the work of the Party and the country. It is the latest achievement of the development of Marxism in China, a powerful theoretical weapon to strengthen and improve the construction of the Party, and to promote the self-improvement and development of Chinese socialism. It is the guiding ideology that the Party must adhere to for a long time and the foundation, basis, and source of the establishment, governance, and strength of our Party.
Thirdly, it creatively inherits and develops the basic principles of Marxism. The important thoughts of the "Three Represents" in understanding the party's governing laws, socialist construction laws, and the laws of human social development have creatively developed the basic Marxist theory that the progress of human society is ultimately determined by productivity, guided by advanced culture, and driven by the masses. It reveals that socialism with Chinese characteristics is the organic unity of a socialist market economy, socialist democratic politics, and socialist advanced culture. It is a comprehensive development of socialist material civilization, spiritual civilization, and political civilization. It profoundly expounds the socialist modernization undertakings led by the Communist Party of China, the development and progress of Chinese society, and the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation, as well as the inherent connection with the Party's new great construction project. These main viewpoints have creatively developed the basic theory of Marxism on the basis of inheriting the existing understanding of Marxism.
In summary, the important thoughts of the "Three Represents" closely integrate with the new era conditions and, with great theoretical courage and scientific spirit of exploration, adhere to and develop Marxism, giving Marxism new vitality. It once again firmly demonstrates that the basic principles of Marxism are still the sharp ideological weapon for us to correctly understand and transform the world and continuously promote social practice.
Chapter 11: The proposal of comprehensively building a well-off society and the scientific outlook on development
Under the guidance of Deng Xiaoping's theory and the important thoughts of the "Three Represents", China's economic and social development and various aspects of work have made great strides. By the end of the 20th century, China had initially established a new socialist market system and the overall living standards of the people had reached a well-off level. Based on this, the Party Central Committee further put forward the new goal of comprehensively building a well-off society in light of the domestic and international situation and the basic conditions of China's economic and social development. In order to better guide the comprehensive construction of a well-off society and smoothly promote China's economic and social development, the Communist Party of China timely proposed the scientific outlook on development after the turn of the century. With the goal of building a well-off society comprehensively and the guidance of the scientific outlook on development, China's society has embarked on a new historical journey of socialist modernization.
I. The new goal of comprehensively building a well-off society and the improvement of the reform program for the market economy
Since the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China in 1992, in accordance with the goal of establishing a socialist market economic system, the Communist Party of China has continuously increased efforts to remove old practices and introduce new ones, making significant breakthroughs in many areas and promoting the fundamental transformation from a traditional planned economy system to a socialist market economy system. By 2000, the socialist market economic system had been initially established, and the overall living standards of the people had reached a well-off level.
1. The initial establishment of the socialist market economic system and the overall achievement of well-off living standards
The initial establishment of the socialist market economic system is mainly manifested in the following aspects: the ownership structure is increasingly diversified, and the micro-vitality of the national economy is enhanced; the market system has basically taken shape, and the production factor market has begun to take shape; active exploration of a new macroeconomic regulation system, with indirect regulation methods beginning to play a major role; reform in the field of income distribution has gradually deepened; the construction of the social security system has steadily advanced; the pace of reform in government institutions and the transformation of functions has accelerated; the deepening of reform has significantly increased the degree of marketization of the national economy, and the fundamental role of market allocation of resources has gradually strengthened. By the end of 2000, China had initially established a socialist market economic system and became a developing market economy country. This is a fundamental change in China's economic system over the past twenty years of reform and opening up, especially since the 14th National Congress. This fundamental change not only greatly changes the institutional environment for China's economic development but also has a profound influence on the social life and ideological concepts of the Chinese people. This is of decisive importance to China's reform and construction as well as the theoretical development and innovation of the Party.
While making the judgment that our country has basically established a socialist market economic system, our Party also made another judgment from a macro perspective: our country has overall achieved a "moderately prosperous society" and based on this, made new plans for the future development goals of the new century.
The concept of "xiaokang" has undergone a historical process in the application of China's society in the new era. As early as 1979, Deng Xiaoping proposed the concept of "xiaokang" and envisioned achieving the goal of "xiaokang" by the end of the 20th century. Since then, the concept of "xiaokang" has been interpreted and enriched from different perspectives.
In December 1990, the "Suggestions on Formulating the Ten-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the Eighth Five-Year Plan" passed by the 7th Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed that "people's lives should go from having enough food and clothing to reaching a moderately prosperous level, with more abundant material resources, a more reasonable consumption structure, significantly improved living conditions, further enriched cultural life, continued improvement in health levels, and continuously improved social service facilities." These mainly focus on the quality of life. In 1991, the National Bureau of Statistics and 12 other departments proposed 16 indicators for the level of xiaokang, including per capita GDP, Engel's coefficient, per capita disposable income of urban residents, and per capita net income of rural residents. According to this standard, China's overall living standard reached a moderately prosperous level by 2000.
In the "Suggestions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Formulating the Ninth Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the Long-Range Goals for 2010" passed at the 5th Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee in 1995, the deadline for achieving "xiaokang" was set at 2000, and by then, China planned to "basically eliminate poverty and make people's lives reach a moderately prosperous level." Generally speaking, the definition of xiaokang life is similar to the international concept of quality of life, including material living conditions such as food, clothing, housing, and transportation; living environment including air quality, transportation, water quality, green areas, etc.; and social environment such as social order, sense of security, social moral norms, etc.
After years of development through reform and opening up, China generally reached the level of "xiaokang" and achieved the strategic goal of the second step of socialist modernization construction by 2000. In this context, the 5th Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in 2000 clearly announced that China had achieved overall "xiaokang" and would "enter the new development stage of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society and accelerating the socialist modernization." It marked a new milestone in the development history of the Chinese nation. Based on the recommendations of the 5th Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee, the State Council formulated the "Outline of the Tenth Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development" which was approved at the 4th Session of the 9th National People's Congress in March 2001. This outline provided a blueprint for economic and social development in the first five years after entering the new century, clarified guiding principles and major tasks, and became the action plan for people of all ethnic groups in the country to strive for in the early years of the new century. With the implementation of the "10th Five-Year Plan," China entered a new stage of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society and accelerating socialist modernization construction.
By the end of the 20th century, people's lives generally reached a moderately prosperous level, which marked a new milestone in the development history of the Chinese nation. It also laid a solid foundation for further development in the new century.
2. The formulation of the goal of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society at the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China
Shortly after entering the new century, the Communist Party of China held its 16th National Congress from November 8th to 14th, 2002 in Beijing. The conference passed the report entitled "Building a Well-off Society in an All-round Way and Creating a New Era for the Cause of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics" presented by Jiang Zemin on behalf of the 15th Central Committee. It also passed the amendments to the Constitution of the Communist Party of China and the work report of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection. A new Central Committee and a new Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, consisting of 198 central committee members and 158 alternate committee members, were elected.
The theme of this conference is to hold high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, fully implement the important thought of "Three Represents," carry forward the past and forge ahead into the future, advance with the times, comprehensively build a well-off society, accelerate the socialist modernization, and strive to create a new era for the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
The entire content of the report of the 16th National Congress revolves around this theme, clearly demonstrating to the world that the banner held high by the CPC in the new stage of the new century is the banner of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the banner of the important thought of "Three Represents." The path the CPC must take is the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics pioneered by Deng Xiaoping, adhered to and developed by the Party Central Committee with Jiang Zemin at its core. The goals that the CPC, leading the Chinese people, must achieve in the first 50 years of the new century are to comprehensively build a well-off society and then achieve modernization. These vivid and powerful answers demonstrate the determination of the Party Central Committee, reflect the aspiration of the people, embody the objective requirements for the continuous development of the Party and the cause of the country, and are of great significance for unifying the thinking of the whole Party and the whole nation, consolidating strength, forging ahead with unity and determination, arduously leading the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics into a new era.
The report comprehensively reviews the 13-year struggle and the basic experience since the Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee in 1989, especially since the 15th National Congress. The report points out that it is widely recognized that these 13 years have been a period in which our country's overall national strength has greatly increased, and the people have benefited the most. It has been a period in which our society has maintained stability, unity, and harmony for a long time, and our international influence has significantly expanded and the cohesion of the nation has greatly enhanced. The practice over the past 13 years has deepened our understanding of what socialism is, how to build socialism, what kind of party to build, and how to build the party, accumulating valuable experience. They are as follows: (1) adhere to Deng Xiaoping Theory as the guide and constantly promote theoretical innovation; (2) prioritize economic construction and solve problems through development methods; (3) adhere to reform and opening up, continuously improve the socialist market economy; (4) adhere to the Four Cardinal Principles and develop socialist democratic politics; (5) pay equal attention to material and spiritual civilization, combine ruling the country by law with ruling the country with virtue; (6) adhere to the principle that stability overrides everything else, and correctly handle the relationship between reform, development, and stability; (7) adhere to the absolute leadership of the Party over the military and take the road of building a powerful army with Chinese characteristics; (8) unite all forces that can be united and continuously enhance the cohesion of the Chinese nation; (9) adhere to an independent foreign policy of peace and promote world peace and common development; (10) strengthen and improve the leadership of the Party, and comprehensively promote the new great project of party building. These ten points are the basic experience that leaders of the Party must adhere to in building socialism with Chinese characteristics. These experiences, combined with the historical experience since the Party's founding, boil down to the fact that our party must always represent the development requirements of China's advanced productive forces, the direction of China's advanced culture, and the fundamental interests of the vast majority of the Chinese people. This is an inevitable requirement for adhering to and developing socialism and the inevitable conclusion drawn from our party's arduous exploration and great practice.
Based on the requirements of creating a new era for the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics, the 16th National Congress of the Party, on the basis of a profound analysis of the new situation and new tasks faced by the Party and the country, has determined the goal of building a well-off society in an all-round way.
On November 8th, Jiang Zemin stated in the report of the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China that based on the development goals proposed at the 15th National Congress of the Party, which aimed to achieve a higher level of well-off society benefiting over 1 billion people by 2010, the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Party, and the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the People's Republic of China, "we must concentrate our efforts in the first two decades of this century to comprehensively build a well-off society that benefits over one billion people, making the economy more developed, democracy more sound, science and education more advanced, culture more prosperous, society more harmonious, and people's lives more prosperous. This is a stage of development that must be passed through to achieve the strategic goal of modernization construction, as well as a crucial stage for improving the socialist market economy and expanding opening up to the outside world. After completing this stage of construction, we will continue to strive for several decades to basically achieve modernization by the middle of this century and build our country into a socialist state that is prosperous, strong, democratic, and culturally advanced."
By 2020, China's future will present the following bright prospects:
(1) On the basis of optimizing the structure and improving efficiency, the gross domestic product (GDP) of the country will strive to double that of 2000 by 2020, and its comprehensive national strength and international competitiveness will significantly enhance. Basic industrialization will be achieved, and a sound socialist market economy and a more dynamic and open economic system will be established. The proportion of urban population will increase significantly, and the trend of widening gaps between urban and rural areas, as well as between different regions, will gradually reverse. The social security system will be comparatively sound, social employment will be relatively sufficient, family property will generally increase, and the people will live a more affluent life.
(2) Socialist democracy will be further improved, the socialist legal system will be more comprehensive, the basic strategy of ruling the country according to law will be fully implemented, and people's political, economic, and cultural rights and interests will be genuinely respected and safeguarded. Grassroots democracy will be better developed, social order will be good, and people will live and work in peace and contentment.
(3) The overall quality of the entire nation in terms of ideology, morality, science and culture, and health will significantly improve, and a comparatively complete modern national education system, scientific and cultural innovation system, and national fitness and medical healthcare system will be formed. The people will have the opportunity to receive good education, and high school education will be universally accessible, eliminating illiteracy. A learning society for all and lifelong learning will be formed to promote the all-round development of individuals.
(4) The capacity for sustainable development will continuously enhance, the ecological environment will be improved, resource utilization efficiency will significantly increase, promoting harmony between humans and nature, and propelling the whole society towards a path of civilized development with productive development, abundant living conditions, and a good ecological environment.
The goal of comprehensively building a well-off society as determined by the 16th National Congress of the Party is more enriched and profound in its connotations compared to the past, even though it only adds the two words "comprehensive" in its expression. "Comprehensively building a well-off society" refers to the relatively low level, incompleteness, and imbalanced development of the well-off state achieved in China by the end of the 20th century. Therefore, the comprehensive construction of a well-off society can be summarized as three "mores": "higher level," "more comprehensive coverage," and "more coordinated development."
The goal of comprehensively building a well-off society as set by the 16th National Congress is the goal of comprehensive development of China's socialist economy, politics, culture, and society, further enriching and developing the strategic plan for China's socialist modernization in three steps.
First, the comprehensive construction of a well-off society has raised the concept of social development in our country to a new height. Development is the first priority of the Communist Party of China's governance and national rejuvenation. From meeting basic needs to achieving moderate prosperity, this represents a transformative progress in development led by the Party. However, even after achieving this transformative development, China still faces numerous contradictions and problems that need to be further addressed. For example, productivity and technology, as well as education, are relatively lagging behind. We still face pressure from developed countries that have advantages in areas such as economy and technology. Our economic system and other management systems are not yet perfect, and the rural-urban dual economic structure has not changed. The trend of widening regional disparities has not been fundamentally reversed. There are still people who need to be lifted out of poverty, the total population continues to increase, the proportion of elderly population is rising, and there is increasing pressure on employment and social security. Contradictions between natural resources, ecological environment, and economic and social development are becoming increasingly prominent. There are also some significant issues in cultural construction, democratic and legal construction, and ethical and moral construction that cannot be ignored, and so on. All of these require us to consider and resolve comprehensively. The introduction of the ideology and goals of building a well-off society in all respects demonstrates that the senior decision-makers of the Communist Party of China have a full understanding of this. This has brought the socialist modernization construction of our country, which encompasses comprehensive development in the economic, political, cultural, and social fields, to a new level of understanding.
Second, the comprehensive construction of a well-off society expands the perspective of consolidating and developing socialism from the perspective of productivity to the perspective of people's livelihood. In the report of the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, when summarizing the basic experience of the past thirteen years, it clearly stated that "problems in the course of progress should be solved through development". Regarding how to solve the problem of development, Marxist classical authors have long pointed out insightfully that the reason why socialism is superior to capitalism is that it can create higher social productivity than capitalism. This conclusion is unquestionable. However, from the historical experiences, both positive and negative, at home and abroad since the 1990s, people's high or low identification with a country, a political party, or a society is manifested not only in social productivity but also in whether the living standards and quality of life of the people can continue to improve, whether the social environment and cultural atmosphere can be continuously optimized. The introduction and formulation of the ideology and goals of building a well-off society in all respects are precisely in this regard, reflecting a new understanding and development of Marxism's thinking on the liberation and development of social productivity.
Third, the comprehensive construction of a well-off society embodies the practical requirements of the important thought of the "Three Represents." The essence of the comprehensive construction of a well-off society is to continuously liberate and develop social productivity, continuously build advanced socialist culture, continuously improve people's living standards and quality, and realize the comprehensive development of politics, economy, culture, and society. Implementing the important thought of the "Three Represents," its first priority is also development, which reflects the development that embodies advanced productivity, advanced culture, and the fundamental interests of the broadest people. From the perspective of the essential requirements for promoting social development, the implementation of the important thought of the "Three Represents" and the comprehensive construction of a well-off society have historical and logical unity.
Fourth, the comprehensive construction of a well-off society is an action plan that fully embodies the spirit of the times in the new century. Formulating a goal and action plan that conforms to the requirements of the times and reflects the wishes of the people is the key to whether a political party can unite and mobilize all positive factors to strive together for a common goal. From a historical perspective, in different historical periods, the Party has proposed inspiring goals based on the development changes of the times and the needs of social development, rallying the vast masses of the people around itself, thus continuously transforming from one victory to another in revolution, construction, and reform. The goal of building a well-off society in all respects proposed by the 16th National Congress of the Party is undoubtedly a goal that is in line with the national conditions, conforms to the times, represents the fundamental interests of the people, and embodies the needs of the times. It is a realistic, pragmatic, innovative, and action-oriented action plan for advancing the socialist modernization of our country in the new century.
3. Further improve the outline of the reform of the socialist market economy
The development of the socialist market economy is a significant innovation of Chinese Communists in Marxist economic theory. According to the reform direction of the socialist market economy, China has not only gradually transitioned from a planned economy system to a socialist market economy system but also through practical exploration, has gradually enriched and developed the reform outline of the socialist market economy.
After the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, China began to implement reform and opening-up. After more than ten years of practical exploration and theoretical summarization, the relationship between planning and the market gradually became clear, thereby laying the foundation for establishing the reform goal of the socialist market economy system. In 1992, the Fourteenth National Congress of the Communist Party of China established the reform goal of the socialist market economy system. In 1993, the Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Several Issues Concerning the Establishment of the Socialist Market Economy System, which was adopted at the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party, initially formulated the overall plan for the reform of China's socialist market economy system and outlined its basic content and framework, providing a guiding principle for China's economic system reform in the 1990s. Subsequently, the Fifteenth and Sixteenth National Congresses, based on the summary of practical experience, gradually deepened the Party's understanding of the socialist market economy and preliminary established the socialist market economy system, which made significant progress in China's economic system reform.
First, a pattern of the dominant public ownership with diverse forms of ownership developing together has basically formed. Through years of adjustment and improvement to the ownership structure, China's ownership structure has gradually become more rational. The forms of public ownership have diversified from being singular to becoming diverse, and the layout of the entire state-owned economy has become more reasonable. By the year 2000, the majority of large and medium-sized state-owned enterprises had initially established a modern enterprise system. The collective economy in urban and rural areas has added new vitality through reform and reorganization. Some enterprises with a solid foundation have achieved new developments by introducing market mechanisms. Non-public ownership economies, such as individual, private, joint venture, and foreign-funded enterprises, have shown vigorous vitality from weak to strong. The shareholding system and mixed ownership economy have become increasingly important types of economic entities encouraged by the national policies. In line with the reform towards a market orientation and the adjustment of the ownership structure, the distribution system with the remuneration based on labor has been continuously improved, and multiple modes of distribution coexist. Incentive mechanisms have gradually been strengthened, and a situation where factors of production such as labor, capital, technology, and management participate in distribution based on contribution has been formed.
Second, the socialist market economy system has been initially established. With the establishment of the basic economic system and the continuous development of various market elements, the micro foundation of the socialist market economy system has gradually formed. With the further development of the commodity market, the pace of development of factor markets, such as capital, labor, technology, real estate, has also accelerated, and the fundamental role of the market in resource allocation has been increasingly enhanced. While promoting market-oriented reform, the reform of the national macroeconomic management system has also been comprehensively promoted. The state's ability to macroscopically regulate the economy has been continuously enhanced. Through the coordination of state planning, fiscal policy, monetary policy, and various regulatory means, the policy system of macroeconomic regulation has been gradually improved.
Third, China's economic and social development level has been greatly improved. China has transitioned from the early stage of industrialization to the middle stage. The mode of economic growth has gradually shifted from extensive to intensive, and the economic quality has improved significantly along with the expansion of the overall economy. The total economic output and total import and export trade of our country has entered the forefront of the world. The people's lives have achieved two historic leaps. In the 1980s, we basically solved the problem of getting enough to eat and wear, and in the 1990s, we went from having enough to eat and wear to achieving a moderately well-off standard of living. For thousands of years, the problem of eating has plagued the Chinese people, but under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, it has been fundamentally solved. The dream of a moderately well-off life that has been passed down from generation to generation has now begun to become a reality. Alongside the rapid economic growth and continuous social progress, achievements of historical significance have been made in education, science, culture, as well as in population, environment, and other social undertakings.
