They have started on the path of sustainable development and comprehensive social progress. This is a great victory of the socialist system and a new milestone in the development history of the Chinese nation.
Fourth, the social security system has been initially established, and the social security system, with old-age, unemployment, and medical insurance for urban employees as its main components, continues to be improved. The channels for social security funds have become diversified, and management services have become socialized. The basic livelihood security system for laid-off workers in state-owned enterprises, the unemployment insurance system, and the minimum living security system for urban residents have been continuously improved, playing an important role in maintaining social stability.
Through a series of reforms over a considerable period of time, China's economy and society have made remarkable progress under market conditions. However, we should also see that while achieving the aforementioned series of accomplishments, some deep-seated contradictions that have long existed have not been fundamentally resolved. Additionally, new contradictions and problems have accumulated in the economic and social fields. The prominent issues include an irrational economic structure, persistent gaps in urban-rural and regional development, slow growth of farmer's income, an increase in laid-off workers, prominent employment issues, increasing resource and environmental pressures, and weak overall economic competitiveness, among others. The causes of these problems are multifaceted, and one important reason is that our socialist market economy system is not yet perfect and still cannot meet the requirements of developing productive forces, especially advanced productive forces. These two opposing situations have simultaneously placed new demands on deepening the reform of the socialist market economy system.
Reform is a powerful driving force for economic development and social progress. In order to adapt to the international environment of economic globalization and accelerated technological progress, and to adapt to the new situation of building a moderately well-off society in all respects, in October 2003, the Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Party passed the Decision on Several Issues Concerning the Improvement of the Socialist Market Economic System (referred to as the "Decision"). It emphasized the reform goals and tasks concerning important institutional issues that need to be addressed in the current and future periods, and made decisions and arrangements.
First, the main goals for improving the socialist market economy system. The "Decision" proposes that we should, in accordance with the requirements of coordinating urban-rural development, regional development, economic and social development, harmony between human and nature, and domestic development and opening-up, give full play to the fundamental role of the market in resource allocation to a greater extent, enhance the vitality and competitiveness of enterprises, improve the national macroeconomic regulation system, and improve government social management and public service functions, in order to provide strong institutional guarantee for building a moderately well-off society in all respects.
Second, the main tasks of the reform of the socialist market economy system. The "Decision" clearly states that it is necessary to improve the basic economic system of the dominant public ownership and the simultaneous development of various forms of ownership; establish a system that is conducive to gradually changing the dual economic structure of urban and rural areas; form a mechanism to promote coordinated regional economic development; construct a unified, open, and orderly modern market economy system; improve the macroeconomic regulation system, administrative management system, and economic legal system; improve the employment, income distribution, and social security system; and establish mechanisms to promote sustainable economic and social development.
Third, regarding the guiding ideology and principles for deepening the reform of the socialist market economy system. The "Decision" clearly states that it should be guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of the "Three Represents," implement the Party's basic line, basic program, and basic experience, comprehensively implement the spirit of the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, emancipate the mind, seek truth from facts, and keep pace with the times. It is necessary to adhere to the direction of the reform of the socialist market economy, focus on institutional construction and innovative systems. It is necessary to adhere to the spirit of pioneering by the masses and give full play to the initiative of both the central and local governments. It is necessary to correctly handle the relationship between reform, development, and stability, and promote reform in a targeted and step-by-step manner. It is necessary to take overall considerations, coordinate various interests in the process of reform. It is necessary to put people first, establish a comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development concept, and promote comprehensive development of the economy, society, and individuals. From the perspective of the guiding ideology of deepening the reform of the socialist market economy, compared with the "Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Some Issues Concerning the Establishment of the Socialist Market Economic System" in 1993, it incorporates the latest spirit of the Party's guiding ideology and reflects the progressiveness of the Party's guiding ideology.
The "Decision" reflects the latest understanding of the situation of China's economic and social development in the 21st century by the Party, and has distinct inheritance and continuity. It is a historic document that bridges the past and the future. It systematically enriches the content that was not possible or mature enough to be developed ten years ago, and is a landmark document for the improvement of the socialist market economy in China in the new century. It deepens the guidelines for the reform of the socialist market economy from three major aspects.
First, it further develops Marxist economic theory. Since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, especially since the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China and the Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee, with the gradual establishment and improvement of the socialist market economic system, the reform process has presented some new features: China's reform is no longer like "crossing the river by feeling the stones" in the 1980s, but is carried out under the guidance of the overall reform plan; the topics discussed by the leadership and the theoretical community have also shifted from "whether to reform" to "how to reform". The theory of the socialist market economy has also continuously developed and improved in the deepening of reform practice and theoretical debates.
After the economic operation was shifted to the market system and basic consensus was reached within and outside the Party, the focus of theoretical discussions began to shift to the field of ownership. As a result, the differences of various opinions were manifested in the form of whether the reform should be "oriented towards the public" or "oriented towards the private". The 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China clearly answered this question. In terms of the recognition of the status of the non-public economy, based on the basic national conditions of the primary stage of socialism, the report of the 15th National Congress broke through the previous judgment of the non-public economy as an "important supplement" or a "beneficial supplement" to the public ownership economy. It believed that the dominant public ownership and the simultaneous development of various forms of ownership are a "basic economic system" of the primary stage of socialism in China, and it recognized that the non-public economy is an "important component" of the socialist market economy. In terms of understanding the socialist market economy, the report emphasizes that the socialist market economy includes not only state-owned economy and collective economy, but also the state-owned and collective components in the mixed ownership economy. The forms of implementing public ownership should be diversified, and all operating methods and organizational forms that reflect the laws of socialized production can be boldly utilized. Efforts should be made to find forms of public ownership that can greatly promote the development of productive forces. Regarding the understanding of the state-owned economy, the report believes that the leading role of the state-owned economy refers to controlling the lifeline of the national economy, but this is in the context of the entire country. The dominant role of the state-owned economy mainly manifests in terms of control power, and the layout of the state-owned economy should be adjusted strategically. The 15th National Congress placed the theory of socialist market economy under the background of the primary stage of socialism, which clearly answered the question of whether the reform is oriented towards "public" or "private" and fundamentally developed the theory of socialist market economy.
In the late 1990s, China's second-step strategic goal for modernization was basically achieved. At the beginning of the new century, the third-step strategic goal was timely launched. From top to bottom, people discussed the issues of "strategic opportunity period" and "period of prominent contradictions" coexisting. The new central leadership collective formed at the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China put forward the scientific concept of development of "putting people first" and "comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development" at the third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee, and made the decision on several issues concerning the improvement of the socialist market economic system. In this decision, the Party also made innovations in the theory of socialist market economy, particularly in the theories of ownership and property rights. For the first time, the decision proposed "vigorously developing mixed ownership economy with participation of state-owned capital, collective capital, and non-public capital, achieving diversification of investment subjects, and making joint-stock system the main form of public ownership." Before this, joint-stock system was only considered as one form of implementation. The phrasing in the report of the 16th National Congress was "actively promote the joint-stock system and develop mixed ownership economy." The significant change in the decision will greatly accelerate the diversification of state-owned enterprises and create opportunities for more private enterprises and foreign investors to enter state-owned joint-stock companies. In terms of property rights theory, the decision for the first time proposed that "property rights are the core and main content of ownership, including real rights, creditor's rights, equity rights, and intellectual property rights." The transition from establishing a modern enterprise system to establishing a modern property rights system in enterprise reform indicates that both the theory and practice of China's enterprise reform have entered a new stage.
Secondly, the report deepened and improved the connotation of the socialist market economy reform objectives. The decision of the Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China pointed out that according to the requirements of coordinating urban-rural development, regional development, economic and social development, harmony between man and nature, domestic development and opening-up, the market should play a fundamental role in resource allocation to a greater extent, enhance the vitality and competitiveness of enterprises, improve the national macroeconomic regulation, and improve government social management and public service functions, providing institutional guarantees for building a well-off society in an all-round way. From the perspective of this statement in the decision, it deepened and improved the connotation of the socialist market economy reform objectives from three aspects. First, it identified the "five coordinations" as the starting point for deepening reform. This is an extremely important reform concept proposed by our Party based on summarizing the historical experience of reform since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, according to the characteristics of the current environment and the future trends of domestic and international changes. It is a distinctive feature of this decision’s proposed reform objectives. Second, it embodies the organic unity of the stage and continuity of China's economic system reform. The Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed the goal of establishing a socialist market economic system, that is, giving full play to the fundamental role of the market under macroeconomic regulation. After 10 years of efforts and bold exploration, the goals of the reform have been basically achieved. Based on this, the "Decision" further adds the basic connotations of expanding the market's fundamental role, improving enterprise vitality and competitiveness, improving the national macroeconomic control system, and strengthening the government's public service functions. It combines with the basic connotations of developing a socialist market economy proposed by the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, and together they constitute the main connotations of deepening the reform of the socialist market economy system. This not only enriches the connotations of the reform objectives of the socialist market economy system, but also reflects the organic unity of the stage and continuity of China's economic system reform. Third, it integrates content related to institutional guarantees. From the perspective of Marxist principles, society is an open system, with high interdependence between urban and rural areas, regions, and between humans and nature. The economy and society are inseparable, and internal conditions are interconnected with the external environment. Therefore, reforms must analyze problems from multiple perspectives such as the economy and society, urban and rural areas, humans and nature, domestic and international, developed and underdeveloped regions, in order to propose reform objectives and more effectively promote the liberation and development of productive forces.
Third, it makes the historical task of deepening the reform of the socialist market economy more specific and clear. The "Decision" of the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed seven tasks for further deepening the reform: (1) improving the basic economic system in which public ownership is the mainstay and multiple forms of ownership develop together; (2) establishing a system conducive to gradually changing the dual economic structure of urban and rural areas; (3) forming mechanisms to promote coordinated regional economic development; (4) building a unified, open, competitive, and orderly modern market system; (5) improving the macroeconomic control system, administrative management system, and economic legal system; (6) improving the employment, income distribution, and social security systems; (7) establishing mechanisms to promote sustainable economic and social development. The Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed the establishment of a socialist market economic system, mainly proposing reform tasks in the construction of a market system for state-owned enterprises, the construction of a macroeconomic control system, and the construction of distribution systems and social security systems. Based on the historical conditions at that time, when determining the reform tasks, the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee emphasized the integrity of the market system. The tasks proposed in the "Decision" of the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee further strengthened the realism and targetedness, making the historical tasks of economic reform more specific and clear. From the current situation, if issues such as the effective form of public ownership, orderly competition in the market, and the transformation of government public functions cannot be resolved, China's economy cannot sustain healthy and rapid development, industries cannot form strong competitiveness, and the favorable situation of opening up to the outside world cannot be sustained; if issues such as urban-rural disparities, regional disparities, and disharmony between humans and nature cannot be gradually solved through institutional and mechanistic guarantees, social stability cannot be maintained, and the grand goal of building a well-off society in an all-round way cannot be achieved. It is precisely because of these real problems that the "Decision" proposes seven clear and specific reform tasks, and its fundamental purpose is to eliminate the institutional barriers to the development of productive forces and provide strong institutional guarantees for building a well-off society in an all-round way.
The above-mentioned historical process fully reflects the development of China's reform practice, reflects the exploration conducted by our Party in realizing the combination of the basic principles of Marxism and the practice of China's reform and opening up, and reflects the continuous deepening of our Party's understanding of the laws of developing a socialist market economy.
II. the new situation of deepening reform and development and the proposal of the scientific outlook on development
After entering the new century and new stage, China's economic and social development has entered a key period. Faced with the complex situation faced by our country in this key period, the Party Central Committee, with Hu Jintao as the General Secretary, inherited the beneficial thoughts of previous leaders, summarized the historical experience of many years, scientifically analyzed the current situation, and timely proposed the scientific outlook on development.
1. The situation and problems China faces during the critical period of reform and development
The proposal of the scientific outlook on development is not accidental; it is a necessity of the development of the international and domestic situation and the latest summary of the world's development ideas.
From the perspective of the international situation, peace, development, and cooperation are the trend of the times in today's world. The trend of world multipolarity and economic globalization continues to develop deeply, and countries' interdependence is gradually deepening. The relations among major powers are undergoing profound changes, and the balance of world power continues to change. Technological progress is advancing rapidly, scientific and technological innovation and technological diffusion are accelerating, international industrial restructuring and factor transfer are speeding up, regional economic integration is flourishing, and the world economy is entering a new round of recovery and growth. In this development trend of the world, the international community generally holds positive expectations for the development prospects of our country, attaches importance to our role and influence, and the willingness to cooperate with our country is increasing. This is a favorable aspect for our country's development. However, at the same time, we must also soberly realize that our country's development is also facing some major challenges. Hegemonism and power politics still exist, the instability and uncertainty factors affecting world peace and development are increasing, the imbalance in world economic development is intensifying, international competition for resources, markets, technology, and talents is becoming increasingly fierce, trade barriers and trade frictions are increasing, and the pressure from developed countries that have advantages in economy and technology will persist in the long term. The environment we face will continue to be overall favorable to the development of our country, but unfavorable elements may also increase. In the face of such an environment, we must consider China's development in the context of the world's overall situation, play to our strengths, seize favorable conditions, seize opportunities, respond to challenges, accelerate development, and strive to achieve the initiative in development.
From the perspective of the domestic situation, through unremitting efforts since the establishment of the People's Republic of China, especially since the reform and opening up, our country has achieved remarkable development achievements. Significant changes have taken place in productivity, production relations, economic foundation, and superstructure. By 2000, we had achieved the second development goal of the "three-step" strategy for modernization and overall living standards reached a moderately prosperous level. According to the development goals proposed at the 15th National Congress for the year 2010, the centenary of the founding of the party, and the centenary of the founding of New China, the 16th National Congress clearly stated the magnificent goal of comprehensively building a well-off society benefiting more than one billion people during the first 20 years of the 21st century. This is a crucial stage in achieving the strategic goal of modernization and a critical period for improving the socialist market economy and expanding openness to the outside world. The outstanding characteristics and main problems in this period are that our economy and society have entered a new stage of development, and the reform and development have reached a crucial stage. Comprehensive national strength competition is becoming increasingly fierce, and the external environment is becoming more complex and changeable. The industrialization and urbanization process in our country is accelerating, economic structural adjustments are speeding up, and a large number of surplus labor in rural areas are transferring to non-agricultural areas. The degree of economic marketization is rapidly improving, deepening reforms further touch upon deep-seated contradictions and problems, and institutional innovation has entered a key stage. Regional development imbalance, economic and social development imbalance, narrowing regional development gaps and promoting coordinated economic and social development have become more difficult tasks. The degree of external dependency of our economy continues to increase, and the impact of the world economy on our country's development is becoming more pronounced. The material and cultural needs of the people are constantly improving and becoming more diverse, and social interests are becoming more diverse and complex, making it more difficult to balance and consider the interests of all parties. The awareness of democracy and the rule of law among the people is constantly strengthening, the enthusiasm for political participation is continuously increasing, and new requirements have been put forward for developing socialist democratic politics and implementing the basic strategy of governing the country according to law. The channels through which people are influenced by various ideological concepts have increased significantly and deepened, and the independence, selectivity, and variability of ideological activities have been significantly enhanced. Mastering the complex situation and striving for good and fast development has become a new era issue facing the Party Central Committee led by General Secretary Hu Jintao.
Looking at the experience of world development, reaching a per capita GDP of $1000 is an important milestone for economic development, which means that economic development has reached a new level and is at a crucial juncture. When a country's per capita income surpasses 1000 US dollars, there may be two different prospects and outcomes: some countries soar and thrive, while others stagnate. Only with appropriate responses can development be accelerated. Some countries and regions in East Asia have effectively managed their relationships and achieved sustained rapid growth during this period, while some countries in Latin America have made missteps, falling into unrest and stagnation, and getting trapped in the "Latin American trap". By 2003, China's per capita GDP had exceeded 1000 US dollars. According to internationally recognized standards, China had stepped out of the ranks of low-income countries. This is a great milestone in the development history of the Chinese nation and has created a new starting point for the more forceful promotion of socialist modernization. After China's economic and social development reached a new starting point, how China can draw on successful development experiences from abroad and avoid repeating their failures has become not only a hot topic for discussion in the field of ideological theory but also a crucial issue that must be considered by the highest decision-making level of the Communist Party of China.
2. The Proposal of the Scientific Outlook on Development
The Scientific Outlook on Development was put forward by the Party Central Committee with Hu Jintao as the General Secretary. It was based on inheriting the ideas about development from Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the important thought of the Three Represents. It drew on the development experiences of various countries around the world and learned from the beneficial achievements of foreign development theories. It was proposed based on a profound analysis and understanding of the characteristics of China's development stages.
As early as March 1999, Hu Jintao put forward the idea of "firmly establishing the notion that development is the absolute principle and establishing a scientific outlook on development" during his participation in the deliberation of the Fujian delegation at the Second Session of the Ninth National People's Congress. On April 15, 2003, during an inspection in Guangdong, Hu Jintao specifically proposed the idea of "adhering to a comprehensive outlook on development". On July 28, at the National Conference on SARS Prevention and Control, Hu Jintao pointed out, "Through the fight against SARS, we have come to a deeper understanding that the economic development, social development, urban development, and rural development in our country are not sufficiently coordinated... We must attach great importance to the problems that exist and take practical measures to solve them, truly turning this fight against SARS into an important opportunity for improving our work and promoting the development of our cause." He said, "We emphasize that development is the Party's top priority in governing the country. Here, development not only refers to economic growth but also emphasizes centering on economic construction to achieve comprehensive social development. We must better adhere to a comprehensive outlook on development, coordinated development, and sustainable development. We must more consciously promote the coordinated development of socialist material civilization, political civilization, and spiritual civilization on the basis of economic and social development. We must insist on promoting the comprehensive development of individuals on the foundation of economic and social development and insist on promoting harmony between man and nature. In the process of promoting development, we must not only focus on economic indicators but also pay attention to humanistic indicators, resource indicators, and environmental indicators; we must not only increase investment to promote economic growth but also increase investment to promote social development and protect resources and the environment." In October, the Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Some Issues Concerning the Improvement of the Socialist Market Economy System, adopted at the Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Party, formally established "putting people first, establishing a comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable outlook on development, and promoting comprehensive development of the economy, society, and individuals" as the guiding ideology and principles for deepening economic system reform. On October 14, at the second plenary meeting of the Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee, Hu Jintao further proposed, "The establishment and implementation of a scientific outlook on comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development have significant implications for better adhering to the strategy that development is the absolute principle. The establishment and implementation of the scientific outlook on development is a summary of the experience of more than 20 years of reform and opening up, an important revelation brought to us by the fight against SARS, and an urgent requirement for advancing the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society." "This outlook on development conforms to the objective laws of social development." Here, the outlook on development that is "people-oriented, comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable" was officially named the "Scientific Outlook on Development".
In February 2004, the CCP Central Committee held a special research class on "establishing and implementing the concept of scientific development" for key provincial and ministerial-level leaders at the Central Party School. Comrade Wen Jiabao, Zeng Qinghong, Zeng Peiyan, and other central leaders explained the important significance of the concept of scientific development and emphasized that putting people first is the essence and core of the concept. They also put forward specific requirements for leaders at all levels to establish and implement the concept of scientific development. As a result, the concept of scientific development has been widely used among the central leadership. On March 10, 2004, at the Central Symposium on Population, Resources, and Environmental Work, Hu Jintao gave a comprehensive and profound explanation of the guiding significance, basic connotation, and basic requirements of the concept of scientific development. He pointed out that adhering to people-centered, comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development is a major strategic thought proposed for the development of the party and the country in the new century and new stage, guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of "Three Represents". The concept of scientific development summarizes the successful experience of China's reform, opening up, and modernization construction over more than 20 years, draws lessons from the experiences of other countries in their development process, summarizes the important lessons from overcoming the SARS epidemic, reveals the objective laws of economic and social development, and reflects the Party's new understanding of development issues. Comrades from the whole Party must deeply understand the significant importance of establishing and implementing the concept of scientific development from the strategic perspective of implementing the important thought of "Three Represents" and the spirit of the 16th National Congress, and firmly establish and implement the concept of scientific development to better accomplish the historical tasks we bear in the new stage of the new century. To establish and implement the concept of scientific development, it is necessary, first and foremost, to comprehensively and accurately grasp the profound connotation and basic requirements of the concept of scientific development. Putting people first means taking the comprehensive development of individuals as the goal, seeking development and promoting development from the fundamental interests of the people, constantly meeting the growing material and cultural needs of the people, effectively safeguarding the economic, political, and cultural rights and interests of the people, and allowing the fruits of development to benefit all the people. Comprehensive development means focusing on economic construction and promoting economic, political, and cultural development comprehensively, achieving economic development and social progress in an all-round way. Coordinated development means coordinating urban and rural development, regional development, economic and social development, harmonious development between man and nature, domestic development and opening up to the outside world, coordinating the coordination between productive forces and production relations, economic base and superstructure. Sustainable development means promoting harmony between man and nature, achieving coordinated economic development, population, resources, and environment, adhering to the civilized development path of promoting production development, living prosperity, and good ecological environment, and ensuring the sustainable development from generation to generation. This exposition deepens the connotation, clarifies the requirements, and strengthens the guiding significance of the concept of scientific development.
In October 2005, the fifth plenary session of the 16th CPC Central Committee put forward that the concept of scientific development is a concentrated embodiment of the worldview and methodology guiding development issues. The "Eleventh Five-Year Plan" thoroughly implemented the requirements of the concept of scientific development, and this plan was reviewed and approved at the fourth session of the Tenth National People's Congress in 2006. This plenary session elevated the concept of scientific development to the level of "worldview and methodology" and further clarified the guiding position of this thought within the entire Party. Since then, General Secretary Hu Jintao has made numerous explanations and instructions on the connotation, core, basic contents, and requirements of the concept of scientific development on different occasions, making it a consensus of the whole Party and the people of the whole country and an important guarantee for realizing the grand goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects. In 2007, the 17th National Congress of the Party officially incorporated the concept of scientific development into the Party Constitution and gave it a higher guiding position.
3. The Inheritance and Development of the Marxist Theory by the Concept of Scientific Development
The concept of scientific development is a major strategic thought proposed by our Party under the guidance of Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of "Three Represents". It is based on accurately grasping the trend of world development, summarizing our country's development experience, and analyzing the characteristics of our country's development stages in depth. This major strategic concept is the inheritance and development of Marxism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the Important Thought of "Three Represents". It is a concentrated reflection of the Marxist worldview and methodology on development and a guiding principle that must be persisted in promoting the comprehensive development of socialist economic construction, political construction, cultural construction, and social construction.
Firstly, the Scientific Development Concept inherits and develops the basic ideas about development in Marxism. It adheres to the basic principles of Marxism, closely integrates with the great practice of socialism with Chinese characteristics, absorbs new achievements in the progress of human civilization, stands at a historical and era height, focuses on enriching the connotation of development, innovating development concepts, exploring development ideas, and solving development difficulties. In terms of development path, development model, development strategy, development driving force, development purpose, and development requirements, it further answers a series of significant questions about why and how China should develop under new circumstances, preliminarily forms a systematic theory on socialist development based on Marxism, and inherits and develops the general ideas of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the Important Thought of "Three Represents" on the connotation, essence, purpose, and requirements of development. In summary, it emphasizes that human society is constantly progressing, and development is the eternal theme of human society; it emphasizes the coordination and sustainability of development and advocates the harmonious coexistence of humans and nature; it emphasizes that the ultimate goal of development is to achieve overall societal progress and comprehensive human development. This developmental perspective indicates that our Party, based on upholding the Marxist view on development, has reached a new level of understanding of development issues, the laws of social development, the laws of socialist construction, and laws of Communist Party governance. It embodies the Party's progress in its view on development.
Secondly, the Scientific Development Concept embodies the methodology of Marxism in the understanding of what development is and how to achieve it. It reveals the correct path of economic and social development in China and is the fundamental methodology for guiding our development. The Scientific Development Concept demands the proper handling of a series of significant relationships in the socialist modernization construction, such as the relationship between economic development and social development, development speed and efficiency, market mechanisms and macroeconomic regulation, reform and development stability. It emphasizes the comprehensive promotion of economic construction, political construction, cultural construction, and social construction, achieving economic development and comprehensive social progress, and paying attention to the coordination between urban and rural development, regional development, economic and social development, harmonious development between humans and nature, as well as coordination between domestic development and opening up to the outside world. The basic requirement of the Scientific Development Concept is to give comprehensive consideration to various factors, which runs through the Marxist standpoint, viewpoint, and method. It is the application and extension of the Marxist worldview, values, and methodology to the development issue. In practice, implementing the Scientific Development Concept means adhering to the "Five Coordinations". The "Five Coordinations" are the fundamental policy orientation and guiding principles for the Party to lead economic and social development. Truly achieving the "Five Coordinations" will inevitably result in comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development, economic development, and comprehensive social progress, as well as harmonious coexistence between humans and nature. Essentially, the Scientific Development Concept is a materialistic and dialectical view of development, which embodies the basic principles of dialectical materialism regarding the universal connections and dialectical unity between things. It realizes the unity of worldview and methodology and embodies the consistency between development goals and means.
Lastly, the Scientific Development Concept adheres to the people-oriented principle and embodies the Marxist values. Putting people first is the consistent social value orientation of Marxism. It emphasizes respecting the existence value, demand value, and development value of individuals, which is an important feature of Marxist theory on social development. Historical materialism scientifically clarifies the laws of human social development while indicating the laws of the masses creating history. The scientific development concept clearly puts forward the principle of putting people first and emphasizes that it is the "essence and core" of the scientific development concept. Everything is for the people, relying on the people, taking the masses as the main body and basic force to promote development, and taking the satisfaction of the growing material and cultural needs of the people as the fundamental starting point and foothold of development. This fully embodies the fundamental value orientation of the Marxist party and is a prominent manifestation of the socialist values. Therefore, it is also an inevitable conclusion that combines the historical materialism principle of putting people first with the nature and purpose of our party to establish the party for the public and govern for the people.
III. A series of important strategic decisions to promote scientific development
The formulation of the comprehensive goal of building a well-off society and the proposal of the scientific development concept have provided guarantees for China's society to embark on the path of scientific development. Based on this foundation, the Party has successively launched a series of major strategic decisions to ensure the healthy and rapid development of China's society.
The proposal of the scientific development concept is a summary of the experience of our party in the practice of reform and opening up for more than 20 years, reflecting the Communist Party of China's new understanding of development issues and embodying the urgent requirements for building a well-off society in an all-round way. It conforms to the trend of the times and is in line with the contemporary Chinese national conditions.
To effectively implement the scientific development concept and promote scientific development, the Central Committee of the Party and the State Council have taken a series of major measures:
First, further strengthen and improve macroeconomic regulation and control. In response to new problems in the economy and people's livelihood, such as food, investment, coal and electricity shortages, the central government has grasped the main contradictions and key aspects, taken targeted measures in credit, land, agricultural production, and other aspects to regulate unhealthy and unstable factors in economic operation, preventing large fluctuations in the national economy and maintaining the momentum of sustained and rapid economic growth.
Second, improve the socialist market economy system. In October 2003, the Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Party passed the "Decision on Several Issues Concerning the Improvement of the Socialist Market Economy System" (referred to as the "Decision"), which clarifies the goals and main tasks of improving the socialist market economy system. The "Decision" proposes that the main goal of improving the socialist market economy system is: in accordance with the requirements of overall planning for urban-rural development, regional development, economic and social development, harmonious development between man and nature, domestic development and opening-up, to give full play to the fundamental role of the market in resource allocation, enhance corporate vitality and competitiveness, improve the national macro-control system, improve government social management and public service functions, and provide strong institutional guarantees for building a well-off society in all respects. The main tasks are: to improve the basic economic system in which the public ownership is the mainstay and multiple forms of ownership develop together; to establish a mechanism conducive to gradually changing the dual economic structure of urban and rural areas; to form a mechanism for promoting coordinated regional economic development; to construct a modern market economy system that is unified, open, and orderly competitive; to improve the macro-control system, administrative management system, and economic legal system; to improve the employment, income distribution, and social security system; to establish a mechanism for promoting sustainable economic and social development. The "Decision" embodies the requirements of the scientific development concept, makes the objectives of economic system reform more clear, and is another guiding document for developing a socialist market economy in our country.
Third, propose the overall strategy of coordinated regional development. In accordance with the requirements of the scientific development concept, the central government adheres to overall consideration, rational planning, giving play to advantages, and implementing policies to continually make new deployments for coordinated regional development. In March 2004, the State Council issued the "Opinions on Further Promoting the Development of the Western Region", proposing to strengthen economic exchanges and cooperation between the western region and the eastern and central regions, establish a market-oriented cooperative mechanism across regions and enterprises, combine the advantages of funds, technology, and talents in the eastern and central regions with the resources, markets, and labor force advantages in the western region, achieve complementary advantages, mutual benefit, and common development. In October 2005, the 5th Plenary Session of the 16th Party Central Committee, on the basis of summarizing the experience of socialist modernization in China, further proposed the overall strategy for regional development in China. It emphasized the need to continue promoting the development of the western regions, revitalizing the old industrial bases such as the northeast region, promoting the rise of the central region, encouraging the eastern region to develop first, and forming a reasonable regional development pattern. Starting from the actual situation in various regions, the 5th Plenary Session clarified the development orientation and overall approach of each region. It emphasized the need to establish a sound mechanism for regional coordination and interaction, clarify the functional positioning of different regions, and promote the healthy development of urbanization. These were the three main aspects of implementing the strategy for coordinated regional development. 
The fourth aspect was to formulate the "Eleventh Five-Year Plan". In October 2005, the 5th Plenary Session of the 16th Party Central Committee passed the "Suggestions on Formulating the Eleventh Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development" (referred to as the "Suggestions"). The "Suggestions" took into account the trends and conditions for China's development in the next five years, and proposed the main goals for the "Eleventh Five-Year Plan": to achieve a doubling of per capita GDP in 2010 compared to 2000; to reduce energy consumption per unit of GDP by about 20% compared to the end of the Tenth Five-Year Plan period; to effectively curb the deterioration of the ecological environment and control the excessive reduction of arable land; to form a group of companies with independent intellectual property rights, well-known brands, and strong international competitiveness; to have a relatively comprehensive socialist market economy system, reaching a new level in an open economy, and achieving basic balance in international payments; to popularize and consolidate nine-year compulsory education, continuously increase urban employment opportunities, have a relatively sound social security system, and further reduce the number of people living in poverty; to generally raise the income level and quality of life of urban and rural residents, maintain overall price stability, and greatly improve conditions in terms of housing, transportation, education, culture, healthcare, and the environment; to make new progress in the construction of democracy, the legal system, and spiritual civilization; to further improve social security and work safety, and make new progress in building a harmonious society. In accordance with the above goals, China will comprehensively promote socialist modernization. 
The fifth aspect was to strengthen the construction of a socialist new countryside, deepen rural reform, and effectively strengthen the foundation of agriculture. In December 2002, the Political Bureau of the Central Committee held a meeting, emphasizing that the issues of agriculture, rural areas, and farmers should be regarded as the top priority of the work of the entire Party and be given more prominent positions. From 2004 to 2008, the Central Committee issued documents on rural issues for five consecutive years in the form of the "Number One Document". The 5th Plenary Session of the 16th Party Central Committee in 2005 put forward the historical task of building a socialist new countryside and defined the construction goals as "developing production, improving living standards, promoting civilized rural customs, creating tidy village environment, and implementing democratic management". In early 2006, the Central Committee issued the "Opinions of the CPC Central Committee and the State Council on Advancing the Construction of a Socialist New Countryside" in the form of the "Number One Document", providing comprehensive guidance for the construction of a socialist new countryside. In order to accelerate the construction of a socialist new countryside, the Party Central Committee responded to the changes in the stage of economic and social development and clearly proposed the establishment of a long-term mechanism of "industry-led agriculture, towns supporting rural areas", adhered to the principle of "giving more, taking less, and letting go", focused on "giving more", promoted the development of modern agriculture, and strengthened the industrial support for the construction of a socialist new countryside. In terms of deepening rural reform, the Party Central Committee, based on accelerating the process of rural tax and fee reform and gradually reducing and exempting agricultural taxes, made the decision to abolish agricultural taxes. On December 29, 2005, the 19th meeting of the Standing Committee of the 10th National People's Congress officially decided to formally abolish the "Regulations on Agricultural Taxes" from January 1, 2006. The abolition of agricultural taxes put an end to the historical "imperial grain tax" that had existed in China for over two thousand years, marking a historic change in the pattern of national income distribution. Since then, rural reform has entered a comprehensive reform stage with the main content of township institution, rural compulsory education, and county-town fiscal and taxation management system reforms. 
The sixth aspect was to build an innovative country. Innovation is the soul of national progress and an inexhaustible driving force for a country's prosperity and development. Since the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the central government has made significant decisions to promote independent innovation and build an innovative country, starting from the overall goal of building a well-off society and pioneering China's socialist cause with Chinese characteristics. After nearly five years of improvement and development, in January 2006, Hu Jintao formally put forward the main goal of building an innovative country for China at the opening ceremony of the National Science and Technology Conference. The goal is to significantly enhance China's capacity for independent innovation by 2020, significantly enhance the ability of science and technology to promote economic and social development and ensure national security, significantly enhance the comprehensive strength of basic science and cutting-edge technology research, achieve a number of significant scientific and technological achievements with global impact, and enter the ranks of innovative countries, providing strong support for the comprehensive construction of a well-off society.
The seventh goal is to promote the construction of socialist democratic politics in an orderly manner and strive to build socialist political civilization. The 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China identified the development of socialist democratic politics and the construction of socialist political civilization as important goals to build a well-off society in an all-around way, and called for the continued active and steady promotion of political system reform. After the 16th National Congress, while promoting the development of material civilization and spiritual civilization, the central government has continuously improved and perfected the system of people's congresses, strengthened the system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, expanded grassroots democracy, and steadily promoted the rule of law with Chinese characteristics, so as to ensure that the political system reform is in line with the goal of building socialist political civilization.
The eighth goal is to deepen the reform of the cultural system and promote the prosperity of advanced socialist culture. With the economic transition and social transformation, the economic foundation, institutional environment, and social conditions for cultural construction and development in China have undergone profound changes. The 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China called on all comrades of the Party to deeply understand the strategic significance of cultural construction, promote the development and prosperity of socialist culture, and put forward the urgent need to formulate an overall plan for the reform of the cultural system. From June 27th to 28th, 2003, the National Conference on Pilot Work of Cultural System Reform studied and deployed the pilot work of cultural system reform. On December 23, 2005, the General Office of the CPC Central Committee and the State Council issued the "Several Opinions on Deepening the Reform of the Cultural System," which clearly stated that the goal and task of cultural system reform is to take development as the theme, reform as the driving force, institutional and mechanism innovation as the focus, form a scientifically efficient macro cultural management system, a micro operation mechanism for efficient cultural production and service, a cultural industry pattern with public ownership as the main body and the coordinated, open, competitive, and orderly modern cultural market system; form a sound cultural innovation system, a cultural opening pattern that takes national culture as the main body and absorbs beneficial foreign cultures, and promote the Chinese culture to go global. In March 2006, the National Conference on Cultural System Reform summarized the pilot work of cultural system reform and made specific arrangements for promoting the reform. As a result, the reform of the cultural system has entered a new stage. The pilot areas further transformed the functions of the government based on the principles of separating politics and enterprises, separating politics and administration, and separating management and operation. The reform of public cultural undertakings deepened further, and the capacity and level of public services significantly improved. The operation of cultural enterprises made breakthrough progress towards enterprise-oriented and market-oriented management, and a large number of large-scale cultural groups have gradually formed.
In the process of promoting scientific development, the central government of the Communist Party of China has gained a clearer understanding of the institutional and systemic contradictions accumulated in China's long-term economic and social development, as well as the new situations and problems it faces. The understanding of the objective laws of economic and social development has further deepened. Grasping the laws of development, innovating development concepts, transforming development modes, solving development difficulties, and improving the quality and efficiency of development have gradually become the consensus of the whole party. On this basis, the central government of the Communist Party of China further put forward the requirement of "good and fast" development. In December 2006, the Central Economic Work Conference clearly stated: "We must deeply understand that achieving good and fast development is the fundamental requirement for fully implementing the scientific outlook on development...". "From "fast and good" to "good and fast", although it is only a change in the sequence of two words, it better reflects the inherent requirements of the scientific development concept, reflects the sublimation of the party's guiding ideology on development issues, makes the whole party have a more comprehensive grasp of the laws of development in the new stage, and makes the guiding principles for development more in line with reality and the approach to solving development difficulties more clear.
IV. strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capability and advancedness
Strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capability and continuously improving the governing capacity and level has always been an important aspect of the ideological construction of the proletarian party. As early as the establishment of the Soviet regime, Lenin proposed: "How to consolidate power after the Communist Party comes to power will be a "new and extraordinarily difficult task", "this is a severe test". And he demanded that every member of the Soviet Communist Party "enrich their minds with all the knowledge created by mankind" and continuously improve the Party's governance capacity and level. After the founding of New China, several generations of Chinese Communists have always regarded strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capability as a major task. In the new century and the new stage, the Party Central Committee with Hu Jintao as the General Secretary, based on the needs of the new situation and new tasks, specifically made decisions to strengthen the construction of the Party's governance capability.
On the eve of the establishment of New China, facing the new situation of our party becoming the ruling party, Mao Zedong once cautioned the entire party, "to achieve national victory, this is just the first step after the long march of ten thousand li", "but the journey after the revolution is longer, the work is greater, and more arduous". The task of governing the country throughout the country was like "entering Beijing to take the imperial examination". Mao Zedong's thoughts initially put forward requirements for strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capability. After the reform and opening up, our Party has always attached importance to solving the two historical issues of improving the Party's governance capacity and leadership level and improving the Party's ability to resist corruption and risks. After entering the new century, with the profound changes in the international and domestic political and economic situation, more severe challenges have been posed to our Party's governance capacity and leadership level, and new and higher requirements have been put forward for strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capacity.
To adapt to the requirements of the new situation and development, the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, based on the historical position of our Party and the historical mission bestowed by the times, and from the strategic height of ensuring long-term stability of the Party and the state, clearly put forward the basic requirements for continuously improving the construction of the five aspects of governance capability: First, continuously improving the ability to scientifically judge the situation. Second, continuously improving the ability to manage the market economy. Third, continuously improving the ability to cope with complex situations. Fourth, continuously improving the ability to govern in accordance with the law. Fifth, continuously improving the ability to oversee the overall situation.
In order to firmly and effectively address the issue of strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capacity, on September 7, 2004, the new Central Committee of the Party convened a meeting of the Politburo to discuss the work of the Central Politburo since the Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee, and further studied the issue of strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capacity. On September 19, the Fourth Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing. The decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Strengthening the Construction of the Party's Governance Capability, which was adopted at the plenary session, comprehensively analyzed the current situation and tasks, scientifically summarized the main experiences of the Party's governance, and made clear the guiding ideology, overall goals, and major tasks for strengthening the construction of the Party's governance capability."
The so-called governing capacity of the Party is: the Party puts forward and applies correct theories, lines, principles, policies, and strategies, leads the formulation and implementation of the constitution and laws, adopts scientific leadership systems and methods, mobilizes and organizes the people to manage national and social affairs, economic and cultural undertakings according to law, effectively governs the Party, the country, and the military, and builds the ability to construct a socialist modernized country. 
The guiding ideology for strengthening the construction of the Party's governing capacity is: it is necessary to adhere to the guidance of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the important thought of "Three Represents", fully implement the concept of scientific development, fully implement the Party's basic line, basic program, and basic experience, with the core being to maintain the close ties between the Party and the people, the key being to build a high-quality cadre team, the focus being on reforming and improving the Party's leadership system and working mechanism, and the foundation being to strengthen the construction of grassroots organizations and Party members, striving to embody the characteristics of the times, grasp regularities, and be rich in creativity.
The overall goal of strengthening the construction of the Party's governing capacity is: through the joint efforts of the whole Party, the Party will always be a governing party that stands for the public and governs for the people, a governing party that governs scientifically, democratically, and according to the law, a governing party that is practical, innovative, efficient, and clean, and ultimately a Marxist governing party that always adheres to the "Three Represents", maintains advancement, and withstands various tests and challenges.
The main tasks of strengthening the construction of the Party's governing capacity are: in accordance with the requirements of promoting the coordinated development of socialist material civilization, political civilization, and spiritual civilization, continuously improving the ability to manage the socialist market economy, develop socialist democratic politics, build advanced socialist culture, construct a harmonious socialist society, and deal with international situations and handle international affairs.
In addition, based on the "five aspects of governing capacity" proposed at the 4th Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC), the Decision of the Central Committee of the CPC on Strengthening the Construction of the Party's Governing Capacity also made specific strategic deployments for enhancing the construction of the Party's governing capacity.
According to the relevant deployments of the Central Committee, in order to effectively strengthen the construction of the Party's governing capacity, ensure that the Party always takes the lead in the times and better shoulder its historical mission, on November 7, 2004, the Central Committee of the CPC issued the Opinions on Carrying out the Education Activity of Preserving the Advancement of Communist Party Members with the Important Thought of "Three Represents" in Practice as the Main Content (referred to as the "Opinions"), making specific deployments for the educational activity:
In terms of overall requirements, the overall goal is to improve the quality of Party members, strengthen grassroots organizations, serve the people, and promote various work. In terms of the overall process, this educational activity will be conducted in three batches, with each batch lasting about six months. The first batch includes county-level and above Party and government organs and some enterprises and institutions. It starts from January 2005 and ends by June 2005. The second batch includes urban grassroots and township government offices. It starts from July 2005 and ends by December 2005. The third batch is in rural areas and some Party and government organs. It starts from January 2006 and ends by June 2006. In terms of methods and steps, the education will be conducted in three stages: learning and mobilization, analysis and evaluation, and rectification and improvement.
After the issuance of the "Opinions", on January 5-6, 2005, the CPC Central Committee held a work conference on the educational activity of preserving the advancement of Communist Party members, making specific deployments for the educational work. According to the overall arrangements of the CPC Central Committee, the members of the Political Bureau Standing Committee of the CPC Central Committee participated in the first batch of educational activities. On January 14, at the symposium on maintaining the advancement of Communist Party members in the new era, Hu Jintao delivered an important speech on strengthening the construction of the Party's advancement and carrying out educational activities, emphasizing the importance and necessity of preserving the advancement of Communist Party members in the new era, and the basic requirements for Communist Party members to maintain advancement. He called on all Party members to actively participate in the educational activity of preserving the advancement, and especially demanded that leading cadres play a leading role and effectively carry out the educational activity.
After the Central Advanced Education Work Conference, the activities to maintain the advanced education of Communist Party members were carried out in three phases starting from January 2005, and basically concluded by June 2006. In a year and a half, more than 3.5 million grass-roots party organizations and nearly 70 million party members participated in the education activities for advancing the Party's development. From a practical perspective, the entire education activities were conducted in a healthy and orderly manner, with solid work and smooth progress. They have achieved relatively significant results in advancing the Party's development and enhancing its governing capacity, and have received praise from the majority of party members, cadres, the masses, and the wider society.
V. adhere to the path of peaceful development and advocate the establishment of a harmonious world.
Entering a new stage in the new century, China's socialist modernization construction has embraced a new strategic opportunity period. Under the leadership of General Secretary Hu Jintao, the Party Central Committee has led the whole Party and the entire nation to face a series of new changes in the international and domestic environment. While accelerating economic development, it has also paid more attention to the modernization of the military and national defense, actively carried out diplomatic work, and made efforts to promote the process of peaceful reunification of the motherland, actively safeguarding the strategic opportunity period.
To achieve synchronous development of national defense construction and the national economy, adapt to the development and changes in the international military situation after entering the 21st century, the Party Central Committee has demanded that the entire military actively respond to the severe challenges of the new global military revolution. It has called for the promotion of the Chinese military's characteristic reform without delay, and striving to achieve the dual historical tasks of mechanization and informatization construction, and resolutely realize the strategic goal of building an informatized military and winning informatized warfare. On September 20, 2004, at an expanded meeting of the Central Military Commission, Hu Jintao, who had just assumed the position of Chairman of the Central Military Commission, proposed to continuously enhance the ability to strengthen the ideological and political construction of the troops and master the correct direction of their development, continuously improve the ability to lead the military struggle preparations and lead the troops to accomplish combat missions under the conditions of informatization, continuously enhance the ability to promote the Chinese military's characteristic reform and promote the mechanization and informatization construction of the troops, and continuously enhance the ability to govern the troops strictly in accordance with the law and strengthen the standardized construction of the troops.
On March 13, 2005, Hu Jintao delivered an important speech at the plenary meeting of the delegation of the People's Liberation Army of the 10th National People's Congress, putting forward new requirements on the historical mission of our army on behalf of the Central Military Commission. These requirements are to provide important support for the Party in consolidating its ruling position, to provide strong security guarantees for safeguarding the country's important strategic opportunities, to provide powerful strategic support for safeguarding national interests, and to play an important role in maintaining world peace and promoting common development. This new mission entrusted by the Party and the Central Military Commission to our army has epoch-making significance.
To fulfill this mission, our army has further accelerated the pace of reform along the road of China's characteristics of being an elite force. Following the large-scale downsizing in the mid-1980s and the further reduction of 500,000 troops in the mid-to-late 1990s, in September 2003, the Chinese government decided to further reduce the military personnel by 200,000 before 2005. While reducing military personnel, the country has increased investment in national defense construction. The political and military quality of the officers and soldiers of the whole army has been greatly improved, and weapons and equipment as well as the defense technology industry have made rapid progress.
Since the 16th National Congress of the Party, the most noticeable aspect of China's diplomacy has been the advocating and active promotion of the construction of a "harmonious world." This international strategic idea reflects the basic judgment and value pursuit of the Communist Party of China on the current international situation, global issues, and the future of mankind. It is a new summary of China's independent, self-reliant, and peaceful diplomatic policy objectives in the new era.
On April 22, 2005, at the Asia-Africa Summit in Jakarta, President Hu Jintao issued an appeal to all countries in the world, proposing to "promote friendly coexistence, equal dialogue, and common development among different civilizations, and jointly build a harmonious world." This was the first time that the concept of building a "harmonious world" was put forward. On July 1st, the leaders of China and Russia held a summit and included the concept of "harmonious world" in the Joint Statement on the International Order of the 21st Century, marking the first confirmation of consensus between the two major countries. On September 15th, Hu Jintao delivered a speech titled "Striving to Build a Harmonious World of Lasting Peace and Common Prosperity" at the 60th anniversary of the United Nations, proposing that "in the face of today's complex and diverse world, we should attach greater importance to harmony, emphasize harmony, promote harmony, and build a harmonious world of lasting peace and common prosperity," comprehensively elucidating the abundant connotations of the "harmonious world." In August 2006, the Party Central Committee held the National Conference on Foreign Affairs, establishing the construction of a "harmonious world" as the goal of China's diplomatic work.
In order to promote the construction of a harmonious world, the Chinese government has actively carried out a series of fruitful diplomatic activities. China's relations with major countries have remained stable and developed, and its friendship and cooperation with neighboring countries have continued to consolidate.
In 2003, the second Forum on China-Africa Cooperation adopted the Addis Ababa Action Plan (2004-2006), planning cooperation in various fields such as economy, trade, and society for the next three years. After signing the Framework Agreement on Comprehensive Economic Cooperation between China and ASEAN in 2002, China and ASEAN countries signed the Agreement on Trade in Goods and the Agreement on Dispute Settlement Mechanism in November 2004, stipulating the gradual elimination of most bilateral trade tariffs and other trade barriers by 2010. From November 28th to 30th, Wen Jiabao visited Laos and attended the 8th ASEAN-China Leaders' Meeting (10+1) held in Vientiane, where he delivered the "Action Plan for Implementing the Joint Declaration on Building a Strategic Partnership of Peace and Prosperity between China and ASEAN." In April 2005, Wen Jiabao visited Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, and India, and attended the fourth Asian Cooperation Dialogue Ministerial Meeting held in Islamabad. During the visit, China and Pakistan, China and India announced the establishment of strategic cooperative partnerships, while China and Bangladesh, China and Sri Lanka announced the establishment of comprehensive cooperative partnerships. China and India signed the Agreement on Political Guidelines for the Settlement of the Boundary Question, recognizing for the first time the principle of adjusting the existing boundaries. In the same month, Hu Jintao attended the Asian-African Summit and the 50th anniversary commemoration of the Bandung Conference held in Indonesia, comprehensively elaborating China's clear stance on win-win cooperation with Asian and African countries: mutual respect and support in politics; complementary strengths and mutual benefit in economy; learning from each other and making up for each other's shortcomings in culture; equal trust and dialogue and cooperation in security. On June 2nd, China and Russia exchanged the Instrument of Ratification for the Supplementary Agreement to the Sino-Russian Boundary East Section, marking the complete resolution of all historical boundary issues between China and Russia. With China's promotion, all parties finally reached a document with the goal of denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula in September 2005. On November 20th, during a meeting with U.S. President Bush, Hu Jintao proposed five suggestions for further developing the constructive cooperative relationship between China and the United States, further promoting the development of the constructive cooperative relationship between the two countries.
By 2008, China had participated in more than 100 intergovernmental international organizations, more than 300 international conventions, and 22 UN peacekeeping operations, sending tens of thousands of peacekeeping personnel, making it the country that has sent the most peacekeeping personnel among the five permanent members of the UN Security Council. China actively participates in international and regional affairs, conscientiously fulfilling its corresponding international responsibilities, and has become an important member of the international system.
Through active efforts, China's diplomacy has developed in a parallel manner with bilateral and multilateral approaches, giving equal weight to traditional security and non-traditional security, and a new model of comprehensive development and mutually reinforcing in politics, economy, diplomacy, military, culture, and other aspects has begun to take shape.
Since the 16th National Congress, the new central leadership collective has strictly adhered to the policy of "one country, two systems" in dealing with the issues of the Hong Kong and Macau Special Administrative Regions, and has implemented some important measures in accordance with the new situations in the development of Hong Kong and Macau. In cross-strait relations, the central government has actively responded to new changes in the situation across the Taiwan Strait and taken some significant and positive steps. The struggle against "Taiwan independence" and the defense of national sovereignty have made new progress.
Since Hong Kong and Macau returned to the motherland, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council, have consistently regarded the long-term prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macau as the fundamental starting point and foothold for handling Hong Kong and Macau affairs. They have unwaveringly implemented the principles of "one country, two systems", "Hong Kong people administering Hong Kong", "Macau people administering Macau", and high degree of autonomy, as well as the Basic Law of the Hong Kong and Macau Special Administrative Regions. They have firmly supported the Chief Executives and governments of the special administrative regions in governing according to the law.
The central government has provided full support to the prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macau. Not only have they taken effective measures to help Hong Kong and Macau successfully overcome the negative impact of the Asian financial crisis, but they have also strengthened the connections between the mainland and Hong Kong/Macau, carried out exchanges and cooperation in various fields, implemented policies such as regional cooperation in the Pan-Pearl River Delta, and promoted the common development of Hong Kong, Macau, and the mainland. These efforts have provided a broader development space for the prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macau. With the support of the central government and the mainland compatriots, the economy of Hong Kong and Macau has become more prosperous, democracy has developed in an orderly manner, the people live and work in peace and stability. The majority of Hong Kong and Macau compatriots love the motherland, care about Hong Kong and Macau, and demonstrate a spirit of diligence and progress.
After the return of Hong Kong and Macau, cross-strait relations have attracted more attention from the Communist Party of China and the Chinese people.
