Based on changes in cross-strait relations and the situation in Taiwan, the central government has put forward new propositions and taken new steps to continuously develop cross-strait relations, while adhering to the existing policies.
On March 4, 2005, General Secretary Hu Jintao put forward four points of views on the development of cross-strait relations in the new situation. It emphasized that the principle of "one China" would never waver, efforts for peaceful reunification would not be abandoned, the policy of relying on the Taiwanese people would not change, and the compromise with "Taiwan independence" activities would not be made. These four "never" propositions have had significant repercussions in cross-strait relations and the international community, receiving widespread welcome and high praise. On March 14, the Third Session of the Tenth National People's Congress passed the Anti-Secession Law with a high vote, which legally established the central government's major policies concerning the resolution of the Taiwan question and opposition to the secession of the motherland. The formulation and passage of this law fully reflect the consistent position of the Communist Party of China to strive for peaceful reunification with the greatest sincerity and utmost effort, and also demonstrate the firm determination of the Communist Party of China and the Chinese people to safeguard national unity and territorial integrity.
Under the guidance of the correct policies of the central government and with the efforts of all parties, political party exchanges have been successfully initiated between the two sides of the strait. In 2005, Lien Chan, Chairman of the Chinese Nationalist Party, as well as James Soong, Chairman of the People First Party, and Vincent Siew, Chairman of the New Party, visited the mainland with their delegations. General Secretary Hu Jintao respectively met and held talks with them, jointly issued a joint statement, and reached consensus on maintaining the "1992 Consensus", opposing "Taiwan independence", seeking peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait, and promoting the development of cross-strait relations. Through the three Cross-Strait Economic, Trade and Cultural Forums held successively by the Communist Party of China and the Chinese Nationalist Party, the mainland has introduced 48 policy measures to promote communication and cooperation between the two sides of the strait and benefit Taiwanese compatriots. These measures include expanding the sale of Taiwanese agricultural products in the mainland, recognizing the academic qualifications approved by Taiwan's education authorities for higher education institutions, allowing Taiwanese compatriots who meet the specified conditions to apply for professional registration and short-term medical practice on the mainland, and so on. The Communist Party of China and the People First Party have also held the "Cross-Strait Elites Forum". Through extensive exchanges and cooperation between the two sides' political parties, a new situation has been opened up to contain "Taiwan independence" activities and promote the development of cross-strait relations. The "Taiwan independence" activities such as "legal independence," "new constitution referendum," and "joining the United Nations in the name of Taiwan" have been repeatedly defeated by the Taiwan authorities. The struggle against "Taiwan independence" has also received extensive understanding and support from the international community. Many influential countries have reiterated their adherence to the policy of "One China." In September 2007, the 62nd session of the United Nations General Assembly overwhelmingly rejected the so-called "Taiwan joining the United Nations" proposal instigated by the Chen Shui-bian administration with the support of only a few countries. In March 2008, Taiwan held a general election, and the Chen Shui-bian administration, which had been pushing for "Taiwan independence," was finally abandoned by the Taiwanese people. The Kuomintang regained its governing position, and cross-strait relations underwent favorable changes conducive to peaceful development.
Chapter 12: Implementing the Scientific Outlook on Development and Building a Harmonious Socialist Society
Since the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, under the leadership of General Secretary Hu Jintao, the Party Central Committee has, in the practice of building a well-off society in an all-round way, put forward the concept of the scientific outlook on development to achieve better and faster development of socialist modernization in our country. It has further summarized the theoretical system of socialism with Chinese characteristics and, guided by the scientific outlook on development, put forward new requirements for the struggle to build a well-off society in an all-round way. It has promoted the construction of a harmonious society, deepened reforms in the administrative system and rural areas, and made a series of strategic decisions to promote the development of social sciences in our country, driving the continuous healthy development of our society.
I. A New Summary of the Theoretical System of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics
From October 15 to 21, 2007, the 17th National Congress of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing. The theme of the congress was: Hold high the great banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics, follow the guidance of Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of Three Represents, comprehensively implement the scientific outlook on development, continue to emancipate the mind, adhere to the reform and opening-up, promote scientific development, promote social harmony, and strive for new victories in building a well-off society in an all-round way. Hu Jintao, on behalf of the 16th Central Committee, delivered a report entitled "Hold High the Great Banner of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics and Strive for New Victories in Building a Well-off Society in an All-round Way." The congress elected a new Central Committee and Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, adopted resolutions on the report of the 16th Central Committee, the work report of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, and amendments to the Constitution of the Communist Party of China.
The report of the 17th National Congress scientifically answers major questions such as what kind of banner the Party should hold, what path to follow, what kind of mental state to maintain, and what development goals to strive for during the key stage of reform and development. It comprehensively deploys the grand goals of advancing the reform and opening-up, socialist modernization, and building a well-off society in an all-round way, and clearly puts forward specific requirements for promoting the new great project of Party building with a spirit of reform and innovation.
The report of the 17th National Congress comprehensively reviews the historic changes that have taken place over the past 30 years of reform and opening-up in the Chinese people's lives, socialist China's face, and the face of the Communist Party of China. It scientifically summarizes the valuable experience of our country, a big country with over one billion people, in getting rid of poverty, accelerating the modernization drive, and consolidating and developing socialism. The report points out that the fundamental reason for all our achievements and progress since the reform and opening-up can be summed up as opening up the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics and forming the theoretical system of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
The path of socialism with Chinese characteristics means that under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, based on China's basic national conditions, with economic construction as the central task, we adhere to the four cardinal principles, stick to reform and opening-up, liberate and develop social productive forces, consolidate and improve the socialist system, and build a socialist market economy, socialist democracy, socialist advanced culture, and socialist harmonious society, and strive to build a prosperous, democratic, civilized, and harmonious socialist modernized country.
The theoretical system of socialism with Chinese characteristics includes scientific theories such as Deng Xiaoping Theory, the important thought of Three Represents, and the scientific outlook on development.
The proposal of the "Theory of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics" is a scientific integration of our party's innovative theories in the new historical period of reform and opening up. It is a scientific expression of the openness of the party's theoretical achievements since the reform and opening up, a significant theoretical contribution of the 17th National Congress, and the latest achievement in the sinicization of Marxism. In the past thirty years, in the great historical process of reform and socialist modernization, our party has adhered to emancipating the mind, seeking truth from facts, and keeping pace with the times, continuously promoting the sinicization of Marxism, and has made significant theoretical innovations, thereby forming the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
Since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, facing the crisis caused by the "Cultural Revolution" for ten years, the Chinese Communist Party, represented mainly by Deng Xiaoping, has scientifically evaluated Mao Zedong and Mao Zedong Thought with great theoretical courage and political courage, completely negating the erroneous theory and practice of "class struggle as the key" and making historic decisions to prioritize economic construction and implement reform and opening up, opening a new period of socialist development. In practice, through continuous summarization of experience and theoretical exploration, we have gradually gained a clearer understanding of "what is socialism, and how to build socialism," gradually forming Deng Xiaoping Theory.
Since the Fourth Plenary Session of the Thirteenth Central Committee, the Chinese Communist Party, represented mainly by Jiang Zemin, has upheld the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, adhered to reform and opening up, kept pace with the times, successfully pushed forward the cause of socialist modernization with Chinese characteristics into the 21st century, and deepened their understanding of "what is socialism, how to build socialism" and "what kind of party to build, and how to build the party" in the practice of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, forming the important thought of "Three Represents," thus enriching and developing the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
Since the Sixteenth National Congress, the Party Central Committee, with Hu Jintao as its General Secretary, based on new development requirements and the basic national conditions of the primary stage of socialism, has continuously summed up China's development experience and drawn on foreign development experience, initially answered major theoretical and practical questions such as "what kind of development to achieve and how to promote development," and put forward a series of strategic thoughts such as the Scientific Outlook on Development. The Scientific Outlook on Development is the inheritance and development of the important thoughts on development by the three generations of the Party's Central Collective Leadership, the concentrated embodiment of the Marxist worldview and methodology on development, and a scientific theory that inherits and advances the Marxist-Leninist, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the important thought of "Three Represents." It is an important guiding principle for the economic and social development of our country and a major strategic thought that must be adhered to and implemented to develop socialism with Chinese characteristics.
Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of "Three Represents" were written into the Party Constitution at the Fifteenth and Sixteenth National Congresses, and established as the Party's guiding ideology. The Seventeenth National Congress unanimously agreed to include the Scientific Outlook on Development in the Party Constitution.
The theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics adheres to and develops Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and embodies the wisdom and efforts of several generations of Chinese Communists in leading the people's tireless exploration. It is the latest achievement in sinicizing Marxism, the most valuable political and spiritual wealth of the Party, and the common ideological foundation for the unity and struggle of people of all ethnic groups in the country. The theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics is an open and developing theoretical system. The practice of nearly 160 years since the publication of the "Communist Manifesto" has proven that Marxism can only flourish with the combination of the national conditions, the progress of the times, and the common destiny with the people. In contemporary China, adhering to the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics means truly upholding Marxism.
II. The new requirements of achieving the goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects and the overall layout of the "Four Comprehensives"
Adhering to the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics, from a practical perspective, means adapting to the new changes in the domestic and international situation, meeting the new expectations of all ethnic groups for a better life, and deeply implementing and striving to achieve the new requirements of the goal of building a moderately prosperous society as proposed at the 17th National Congress.
1. New requirements for achieving the goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects
We have taken solid steps towards the goal of building a moderately prosperous society set at the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China. In the future, we must continue to strive and ensure the achievement of the goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects by 2020. In this regard, the 17th National Congress of the Party has further put forward the following new requirements:
(1) Enhance development coordination and strive to achieve good and fast economic development. Significant progress has been made in transforming the development mode. Based on optimizing the structure, improving efficiency, reducing consumption, and protecting the environment, we aim to double per capita GDP by 2020 compared to the year 2000. The socialist market economy system is more perfected. The ability of independent innovation has significantly improved, and the contribution rate of technological progress to economic growth has greatly increased, making China an innovative country. The consumption rate of residents steadily improves, forming a growth pattern driven by coordinated consumption, investment, and exports. Mechanisms and layouts for coordinated and interactive development between urban and rural areas and regions have basically formed. Significant progress has been made in the construction of new socialist countryside. The urban population proportion has clearly increased.
(2) Expand socialist democracy and better safeguard people's rights and social fairness and justice. Citizen political participation is orderly expanding. The basic strategy of ruling the country by law is being further implemented, and the legal concept of the whole society has been further enhanced, achieving new results in building a law-based government. The grassroots democratic system is more perfected. The government's ability to provide basic public services has significantly enhanced.
(3) Strengthen cultural construction and significantly improve the overall cultural quality of the whole nation. The socialist core values have deeply penetrated into people's hearts, and positive cultural and moral trends have been further promoted. A public cultural service system covering the whole society has been basically established, with the proportion of the cultural industry in the national economy significantly increased and the international competitiveness significantly strengthened, providing richer cultural products that meet the needs of the people.
(4) Accelerate the development of social undertakings and comprehensively improve people's lives. The modern national education system is more perfected, and the lifelong education system has basically formed. The education level of the entire population and the level of training innovative talents have significantly improved. Social employment is more full. A social security system covering urban and rural residents has been basically established, and everyone enjoys basic livelihood security. A rational and orderly income distribution pattern has basically formed, with the majority being middle-income earners and the eradication of absolute poverty. Everyone has access to basic medical and health services. The social governance system is more sound.
(5) Building an ecological civilization, which significantly promotes energy-saving, resource-conserving, and environmentally-friendly industrial structure, growth mode, and consumption pattern. A large-scale circular economy is established, and the proportion of renewable energy significantly increases. Major pollutant emissions are effectively controlled, and the ecological environment quality is noticeably improved. The concept of ecological civilization is firmly established in society as a whole.
By the time the goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects is achieved by 2020, our historically profound ancient civilization and socialist developing country will become a nation where industrialization is basically realized, comprehensive national strength is significantly enhanced, and the overall scale of the domestic market ranks among the forefront of the world. It will become a country where people's affluence is universally improved, living standards are noticeably enhanced, and the ecological environment is good. It will become a country where people enjoy more full democratic rights, possess higher levels of civilization and spiritual pursuits. It will become a country with more perfect institutions, a more vibrant and stable society; a country that is more open, more friendly, and makes greater contributions to human civilization.
To implement the above new requirements for building a moderately prosperous society in all respects, all Party comrades must "fully grasp the scientific connotation and spiritual essence of the Scientific Outlook on Development, enhance their consciousness and determination to implement the Scientific Outlook on Development, focus on transforming ideological concepts that are not in line with the Scientific Outlook on Development, focus on addressing prominent problems that affect and restrict scientific development, guide the enthusiasm of the whole society towards scientific development, and implement the Scientific Outlook on Development in all aspects of economic and social development."
To thoroughly implement the new requirements for building a moderately prosperous society in all respects, an important task is to actively construct a socialist harmonious society. This is because scientific development and social harmony are inherently unified. Without scientific development, social harmony cannot be achieved, and without social harmony, scientific development is difficult to attain. Therefore, to implement the new requirements for building a moderately prosperous society in all respects, it is necessary to always prioritize the construction of a socialist harmonious society.
2. Making efforts to construct a socialist harmonious society
Constructing a socialist harmonious society is a major strategic decision made by our Party based on the basic principles of Marxism and the practical experience of socialist construction in our country. It is also a significant achievement attained by our Party through the guidance of developing Marxism and applying it to new social practices in the new century and new stage of our country's economic and social development.
(1) The proposal of the idea of building a socialist harmonious society
A socialist harmonious society is the goal of our Party's unremitting struggle and the common social ideal of the people of all ethnic groups in our country. After the establishment of New China, we established a socialist system in which the people are the masters of the country, thereby eliminating the institutional roots that caused social contradictions and disharmony. This has opened up a broad path for building a harmonious society. However, due to the need for a process of understanding the laws of socialist construction, we have made mistakes in understanding what socialism is and how to build socialism. We even experienced a severe and long-lasting mistake like the "Cultural Revolution". After the Third Plenum of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Party, our party decisively abandoned the guideline of "taking class struggle as the key link" and shifted the focus of the party and the state's work to socialist modernization, insisting on economic development as the central task and firmly promoting reform and opening up. We actively promote economic development and social progress, effectively promoting the construction of a harmonious society.
Over the years, through the joint efforts of our party and the people, our society has generally achieved a state of harmony. However, there are still many contradictions and issues that affect social harmony, mainly including: imbalances in urban-rural and regional economic and social development, increased population, resource and environmental pressures; prominent issues concerning the vital interests of the people in employment, social security, income distribution, education, healthcare, housing, production safety, and social stability; incomplete systems and mechanisms, inadequate democracy and rule of law; lack of integrity and moral decline among certain members of society, inadequate qualifications, abilities, and work style of some leading cadres to adapt to the new situation and tasks; corruption is still relatively serious in some fields; hostile forces' infiltration and sabotage activities endanger national security and social stability. The existence of these contradictions and issues shows that the task of building a harmonious socialist society in our country is still quite challenging. In the face of this challenging historical task, the 16th National Congress of the Party put forward "making society more harmonious" as one of the goals of building a well-off society in an all-around manner.
(2) Further systematic and theoretical development of the ideology of building a harmonious society
Since the 16th National Congress of the Party, our party's understanding of social harmony has deepened, and the position of building a socialist harmonious society in the overall layout of socialism with Chinese characteristics has become increasingly clear.
In November 2002, the 16th National Congress of the Party proposed the "six more" goals for building a well-off society in an all-around manner, one of which is "making society more harmonious". In September 2004, the Fourth Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) reviewed and approved the "Decision on Strengthening the Party's Governance Capability", which put forward the proposition of building a harmonious society and made continuous improvement of the ability to build a harmonious society one of the main tasks of strengthening the party's governance capability.
On February 19, 2005, Hu Jintao summarized the basic characteristics of a socialist harmonious society at a special seminar for senior officials at the provincial and ministerial levels on "enhancing the capability to build a socialist harmonious society". He pointed out: the socialist harmonious society we aim to build should be a society with democracy and the rule of law, fairness and justice, integrity and friendliness, full of vitality, stability and order, and harmonious coexistence between human and nature. Democracy and the rule of law mean fully promoting socialist democracy, implementing the basic strategy of ruling the country by law, and mobilizing positive factors in all aspects; fairness and justice mean properly coordinating the interests of various sectors of society, handling internal contradictions among the people and other social conflicts correctly, and effectively safeguarding and realizing social fairness and justice; integrity and friendliness mean mutual help and trustworthiness throughout society, equal friendship and harmony among all the people; full of vitality means respecting the desire for social progress, supporting creative activities, giving play to creative talents, and affirming creative achievements that benefit social progress; stability and order mean sound social organization and mechanisms, improved social management, good social order, people's well-being and stability; harmonious coexistence between human and nature means development, prosperity, and good ecological environment. Hu Jintao also emphasized that building a socialist harmonious society is organically integrated with the construction of material civilization, political civilization, and spiritual civilization in socialism. They have inseparable and close connections, as well as their own special fields and laws. Building socialist material civilization, political civilization, and spiritual civilization can provide a solid foundation for constructing a socialist harmonious society. Building a socialist harmonious society can also provide important conditions for the construction of socialist material civilization, political civilization, and spiritual civilization.
In October 2006, the 6th Plenary Session of the 16th Party Congress made the decision on several major issues concerning the construction of a socialist harmonious society (referred to as the "Decision"), which formed the guiding document for the construction of a socialist harmonious society. Starting from the importance and urgency of constructing a socialist harmonious society, the "Decision" first clarifies the nature and positioning of a socialist harmonious society. The socialist harmonious society we are building is not the "Great Harmony" imagined by some philosophers in our country's history, nor is it the "Utopia" portrayed by utopian socialists. Instead, it is a combination of Marxist ideas about social harmony and the actual conditions in contemporary China. The "Decision" points out that the socialist harmonious society we want to build is a society that is led by the Communist Party of China and enjoyed by the entire people, constructed on the socialist path with Chinese characteristics. This clarifies the leadership core, development path, main practices, and fundamental purpose of building a socialist harmonious society.
To construct a socialist harmonious society, it is necessary to have correct guiding ideologies. The "Decision" emphasizes the need to adhere to the guidance of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the important thought of the "Three Represents." It also stresses the need to adhere to the Party's basic line, basic principles, and basic experiences, to be guided by the scientific outlook on development in overall economic and social development, and to follow the general requirements of democracy and the rule of law, fairness and justice, integrity and friendship, vitality and stability, and harmonious coexistence between man and nature. The focus should be on addressing the most pressing, direct, and realistic interests of the people, focusing on the development of social undertakings, promoting social fairness and justice, building a harmonious culture, improving social management, enhancing social creativity, and following the path of common prosperity. This will promote the coordinated development of social construction and economic construction, political construction, and cultural construction.
(3) The goals, main tasks, and basic principles of constructing a socialist harmonious society
In accordance with the goal of building a well-off society in an all-round way established at the 16th Party Congress, and based on the general requirements for constructing a socialist harmonious society, the "Decision" puts forward the goals and main tasks of building a socialist harmonious society by 2020. These include improving the socialist democratic legal system, fully implementing the basic strategy of governing the country by law, and effectively respecting and guaranteeing people's rights and interests; gradually reversing the trend of widening gaps in urban-rural and regional development, forming a reasonable and orderly income distribution pattern, increasing household wealth, and improving people's living standards; achieving relatively sufficient employment and establishing a basic social security system covering urban and rural residents; strengthening the basic public service system, significantly improving government management and service levels; significantly improving the overall quality of the nation's ethical, scientific, and cultural qualities and health; further fostering good moral standards and harmonious interpersonal relationships throughout society; significantly enhancing the creativity of the whole society and establishing an innovative country; improving the social management system and maintaining good social order; significantly improving resource utilization efficiency, and obviously improving the ecological environment; striving to achieve the goal of building a well-off society that benefits over a billion people at a higher level, and working towards a situation where all people can give full play to their abilities, receive due rewards, and live in harmony. 
To construct a socialist harmonious society, it is necessary to follow the correct principles. The "Decision" puts forward the "six must adhere to" principles: (1) adhere to people-centered development; (2) adhere to scientific development; (3) adhere to reform and opening-up; (4) adhere to democratic rule of law; (5) adhere to correctly handle the relationships between reform, development, stability; and (6) adhere to the joint construction of the whole society under the leadership of the Party.
3. Preliminary clarification of the overall layout ideas for socialist construction
The proposal of the strategic tasks for building a socialist harmonious society has made the overall layout of China's socialist cause more clearly structured, evolving from the development of the socialist economy, political construction, and cultural construction, to the development of socialist economy, political construction, cultural construction, and social construction, forming a four-pronged structure. Taken together, it is not difficult to see that: regarding the construction of socialist politics, the main focus is on solving the basic political structure of Chinese socialism, continuously improving the socialist political system, and gradually embodying scientific, rational, and effective political governance; regarding the construction of socialist economics, the main focus is on gradually establishing the basic economic system of socialism, in order to solve the problems of driving force and efficiency in the development of socialist society, thus laying a solid material foundation for the consolidation of socialism; regarding the construction of socialist culture, the main focus is on forming the core values and healthy and progressive humanistic concepts of socialism, constructing a scientific and advanced socialist ideological theory and social cultural atmosphere, in order to create a good humanistic environment for the better development of socialism; the construction of a socialist harmonious society is aimed at better addressing the overall layout of socialist modernization, while promoting political development, economic development, and cultural development, with a focus on solving the historical issue of social progress. The introduction of the Four-Pronged Comprehensive Development layout further enriches the theory of Chinese socialism in terms of social dynamics, social development, and social progress, becoming an inherent part of the cause of Chinese socialism and clarifying the social values and development goals of socialism. It not only innovates the balance mechanism of socialist society but also develops the driving mechanism of socialist society. Therefore, the introduction of this ideology not only highlights the tasks of social construction, makes the overall layout of socialist modernization in China more rational, but also makes the development model of Chinese socialism clearer.
The strategic concept of constructing a socialist harmonious society conforms to the basic principles of Marxism and the scientific vision of Marxist socialist society, marking a new advancement of our party in the theoretical and practical aspects of socialist social construction. It is not only a summary of the party's governing experience, but also a reference to the governing experience and lessons of some ruling parties abroad; it deepens our understanding of the law of socialist construction in China, as well as the law of the Communist Party's governance, the law of socialist construction, and the law of human social development; it enriches and develops the theory of Chinese socialism with distinctive features and enriches and develops the theory of socialist construction in Marxism.
III. Deepen the new deployment of administrative system reform and rural reform
From February 25th to 27th, 2008, the Second Plenary Session of the 17th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing. The plenary session reviewed and approved the "Opinions on Deepening the Reform of the Administrative Management System" and the "Plan for the Reform of the State Council Institutions" proposed on the basis of extensive consultations, and agreed to submit the "Plan for the Reform of the State Council Institutions" to the First Session of the 11th National People's Congress for deliberation.
1. Opinions on Deepening the Reform of the Administrative Management System
The Central Committee of the Party and the State Council have always attached great importance to the reform of the administrative management system. Since the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, especially since the reform and opening up, the reform of the administrative management system has been continuously promoted, the construction of the government itself has been strengthened, and remarkable achievements have been made. Overall, China's administrative management system basically meets the requirements of economic and social development and effectively guarantees the development of the cause of reform and opening up and socialist modernization. However, in the face of new situations, new tasks, and new requirements for the administrative management system, the existing system still has some aspects that are not adapted: the transformation of government functions is not yet in place, there is excessive intervention in the microeconomic operation, and social management and public services are still relatively weak; there are still prominent problems such as cross-cutting of departmental responsibilities, disjointed rights and responsibilities, and low efficiency; the government's organizational structure is not entirely reasonable, and the administrative operation and management system is not sound enough; the supervision and restraint mechanism for administrative power is not yet perfect, and phenomena such as abuse of power, pursuit of personal gain, and corruption still exist. These problems directly affect the government's comprehensive and correct performance of its functions and to some extent restrict economic and social development. It is imperative to deepen the reform of the administrative management system.
(1) The goal and requirements of deepening the reform of the administrative management system. Regarding the overall goals of deepening the reform of the administrative management system, the "Opinions on Deepening the Reform of the Administrative Management System" explicitly states: by 2020, a relatively sound socialist administrative management system with Chinese characteristics should be established... Through reforms, the fundamental transformation of government functions is realized, shifting towards creating a favorable development environment, providing high-quality public services, and maintaining social fairness and justice. It aims to achieve the fundamental transformation of government organization and personnel establishment towards scientification, standardization, and legalization. It also aims to achieve the fundamental transformation of administrative operation mechanisms and government management methods towards standardization, transparency, convenience, and efficiency, with the goal of constructing a government that satisfies the people.
(2) The core of deepening the reform of the administrative management system is to accelerate the transformation of government functions. The functions of government departments should be defined reasonably, and departmental responsibilities should be clarified to ensure consistency between power and responsibility. The division of responsibilities among departments should be rationalized, with one department primarily responsible for each matter, and if multiple departments are needed, the leading department should be identified to differentiate primary and secondary responsibilities. Mechanisms for coordination and cooperation between departments should be strengthened. Efforts should be made to accelerate the separation of government and enterprises, government and capital, government and intermediary organizations in the market, transferring matters that should not be managed by the government, and effectively managing matters that should be. This is to better leverage the fundamental role of the market in resource allocation and enhance the role of citizens and social organizations in the management of social public affairs, thus providing public goods more effectively.
(3) Explorations into departmental reform and the improvement of administrative operation mechanisms should be carried out. The reform of government institutions should primarily adhere to the principles of streamlining, unification, and effectiveness, ensuring mutual constraints and coordination among decision-making power, executive power, and supervisory power. Focusing on the transformation of functions and the rationalization of responsibilities, further optimization of government organizational structure and standardization of institutions should be conducted, and the establishment of a large department system with organic unification of functions should be explored. The administrative operation mechanisms should be improved as well.
(4) Strengthening the administration according to law and system construction is essential. Strict adherence to the rule of law in administration should be enforced. The exercise of power, handling of affairs, and managing of personnel should be carried out through institutional means. A sound supervisory mechanism should be established, and accountability should be strengthened. The principle of "power comes with responsibility," "supervision accompanies power exercise," and "violations shall be pursued" should be effectively implemented. Efforts should be made to expedite the construction of a rule of law government, implement government performance management and administrative accountability systems, and improve the supervision system for administrative power. The construction of the civil service team should also be strengthened.
2. State Council's Institutional Reform Plan
Based on the spirit of the 17th National Congress and the 2nd Plenary Session of the 17th Central Committee, the main task of this round of State Council institutional reform is to focus on the transformation of government functions and the rationalization of departmental responsibilities. It aims to explore the establishment of a large department system with organic unification of functions, allocate macro-control department functions reasonably, strengthen energy and environmental management institutions, integrate and improve the industrial and informatization, transportation management systems, and prioritize improving people's livelihood. It also aims to strengthen and integrate social management and public service departments.
(1) Rational allocation of macro-control department functions is important. The National Development and Reform Commission should further transform its functions, reduce micromanagement and specific approval matters, and focus on macro-control. The Ministry of Finance should reform and improve budget and tax administration, establish a financial system that matches central and local fiscal powers and responsibilities, and improve the public finance system. The People's Bank of China should further improve the monetary policy system, coordinate and coordinate with financial regulatory departments, and safeguard national financial security. The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Finance, the People's Bank of China, and other departments should establish a sound coordination mechanism to create a more complete macro-control system.
(2) Strengthening energy management institutions. Establish a high-level coordinating body, the National Energy Commission. Establish the National Energy Administration, to be managed by the National Development and Reform Commission. Integrate the energy industry management responsibilities and institutions of the National Development and Reform Commission, the responsibilities of the office of the National Energy Leading Group, and the nuclear power management responsibilities of the National Defense Science and Technology Industry Committee into the National Energy Administration. The work of the office of the National Energy Commission will be undertaken by the National Energy Administration. The National Energy Leading Group and its institutions will no longer be retained.
(3) Establish the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology. Integrate the industrial sector management responsibilities of the National Development and Reform Commission, the responsibilities other than nuclear power management of the National Defense Science and Technology Industry Committee, the responsibilities of the Ministry of Information Industry, and the responsibilities of the State Council Informationization Work Office into the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology. Establish the National Defense Science and Technology Industry Bureau, to be managed by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology. The State Tobacco Monopoly Administration will be managed by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology. The National Defense Science and Technology Industry Committee, the Ministry of Information Industry, and the State Council Informationization Work Office will no longer be retained.
(4) Establish the Ministry of Transport. Integrate the responsibilities of the Ministry of Transport, the Civil Aviation Administration of China, the urban passenger transport responsibilities guided by the Ministry of Construction, into the Ministry of Transport. Establish the Civil Aviation Administration of China, to be managed by the Ministry of Transport. The State Postal Administration will be managed by the Ministry of Transport. The Ministry of Railways will be retained to continue reforms. The Ministry of Transport and the Civil Aviation Administration of China will no longer be retained.
(5) Establish the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security. Integrate the responsibilities of the Ministry of Personnel, the Ministry of Labor and Social Security into the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security. Establish the National Civil Service Bureau, to be managed by the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security. The Ministry of Personnel and the Ministry of Labor and Social Security will no longer be retained.
(6) Establish the Ministry of Environmental Protection. The National Environmental Protection Administration will no longer be retained.
(7) The Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development will be established. The Ministry of Construction will no longer be retained.
(8) The State Food and Drug Administration will be managed by the Ministry of Health. The Ministry of Health will be responsible for comprehensive coordination of food safety and organizing investigations into major food safety incidents.
3. Five major changes in the administrative management system
The reform of China's administrative management system, as an important part of national reform, will bring about five changes.
First, there is a change in the government's management philosophy, with administrative principles shifting towards a scientific approach. There is a further shift from the management principles of a planned economy to those of a socialist market economy. The change in principles is specifically reflected in: changing the notion that state-owned economy is the sole form of socialism and its essential attribute, with the government shifting from solely serving the state-owned economy to serving all economic components that contribute to the development of productive forces; changing the notion that development is purely economic development, with the government shifting from focusing on achieving high growth rates to promoting the improvement of economic quality, efficiency, and the comprehensive coordinated development of the economy and society. This change has led to a series of adjustments and reforms in the system and policies.
Second, there is a change in the scope of management, with government functions gradually becoming more rationalized. Through the separation of government and enterprises, reforms in the management of state-owned assets, and adjustments in the layout of the state-owned economy, the government has shifted from comprehensive management to primarily engaging in economic regulation, market supervision, social management, and public services; it has moved from directly engaging in and intervening in economic activities to effectively implementing macroeconomic regulation and creating a market environment; and it has shifted from pursuing purely high economic growth to promoting a combination of speed, quality, structure, and efficiency in order to drive coordinated development of the economy and society and achieve harmony between humans and nature.
Third, there is a change in administrative methods, with continuous improvement in management approaches. The reform of the administrative approval system has been promoted, resulting in significant reductions in the number of approval matters at the central and provincial levels. New approval methods, such as approval and registration, have been adopted to standardize and simplify approval procedures, and "one-stop" approval services and online approvals have been provided.
The fourth change is the transformation of the administrative foundation, with government actions becoming increasingly standardized. Since the reform and opening up, there have been six government institutional reforms of varying intensities, strengthening institutions involved in economic regulation, supervision, and social management services. This has reduced the overlapping responsibilities between departments, streamlined the number of government personnel, and promoted the transformation of government functions and the improvement of efficiency.
The fifth change is the improvement of the qualities of officials, with enhanced administrative capabilities. The establishment of a strict selection and recruitment mechanism for administrative personnel or civil servants requires all staff entering state administrative agencies to pass an examination. A scientific mechanism for selecting and appointing leading cadres has been established, promoting systems such as open selection and competitive appointment. The "Civil Servant Law of the People's Republic of China" promulgated in 2005 has become an important milestone in the institutionalization of civil servant construction and management.
4. Deployment of deepening rural reforms:
From October 9th to 12th, 2008, the Third Plenary Session of the 17th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing. Starting from the new requirements proposed by the 17th National Congress of the Communist Party of China for achieving the goal of comprehensive construction of a well-off society, the plenary session made comprehensive arrangements for further deepening rural reforms.
(1) Objectives and tasks of deepening rural reforms: According to the new requirements and demands of achieving the goal of comprehensive construction of a well-off society and building a socialist new countryside with thriving production, affluent living standards, civilized rural customs, clean village environments, and democratic management, by 2020, the basic objectives and tasks of rural reform and development are as follows: a more sound rural economic system, the establishment of a unified urban-rural economic and social development system; significant progress in modern agriculture construction, a noticeable improvement in comprehensive agricultural production capacity, effective guarantee of national food security and major agricultural product supply; doubling the per capita net income of farmers compared to 2008, a substantial increase in the consumption level, and the basic elimination of absolute poverty; further strengthening the construction of grassroots rural organizations, improvement of the system of villager autonomy, and effective safeguarding of the democratic rights of farmers; significant progress in the equalization of basic public services between urban and rural areas, further prosperity of rural culture, better implementation of the basic cultural rights and interests of farmers, ensuring that everyone in rural areas has the opportunity to receive good education, a more sound system for basic rural livelihood and basic healthcare, and further improvement of the rural social management system; the formation of a resource-saving and environmentally friendly agricultural production system, obvious improvements in rural living conditions and ecological environment, and continuous enhancement of sustainable development capabilities.
(2) Major principles to be followed in deepening rural reforms: In order to achieve the basic objectives and tasks of rural reform and development by 2020, the following major principles must be followed.
First, we must adhere to the principle of self-sufficiency in grain production based on the domestic market, increase the support and protection for agriculture, implement the strategy of promoting agriculture through science and education, accelerate the construction of modern agriculture, achieve comprehensive and stable development of agriculture, and lay a solid foundation for promoting economic development, promoting social harmony, and safeguarding national security.
Second, we must effectively safeguard the rights and interests of farmers, always take the realization, maintenance, and development of the fundamental interests of farmers as the starting point and foothold for all work in rural areas. We must adhere to a people-centered approach, respect the will of the farmers, focus on solving the issues that farmers are most concerned about, most directly related to, and most practical, safeguard the political, economic, cultural, and social rights and interests of farmers, improve the comprehensive quality of farmers, promote the comprehensive development of farmers, give full play to the role of farmers as the main body and their pioneering spirit, and rely closely on hundreds of millions of farmers to build a new socialist countryside.
Third, we must continuously liberate and develop rural productive forces, always taking reform and innovation as the fundamental driving force for rural development. We must continue to promote rural reform and institutional innovation, improve the scientificity of reform decision-making, enhance the coordination of reform measures, give full play to the fundamental role of the market in resource allocation, strengthen and improve the regulation and guidance of the state on agricultural and rural development, improve the rural economic system that meets the requirements of a socialist market economy, adjust the production relations and superstructure that are not conducive to the development of rural productive forces, and make rural economic and social development vibrant.
Fourth, we must coordinate the economic and social development between urban and rural areas, always taking the construction of a new type of rural-urban relationship as a major strategic goal to accelerate modernization. We must coordinate industrialization, urbanization, and agricultural modernization, accelerate the establishment of a long-term mechanism that promotes agriculture through industry and drives rural areas with cities, adjust the pattern of national income distribution, consolidate and improve policies that benefit agriculture and farmers, focus on national infrastructure construction and social development in rural areas, promote equalization of basic public services between urban and rural areas, achieve coordinated development between urban and rural areas and regions, and ensure that the majority of farmers participate in the modernization process on an equal footing and share the fruits of reform and development.
Fifth, we must adhere to the Party's leadership over rural work, always taking strengthening and improving the Party's leadership over rural work as a political guarantee for promoting rural reform and development. We must base our work on reality, adhere to the Party's basic policies in rural areas, strengthen the construction of grassroots organizations and grassroots political power in rural areas, improve the institutional mechanisms and methods for the Party to manage rural work, maintain the close bond between the Party and the rural masses, consolidate the Party's ruling foundation in rural areas, and form a strong synergy for promoting rural reform and development.
(3) A comprehensive deployment of rural institutional construction and innovation is made. Institutional construction is fundamental, strategic, and long-term. The plenary session accurately grasps the basic national conditions of the primary stage of socialism in our country and the stage characteristics of current development, closely focuses on the major issues in rural reform and development, seizes the important areas and key links of rural institutional reform, and focuses on the six major areas of institutional construction: stabilizing and improving the basic rural operating system; improving a strict and standardized rural land management system; improving the agricultural support and protection system; establishing a modern rural financial system; establishing a system to promote the integration of urban and rural economic and social development; and improving the rural democratic management system.
The Third Plenary Session of the 17th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China set forth a series of new arrangements for deepening rural reform and development, including the goals, tasks, major principles, and institutional construction of rural reform, as well as actively developing modern agriculture and improving the comprehensive production capacity of agriculture. It also emphasized the need to accelerate the development of rural public services and promote comprehensive social progress in rural areas. Strengthening and improving the Party's leadership, providing a strong political guarantee for advancing rural reform and development, and providing a general mindset for further deepening rural reform. This is an important strategic step for achieving the strategic goals of rural development and promoting the development of Chinese characteristics in modern agriculture. It has significant and far-reaching implications for accelerating the promotion of socialist new rural construction and promoting the coordinated development of urban and rural areas.
IV. Summary of 30 years of reform and opening up and deep implementation of the scientific outlook on development
Just when the Party Central Committee, led by General Secretary Hu Jintao, was leading the whole Party and the people of the nation in their efforts to build a moderately prosperous society in all respects, China ushered in the 30th anniversary of reform and opening up. Over the past 30 years, the Party has always taken reform and opening up as a powerful driving force. Building on the foundation laid in the 29 years since the founding of New China, it has opened up the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics and has achieved remarkable accomplishments in various undertakings.
On December 18, 2008, General Secretary Hu Jintao, on behalf of the Party Central Committee, made a scientific summary of the achievements and basic experiences of the past 30 years of reform and opening up. The achievements of these 30 years can be summed up as follows: actively promoting various institutional reforms and successfully achieving a historical transition from a highly centralized planned economic system to a vibrant socialist market economy system; continuously expanding opening-up and successfully achieving a historical transition from closed or semi-closed to all-round opening-up; insisting on economic construction as the center and comprehensively raising national strength to a new level; focusing on guaranteeing and improving people's well-being, with overall improvement of people's lives reaching a moderately prosperous level; vigorously developing socialist democracy, better safeguarding the people's right to be masters of their own country; vigorously developing advanced socialist culture, better satisfying the growing spiritual and cultural needs of the people; vigorously developing social undertakings, consolidating and developing social harmony and stability; adhering to the Party's absolute leadership over the military, and making significant achievements in national defense and military construction; successfully implementing the basic principle of "One Country, Two Systems" and taking a major step forward in peaceful reunification of the motherland; persisting in pursuing an independent foreign policy of peace and making significant achievements in all-round diplomacy; persisting in the Party's self-governance, and significantly improving the Party's leadership level and governance capacity, in resisting corruption and preventing changes and in resisting risks.
Thirty years of practice have fully demonstrated that through the baptism of this great revolution of reform and opening up, the Chinese nation has caught up with the trend of the times, and socialist China stands proudly in the East of the world. The Communist Party of China stands at the forefront of the times.
Over the past 30 years, the fundamental reason why our country has achieved such splendid achievements and historic progress lies in integrating the basic principles of Marxism with China's specific realities, charting its own course, and building socialism with Chinese characteristics. Through creative practice over the past 30 years of reform and opening up, valuable experience has been accumulated. This is expounded in the 17th National Congress of the Party with the "Ten Combinations":
First, combining adherence to the basic principles of Marxism with promoting the sinification of Marxism. It is necessary to adhere to the basic principles of Marxism, and promote the sinification of Marxism in accordance with the practice and development of contemporary China, so as to better guide the development of socialism with Chinese characteristics and inject vitality into contemporary Chinese Marxism.
Second, combine the adherence to the Four Cardinal Principles with the promotion of reform and opening up. This means not only ensuring that reform and opening up are guided by the Four Cardinal Principles, but also giving the Four Cardinal Principles new significance in the context of reform and opening up. It requires providing education and guidance to the entire Party and all ethnic groups in China to deeply understand the dialectical relationship and important significance of adhering to the Four Cardinal Principles and promoting reform and opening up. It also means integrating the focus on economic development with the adherence to the Four Cardinal Principles and the promotion of reform and opening up, in order to unite the two basic points of putting economic construction at the center and practicing socialism with Chinese characteristics.
Third, combine the respect for the creative spirit of the people with the strengthening and improvement of Party leadership. This means not only adhering to the scientific principle of Marxist theory that the people create history, but also sincerely representing the fundamental interests of the broadest masses of the Chinese people and relying closely on the people. It requires mobilizing the enthusiasm, initiative, and creativity of the people to the greatest extent possible, uniting strength and drawing wisdom from the people, continuously strengthening and improving Party leadership, and gaining the full trust and support of the people to fulfill its role as the core leadership.
Fourth, combine the adherence to the basic socialist system with the development of a market economy. This means continuing to adhere to the basic socialist system in the face of profound and extensive changes, while also developing a market economy under socialist conditions. It requires following the requirements of economic activities in accordance with the law of value, continuously liberating and developing productive forces, enhancing overall national strength, improving people's living standards, and better realizing the central task of economic construction.
Fifth, combine the promotion of changes in the economic foundation with the reform of the superstructure. This means actively promoting both economic system reform and political system reform, developing socialist democracy, constructing a socialist rule of law country, ensuring that the people are the masters of the country, continuously promoting the organic integration of the socialist superstructure with the economic foundation, and providing institutional guarantees and legal guarantees for reform, opening up, and socialist modernization construction.
Sixth, combine the development of social productive forces with the improvement of the overall cultural quality of the people. This means attaching importance to both material development, namely the development of social productive forces, and the development of people, namely the improvement of the overall cultural quality of all ethnic groups. It requires grasping both material civilization and spiritual civilization, vigorously developing socialist culture, constructing socialist spiritual civilization, vigorously cultivating citizens with ideals, morals, culture, and discipline, and providing powerful spiritual motivation and intellectual support for economic and social development.
Seventh, combine the improvement of efficiency with the promotion of social fairness. This means attaching great importance to promoting development through improving efficiency, and also attaching great importance to promoting social harmony through achieving social fairness on the basis of economic development. It requires putting people first, focusing on solving issues that are most concerning, most direct, and most immediate to the people, vigorously developing social undertakings, improving the income distribution system, ensuring and improving people's livelihood, and pursuing the path of common prosperity, and striving to create a situation where all the people can fully exert their abilities, obtain what they deserve, and live in harmony.
Eighth, combine the adherence to independence and self-reliance with participation in economic globalization. This means highly cherishing and firmly safeguarding the right to independence and self-reliance that the Chinese people have obtained through years of struggle, while also adhering to the basic national policy of opening up, always examining the development of China and the world from the perspective of the interrelationship between the international situation and the domestic situation, reflecting on and formulating China's development strategy, adhering to an independent foreign policy of peace, adhering to the path of peaceful development, adhering to an open strategy of mutual benefit and win-win cooperation, and promoting the building of a harmonious world of lasting peace and common prosperity.
Ninth, combine the promotion of reform and development with the maintenance of social stability. This means vigorously promoting reform and development, while correctly handling the relationship between reform, development, and stability, and adhering to the principles that reform is the driving force, development is the goal, and stability is the prerequisite. It requires coordinating the intensity of reform, the speed of development, and the capacity of society to bear, and taking the improvement of people's lives as an important link in dealing with the relationship between reform, development, and stability, promoting reform and development through social stability, and promoting social stability through reform and development.
The "Ten Combinations" combines the promotion of the great cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics with the promotion of the new great project of party building. It focuses on promoting the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics by strengthening and improving party building. It continuously improves the party's governance capacity, maintains and develops the party's advanced nature, continuously enhances the party's class and mass foundation, continuously improves its ability to resist corruption and risks, and ensures that the party always remains a strong leadership core for the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
These "Ten Combinations" are a new summary that is full of the spirit of the times. In summary, it creatively explores and answers major theoretical and practical questions such as what is Marxism and how to treat Marxism, what is socialism and how to build socialism, what kind of party to build and how to build it, what kind of development to achieve and how to achieve it. One important feature is the "combination" concept that reflects the second historic leap, combining the basic principles of Marxism with the practice and characteristics of contemporary China. The "Ten Combinations" are precious experiences for a large country like China with a population of over a billion, to overcome poverty, accelerate modernization, and consolidate and develop socialism. They are also valuable spiritual wealth accumulated by the Party and the people through long-term practice and arduous exploration. Hu Jintao's historic summary of the 30 years of reform and opening up is innovative, profound, rich in content, highly theoretical, strategic, and guiding. It shines with the brilliance of Marxist truth, further enriches the theoretical system of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and serves as a guiding document for the continued advancement of China's great cause of reform and opening up.
By drawing on and adhering to these valuable experiences, we can continuously enrich and develop them in the practice of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. We must adhere to liberating our minds, seeking truth from facts, advancing with the times, daring to reform, daring to innovate, never becoming rigid, never stagnating, fearless of any risks or distractions. The development and innovation of the ideological guidance of the Communist Party of China will achieve even greater achievements.
By summarizing the historical experience since the Communist Party of China came to power and since the reform and opening up, the Communist Party of China has taken a big step forward in the path of Marxist sinicization. On the other hand, the new development of Marxist sinicization also promotes the Communist Party of China to continuously form new understandings of the laws of China's reform and opening up and socialist modernization construction.
New understandings come from new practices. During the "Eleventh Five-Year Plan" period, facing complex domestic and international situations and a series of major risks and challenges, the Communist Party of China has united and led people of all ethnic groups in the country to comprehensively promote reform and opening up and socialist modernization construction, resulting in historic changes in the national landscape. China's productivity and comprehensive national strength have significantly improved, social undertakings have accelerated development, people's lives have improved significantly, reform and opening up has made significant progress, and international status and influence have significantly increased. Major breakthroughs have been made in cutting-edge technologies such as manned spaceflight, lunar exploration projects, and supercomputers, and major achievements have been made in national defense and military modernization. All these achievements have been made under difficult conditions such as the impact of the international financial crisis and frequent natural disasters such as the Wenchuan and Yushu earthquakes and the Zhouqu flash floods and debris flows. Based on the summary of the achievements and experiences mentioned above, in October 2010, the Fifth Plenary Session of the 17th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) passed the "Suggestions on formulating the 12th Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development". It explicitly stated that the guiding ideology for formulating the 12th Five-Year Plan is to hold high the great banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics, guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of "Three Represents", thoroughly implement the Scientific Outlook on Development, adapt to new changes in domestic and international situations, respond to the new expectations of people of all ethnic groups for a better life, take scientific development as the theme, accelerate the transformation of economic development patterns as the main line, deepen reform and opening up, ensure and improve people's well-being, consolidate and expand the achievements in responding to the impact of the international financial crisis, promote long-term, stable and rapid economic development and social harmony and stability, and lay a decisive foundation for the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society. In March 2011, the Fourth Session of the 11th National People's Congress reviewed and approved the "Outline of the 12th Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development of the People's Republic of China". The outline, approved by the Congress, holds high the great banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics, guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of "Three Represents", thoroughly implements the Scientific Outlook on Development, insists on strategic adjustment of economic structure as the main focus of accelerating the transformation of economic development patterns, insists on ensuring and improving people's well-being as the fundamental starting point and foothold for accelerating the transformation of economic development patterns, insists on building a resource-saving and environment-friendly society as the important focus of accelerating the transformation of economic development patterns, and insists on reform and opening up as the powerful driving force for accelerating the transformation of economic development patterns. It has clearly defined the main objectives of China's economic and social development during the 12th Five-Year Plan period and outlined the development blueprint for the next five years. The outline also specifically determines the main objectives of China's economic and social development in the next five years. These objectives not only combine the five-year plan with the ten-year plan, the present with the long-term, but also closely connect with the goal of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society, and comprehensively consider future development trends and conditions.
Looking at the 12th Five-Year Plan, the magnificent blueprint inspires people, and the grand goals drive people forward. The action plan formulated by the CPC Central Committee, with its realistic and inspiring tone, vividly outlines the roadmap for the third five-year plan of the new century, pointing out the direction for China's future development and filling the people of all ethnic groups in the country with hope for socialist China's future.
